column1: In 1963 and 1965, she toured the Soviet Union, appearing at the Kirov and the Bolshoi Theatre.
column2: El 1963 i el 1965 va fer una gira per la Unió Soviètica, presentant-se al Teatre Marïnski i al Teatre Bolxoi .

column1: In 1968, she debuted in the United States.[citation needed]
column2: El 1968 va debutar als Estats Units d'Amèrica.

column1: In parallel to her opera career, she gave many recitals, often with Geza Frid, and also as a soloist.
column2: Paral·lelament a la seva carrera d'òpera, va oferir molts recitals, sovint amb l'acompanyant al piano de Géza Frid, i també com a solista.

column1: In a 1957 recording of Bach's St Matthew Passion with De Nederlandse Bachvereniging, conducted by Anthon van der Horst [Wikidata], she was the soprano soloist.
column2: Va ser la soprano solista a un enregistrament de 1957 de la Passió segons Sant Mateu de Johann Sebastian Bach amb De Nederlandse Bachvereniging, una gravació diriida per Anthon van der Horst.

column1: On 16 April 1970, she made her final appearance at De Nederlandse Opera as Konstanze in Die Entführung aus dem Serail.[citation needed]
column2: El 16 d'abril de 1970 va fer la seva última aparició a De Nederlandse Opera com a Konstanze a Die Entführung aus dem Serail.

column1: In the early 1970s, Spoorenberg was injured in a car accident, in which her rib cage was crushed.
column2: A principis de la dècada de 1970, Spoorenberg va resultar ferida en un accident de trànsit, patint un aixafament de la caixa toràcica.

column1: After six months in hospital, she trained intensively to restore her breathing technique.
column2: Després de sis mesos a l'hospital, es va entrenar intensament per restaurar la seva tècnica respiratòria.

column1: The accident influenced her decision to work closer to home and she became mainly a singing teacher.
column2: L'accident va influir en la seva decisió de treballar més a prop de casa i es va convertir principalment en professora de cant.

column1: From 1970 to 1977, she taught at the Royal Academy in Brussels, and from 1971 to 1988 in the Sweelinck Academy of Music in Amsterdam.
column2: Del 1970 al 1977, va ensenyar a la Royal Academy de Brussel·les i del 1971 al 1988 al Conservatori d'Amsterdam. Després del 1978, va treballar com a professora privada.

column1: After 1978, she worked as a private teacher.[citation needed]
column2: Els últims anys de la seva vida es va estabvlir a Vught, on va morir el 2004 als 78 anys.

column1: A Harriet Cohen International Music Award (year not determined) 2002: Commander of the Order of Orange-Nassau
column2: Premi Internacional de Música Harriet Cohen (any no determinat) 2002: Comandant de l'Orde d'Orange-Nassau

column1: Hamzah Fansuri (Jawi: حمزه فنسوري ; also spelled Hamzah Pansuri, d. c.
column2: Hamzah Fansuri ( Jawi : حمزه فنسوري ; també anomenat Hamzah Pansuri, d. c.

column1: 1590 ?) was a 16th-century Sumatran Sufi writer, and the first writer known to pen mystical panentheistic ideas in the Malay language.
column2: 1590) va ser un escriptor sufí de Sumatra del segle XVI, conegut per escriure idees panentistes místiques en la llengua malaia .

column1: He also wrote poetry in addition to his prose, and he is considered to be the first known poet of the Malay world.
column2: A més d'escriure poesia, també va proliferar en la prosa, considerat el primer poeta conegut del món malai.

column1: He was the first writer to write about Sufi doctrines in the Malay language, or indeed any other languages of the Malay archipelago.[10]
column2: Va ser el primer escriptor que va redactar sobre doctrines sufís en llengua malai, o de fet, en qualsevol altre idioma de l'arxipèlag malai. [1]

column1: Hamzah travelled widely, and was known to have visited the Malay Peninsula, Mughal India, Mecca and Medina, and Baghdad.[1] He was one of the first Southeast Asians to have completed the hajj.[5] The date of his death is generally assumed to be around 1590 or earlier,[3] although a later date during the reign of Sultan Iskandar Muda has also been proposed.[1] However, an inscription on a gravestone found in Mecca for a Shaykh Hamza b.
column2: Hamzah va viatjar molt i va visitar la península Malaya, l'Índia Mughal, la Meca i Medina i Bagdad . [1] Va ser un dels primers asiàtics del sud-est en completar el hajj . [2] La data de la seva mort se suposa al voltant de 1590 o anteriors, [3] encara que també s'ha proposat una data posterior durant el regnat del sultà Iskandar Muda .

column1: Abd Allah al-Fansuri (note that this identification has been challenged) recorded a date of April 11, 1527.[6] Such an early date, if confirmed, may suggest that Hamzah did not live or work in Aceh, rather he was in Barus before leaving for Mecca where he died.[2]
column2: [4] Encara que, s'ha trobat una inscripció en una làpida trobada a la Meca per a un Shaykh Hamza b. Abd Allah al-Fansuri (identificació impugnada) va registrar la data 11 d'abril de 1527. [5] Una data tan primerenca, si es confirma, pot suggerir que Hamzah no vivia ni treballava a Aceh, sinó que era a Barus abans de marxar a la Meca on va morir.

column1: Hamzah Fansuri's panentheism was derived from the writings of the medieval Islamic scholars.
column2: El panenteisme de Hamzah Fansuri es va derivar dels escrits erudits islàmics medievals .

column1: He was influenced by Ibn Arabi's doctrine of Waḥdat al-Wujūd popular in Persia and Mughal India during the 16th century.[1] He perceived God as immanent within all things, including the individual, and sought to unite one's self with the indwelling spirit of God.
column2: Va estar influït per la doctrina d' Ibn Arabi sobre Waḥdat al-Wujūd a Pèrsia i la Índia Mughal durant el segle XVI.

column1: He employed the doctrine of seven stages of emanation (martabat) in which God manifests Himself in this world, ending in the Perfect Man, a doctrine widespread in Indonesia at the time.
column2: [1] A més, va percebre Déu com immanent dins de totes les coses, inclosa les persones, i va intentar unir-se a si mateix amb l'esperit de Déu.

column1: His teachings were promoted by Aceh theologian Shamsuddin al-Sumatrani.
column2: Els seus ensenyaments van ser promoguts pel teòleg Aceh Shamsuddin al-Sumatrani.

column1: However, his views were later deemed heretical by Nuruddin ar-Raniri for not conforming to the Islamic belief that God remained unchanged by His creation.[7] Nuruddin travelled to Aceh and under his influence, the Sultana Taj ul-Alam attempted to eradicate Hamzah's works and name, and his writings were burnt.[2]
column2: No obstant això, més tard les seves opinions van ser considerades herètiques per Nuruddin ar-Raniri per no conformar-se amb la creença islàmica que Déu va romandre inalterat per la seva creació. [1] Nuruddin va viatjar a Aceh i sota la seva influència, el Sultana Taj ul-Alam intentà eradicar les obres i el nom de Hamzah, cremant els seus escrits. [2]

column1: The poetry, syair or ruba'i, of Hamzah Fansuri are usually not more than 13-15 stanzas, but some may be up to 21.[8] 32 of his poems have survived, and Hamzah included in each poem his name and information about himself in the last stanza (takhallus bait).
column2: La poesia, syair o ruba'i, de Hamzah Fansuri no solen ser més de 13-15 estrofes, però algunes poden arribar a ser de 21. [1] 32 dels seus poemes han sobreviscut, incloent-hi a cada poema el seu nom i informació sobre ell a la darrera estrofa ( akhallus bait).

column1: Scholars have commented on his technical skill and mastery in his rhymes, the effective blending Arabic words into Malay poetic structure.
column2: Els estudiosos han comentat la seva habilitat tècnica i el seu domini de les rimes, barrejant efectivament les paraules àrabs amb l'estructura poètica malaia.

column1: They also noted a fondness for pun in his works that displays his humour and poetical virtuosity.[2][9] He also wrote prose, and his three surviving works in prose are:
column2: També van observar una afició pel joc de paraules, on es mostra el seu humor i el seu virtuosisme poètic. [2] [3] També va escriure prosa, i les seves tres obres sobrevistes en prosa són:

column1: Information on Hamzah's life comes largely from the takhallus bait (pen-name stanza) that ends his poetry (syair), as well as from the work of his disciple Hasan Fansuri and commentaries on Hamzah's poems.
column2: La informació sobre la vida de Hamzah prové en gran mesura de l' esquer takhallus (estrofa de nom de ploma) que finalitza la seva poesia ( syair ), així com de l'obra de Hasan Fansuri i els comentaris sobre els poemes de Hamzah. No obstant això, molts dels seus detalls biogràfics són incerts.

column1: However, many of his biographical details are uncertain.[1] His name indicates that he may be from Barus (also known as Fansur to the Arabs), or have spent a large part of his life there.[2][3] A link to the Siamese Ayutthaya (Shahr-i-Naw) has also been proposed, although it may be that he travelled to Ayutthaya rather than that being his birthplace.[4] He was known as a Sufi spiritual master and it is thought that he may have worked at the court of the Aceh Sultanate.
column2: [1] El seu nom indica que pot ser de Barus (també conegut com Fansur per als àrabs), o d'haver-hi passat una gran part de la seva vida. [2] [3] També s'ha proposat un enllaç amb l'Ayutthaya siamès ( Shahr-i-Naw ), tot i que pot ser que només viatgés a Ayutthaya (no el seu lloc de naixement). [4] Era conegut com un mestre espiritual sufí i es creu que podria haver treballat a la cort del sultanat d'Aceh .

column1: Big Mutha Truckers is a racing video game developed by British studio Eutechnyx, released in 2002.
column2: Big Mutha Truckers és un videojoc de carreres desenvolupat per l'estudi britànic Eutechnyx, que va llançar el joc l'any 2002.

column1: Set in fictional Hick County, the game revolves around completing trips between cities, delivering goods, and competing in races while at the helm of a semi truck.
column2: Ambientat al comtat fictici de Hick, la finalitat del joc és la realització de viatges entre ciutats, el lliurament de mercaderies i la competició en carreres al volant d'un camió articulat.

column1: The game is available on GameCube, Xbox, PlayStation 2, and PC.
column2: El joc està disponible a les plataformes: GameCube, Xbox, PlayStation 2 i PC.

column1: It met with middling critical and commercial reception, due to repetitive gameplay, dated graphics, and lackluster sound.
column2: La recepció crítica i comercial del joc te una puntuació mitja, això es degut a que és repetitiu, els gràfics antiquats i el so és de poca qualitat.

column1: The game uses Steppenwolf's "Born to Be Wild" as its theme song.
column2: El joc utilitza " Born to Be Wild " de Steppenwolf com a tema principal.

column1: The sequel is Big Mutha Truckers 2.
column2: La seqüela és Big Mutha Truckers 2 .

column1: A different game of the same name was developed by Italian company Raylight Studios and released for the Game Boy Advance and Nintendo DS.
column2: Un joc diferent amb el mateix nom va ser desenvolupat per la companyia italiana Raylight Studios i llançat per a Game Boy Advance i Nintendo DS.

column1: Big Mutha Truckers is primarily a racing game, in the same vein as 18 Wheeler: American Pro Trucker.
column2: Aquest joc de carreres de camions (Big Mutha Truckers), està en la mateixa línia de joc que 18 Wheeler: American Pro Trucker .

column1: Players spend the majority of their time on the road, navigating the highways between the game's six cities: Salt Sea City, Capital City, Greenback, Skeeter's Creek, Smokestack Heights, and Big Mutha Truckin' Incorporated.
column2: La gran part del temps els jugadors el passen a la carretera navegant per les autopistes entre les sis ciutats del joc: Salt Sea City, Capital City, Greenback, Skeeter's Creek, Smokestack Heights i Big Mutha Truckin 'Incorporated.

column1: The player will earn most of their money through trade, shipping goods from cell phones to beer, with additional opportunities from mini-games and challenge races.
column2: El comerç es la principal font d'ingresos de cada jugador, aquest consta de enviar mercaderies que van des de telèfons mòbils fins a cervesa, a mès hi ha oportunitats addicionals de realitzar mini-jocs i curses de desafiament.

column1: Big Mutha Truckers received a mixed reception.
column2: Big Mutha Truckers va rebre una putuació mixta.

column1: GameRankings and Metacritic gave it a score of 66.41% and 62 out of 100 for the PlayStation 2 version;[1][8] 65.36% and 63 out of 100 for the GameCube version;[2][7] 65.35% and 59 out of 100 for the Xbox version;[3][10] 56% and 48 out of 100 for the DS version;[4][11] 55.80% and 61 out of 100 for the PC version;[5][9] and 50% for the Game Boy Advance version.[6]
column2: GameRankings i Metacritic li van donar una qualificació del 66,41% i 62 de 100 per a la versió de PlayStation 2; 65,36% i 63 de 100 per a la versió GameCube; 65,35% i 59 de 100 per a la versió Xbox; 56% i 48 de 100 per a la versió DS; 55,80% i 61 de 100 per a la versió per a PC; i un 50% per a la versió Game Boy Advance.

column1: GameSpot critic Alex Navarro gave the game a 6.2 out of 10 rating, noting that while it "earnestly tries to be a fun game", flaws in the presentation and a lack of varied gameplay lead to a game that "as a full-on purchase ... just doesn't measure up."[17] Similar complaints about the game's commerce model came from Andy Mahood of GameSpy, who wrote that "no matter how much you dress it up ... this lather-rinse-repeat cycle can turn stale after only a few hours of play."[21]
column2: El crític de GameSpot, Alex Navarro, va qualificar el joc amb un 6,2 sobre 10, i va especificar que, encara que "intenta ser un joc divertit", els defectes de la qualitat grafica i la manca de diversitat en els jocs i mini-jocs, condueixen a un joc que es mostra sempre en la mateixa linea. Queixes similars sobre el model de comerç del joc van venir d'Andy Mahood de GameSpy, que va escriure que "per molt que el vesteixis ... aquest cicle d' escuma-esbandida-repetició pot quedar obsolet després de poques hores de joc".

column1: The game's plot revolves around one of four available characters and their quest to inherit the family business.
column2: La trama del joc gira al voltant dels quatre personatges principals de l'història i l'empresa familiar que volen heretar.

column1: With plans to retire from the family business, Ma' Jackson challenges her four children, Cletus, Earl, Rawkus, and Bobbie-Sue, to a "Trial by Truckin". She gives each sibling 60 days in which to make deliveries to various cities in Hick State County, with the company going to the sibling with the most money in the end.
column2: Amb plans per retirar-se del negoci familiar, Ma 'Jackson desafia els seus quatre fills, Cletus, Earl, Rawkus i Bobbie-Sue, a una competició de camions i li dóna a cada germà 60 dies per fer lliuraments a diverses ciutats del comtat de Hick State, finalment la companyia es quedarà en mans del germà que aconsegueixi més diners .

column1: Every city features three locations: a garage, a bar, and a store.
column2: Cada ciutat té tres ubicacions: un garatge, un bar i una botiga.

column1: The garage allowed players to repair damage, refuel, switch trailers to carry different kinds of cargo, buy upgrades to improve their rig, or design custom logos for their truck.
column2: El garatge permeteix als jugadors reparar danys del camió, repostar combustible, intercambiar de remolc per comercialitzar amb diferents tipus de mercadería, comprar millores per augmentar el nivell del camió o també es pot dissenyar logotips personalitzats per al vehicle.

column1: In the bar the player can find tips on where to buy and sell certain cargo, and a loan shark.
column2: Al bar el jugador poden trobar consells sobre on comprar i vendre certes càrregues i un ventall de diversos prestamistes per aconseguir diners fàcilment.

column1: The store allows the player to buy and sell goods, with prices varying by town.
column2: La botiga permet al jugador comprar i vendre mercaderies, amb preus que varien segons la ciutat.

column1: When visiting Big Mutha Truckin' Incorporated, the bar and store are replaced by visits to Ma Jackson.
column2: En visitar Big Mutha Truckin 'Incorporated, el bar i la botiga se substitueixen per visites a Ma 'Jackson, el seu pare.

column1: On the road, the player can earn extra money by smashing other vehicles.
column2: A la carretera, el jugador pot guanyar diners adicionals, això es pot aconseguir destrossant altres vehicles.

column1: This money can be multiplied through combos, or by hitting a vehicle with the trailer.
column2: Aquestes remuneracions adicionals poden augmentar si el jugador aconsegueix colpejar un vehicle amb el remolc de manera consecutiva.

column1: If the player earns a high enough combo, he can make reward icons appear on the road.
column2: Si el jugador aconsegueix augmentar aquest nombre de colpetjos de manera considerable, pot fer aparèixer unes icones de recompensa a la carretera.

column1: When collected, these icons can refuel the truck, repair damage, or offer a cash bonus.
column2: Quan es recopilen, aquestes icones poden repostar el camió, reparar danys o oferir una bonificació en efectiu.

column1: Law enforcement and biker gangs are both present in the game, and cause trouble for the player if they attack them by mistake.
column2: Les autoritats i els grups de ciclistes es poden trobar en la carretera i causen problemes al jugador si els ataquen.

column1: Any cop will pursue and capture a player, while bikers will attempt to shoot up the trailer, or even detach it from the truck.
column2: Els policies perseguiràn i capturaràn a un jugador, mentre que els ciclistes intentaràn disparar el remolc o fins i tot deslligar-lo del camió.

column1: In either case, it is a significant blow to the player's cash.
column2: En qualsevol dels dos casos, suposa un cop significatiu per als diners del jugador.

column1: Every cop can be avoided with skillful driving, and bikers can be shaken away from the truck.
column2: Es pot evitar a tots els policies amb una conducció hàbil i el camió es pot allunyar dels ciclistes.

column1: Occasionally, the player will be asked to accomplish a side-mission when they visit a bar.
column2: De tant en tant, el jugador pot realitzar una missió secundària quan visiti un bar.

column1: These point-to-point races are good for cash if the player can complete them.
column2: Aquestes curses donen diners al jugador quan les completa.

column1: In 2004 he was admitted to the Council of Elders of Datt Akhara in Ujjain, Central India, and has become the special envoy of its Pir (usually the title of a Muslim Sufi leader, but it is also the title of the abbot of Datt Akhara in Ujjain.[1][20]
column2: El 2004 va ser admès al Consell d'Ancians de Datt Akhara a Ujjain, Índia Central, i s'ha convertit en l'enviat especial del seu Pir (normalment el títol d'un líder sufí musulmà, però també és el títol de l' abat de Datt Akhara a Ujjain. [1] [2]

column1: He hosts an international camp at the Kumbh Mela (the most recent being the Ardh Kumbh Mela in Allahabad, 2007), as well as retreats, teachings, and initiations in India, and abroad.
column2: S'allotja en un campament internacional al Kumbh Mela (el més recent és l' Ardh Kumbh Mela a Allahabad, 2007), a més de retirades, ensenyaments i iniciacions a l'Índia i a l'estranger.

column1: At the 2010 Kumbh Mela in Haridwar Rampuri was honored with a permanent seat in the Juna Akhara Council and given the title Antahrashtriya (trans.
column2: A 2010 al Kumbh Mela de a Haridwar, Rampuri va ser guardonat amb un escó permanent al Consell Juna Akhara i va rebre el títol Antahrashtriya (trad.

column1: 'World Circle') ka Shri Mahant.[1][22]
column2: Cercle Mundial) ka Shri Mahant. [1] [2]

column1: He was interviewed in the 2013 National Geographic documentary on the Kumbh Mela.[23]
column2: En 2013 va ser entrevistat al documental de National Geographic sobre el Kumbh Mela. [1]

column1: On August 11, 2017 Rampuri featured in an episode titled Dear India from the Chelsea late-night talk show.[24]
column2: L'11 d'agost de 2017, Rampuri va aparèixer en un episodi titulat Dear India, en el programa de tertúlies de Chelsea . [1]

column1: Baba Rampuri, born William A. Gans (July 14, 1950), also known as Baba Ram Puri -ji is an American born Sadhu.
column2: Baba Rampuri, nascut William A. Gans (14 de juliol de 1950), també conegut com a Baba Ram Puri -ji és un Sadhu americà.

column1: He claims to be the first westerner to become a Naga Sadhu, having been initiated in 1970.
column2: Afirma ser el primer occidental a convertir-se en un Naga Sadhu, després d'haver estat iniciat el 1970.

column1: He is the author of the 2010 Destiny Books published book Autobiography of a Sadhu: A Journey into Mystic India, originally published in 2005 by Harmony/Bell Tower as Baba: Autobiography of a Blue-Eyed Yogi, and now released by Amarpuri Wellness in 2016 as Autobiography of a Sadhu: An Angrez among Naga Babas which has also been translated into German, Russian, Czech, Croatian, and Serbian.[2] He was initiated into the religious order the Naga Sannyasis after traveling to India on a spiritual quest from his native California in 1969, at the age of 18.[3][4] Like many Sadhus, he has stopped using his birth name since his initiation, refuses to give it,[4] and is unwilling to talk about his past.[6][7] He is Shri Mahant at Shri Panch Dashnam Juna Akhara[8][9][10] (The Sacred Juna Akhara of the Ten Names).[11]
column2: És autor del llibre Autobiography of a Sadhu: A Journey into Mystic India del 2010 publicat per Destiny Books, originalment publicat el 2005 per Harmony / Bell Tower com a Baba: Autobiography of a Blue-Eyed Yogi, i ara publicat per Amarpuri Wellness el 2016 com a Autobiografia d'un Sadhu: un Angrez entre Naga Babas que també s'ha traduït a l'alemany, el rus, el txec, el croat i el serbi. [1] Va iniciar en l'ordre religiós Naga Sannyasis després de viatjar a l' Índia en una recerca espiritual des de la seva ciutat natal, Califòrnia el 1969, a l'edat de 18 anys. [2] [3] Com molts sadhus, ha deixat d'utilitzar el seu nom de naixement des de la seva iniciació, es nega a donar-lo [4] i no està disposat a parlar del seu passat.

column1: Rampuri's claim for a $250,000 plus expenses Agent Fee for his assistance in securing the Juna Akhara's participation and a further $1,325,967 that was promised by Stern and his company as a Dakshina (donation) to Juna Akhara itself, was dismissed by the New York Supreme Court on January 15, 2013.[26]
column2: La reclamació de Rampuri per una despesa de 250.000 dòlars més la comissió de l'agent, amb l'objectiu d'aconseguir la participació de Juna Akhara i a més, els 1.325.967 dòlars promesos per Stern i la seva empresa com a Dakshina (donació) a la mateixa Juna Akhara, va ser desestimada pel Tribunal Suprem de Nova York el 15 de gener de 2013. [1]

column1: Rampuri's Autobiography of a Sadhu: A Journey into Mystic India was first published in English in 2005 (as Baba: Autobiography of a Blue-Eyed Yogi) and translated into Russian in 2006 and German in 2008, with an updated republication in English in 2010.
column2: L' Autobiography of a Sadhu: A Journey into Mystic India de Rampuri es va publicar per primera vegada en anglès el 2005 (com a Baba: Autobiography of a Blue-Eyed Yogi ) i es va traduir al rus el 2006 i a l'alemany el 2008, amb una republicació actualitzada en anglès el 2010.

column1: The Crazy Wisdom of Ganesh Baba: Psychedelic Sadhana, Kriya Yoga, Kundalini, and the Cosmic Energy in Man, page XIV Finley, Guy.
column2: The Crazy Wisdom of Ganesh Baba: Psychedelic Sadhana, Kriya Yoga, Kundalini, i the Cosmic Energy in Man, pàgina XIV Finley, Guy.

column1: The Autobiography of an Unknown Indian Angarai Ganesha Mohan.
column2: L'Autobiografia d'un Indi Desconegut Angarai Ganesha Mohan.

column1: Official website 2006 interview by Tim Rakin and Ilya Zhuravlev, Free Flow Yoga Center, Arambol, Goa, India, for Russian Yoga Magazine.
column2: Official website 2006 entrevista per Tim Rakin i Ilya Zhuravlev, Centre de Ioga de Flux Lliure, Arambol, Goa, India, per la Revista de Ioga russa.

column1: Baba Rampuri was born William A. Gans[1][12][13] on July 14, 1950 in Chicago where his father was a dental surgeon,[14] possibly Jewish.[5] His family moved to Beverly Hills, California in 1953.
column2: Baba Rampuri va néixer en William A. Gans [1] [2] [3] el 14 de juliol de 1950 a Chicago on el seu pare era cirurgià dental, [4] possiblement jueu. [5] La seva família es va mudar a Beverly Hills, Califòrnia, el 1953.

column1: In 1969, at the age of 18, after experimenting with psychedelics, and viewed as a dropout, Gans left his prosperous family and headed for India to find himself, and as a spiritual quest.[1] Although he returned to the United States after this visit, he went back to India in 1971 and has not returned to his native country.[5] He claims to be the first foreigner to be initiated into India’s ancient order of yogis and shamans, the Naga Sannyasis, during the Allahabad Maha Kumbh Mela in 1971.
column2: El 1969, als 18 anys, després d'experimentar amb psicodèlics i vist com un abandonament, Gans va deixar la seva família pròspera i es va dirigir a l'Índia per trobar-se a si mateix i com una recerca espiritual. [1] Tot i que va tornar als Estats Units després d'aquesta visita, va tornar a l'Índia el 1971 i no va tornar al seu país natal. [2] Afirma ser el primer estranger en iniciar a l'Índia una antiga ordre dels ioguis i xamans, els Naga sannyasis, durant el Allahabad Maha Kumbh Mela a 1971.

column1: His guru is Swami Hari Puri Ji, son of Pir Sandhya Puri Ji),[15] also known as Hari Puri Baba Ji, Baba Ji,[16] and Guru Ji.[17]
column2: El seu guru és Swami Hari Puri Ji, fill de Pir Sandhya Puri Ji ), [3] també conegut com a Hari Puri Baba Ji, Baba Ji, [4] i Guru Ji. [5]

column1: In 1984 he founded the Hari Puri Ashram in the Himalayan foothill town of Hardwar.
column2: El 1984 va fundar l' Ashram Hari Puri a la ciutat de Hardwar, a la falda de l' Himàlaia .

column1: He divides his time between his ashram in Hardwar, Ujjain, and Goa.[19]
column2: Divideix el seu temps entre el seu ashram a Hardwar, Ujjain i Goa . [1]

column1: CyberBunker was an Internet service provider located in the Netherlands and Germany that, according to its website, hosted "services to any Web site "except child pornography and anything related to terrorism". The company operated first in a former NATO Bunker in southern Holland, and later in another former NATO bunker in Traben-Trarbach, Germany.
column2: CyberBunker era un proveïdor d' Internet localitzat als Països Baixos i Alemanya que, segons la seva pàgina web, allotjava "els serveis de qualsevol lloc web", a excepció de pornografia infantil i activitats relacionades amb el terrorisme.[1] L'empresa va operar primer en un antic búnquer de l' OTAN a Holanda i, més tard en un altre búnquer anterior a Traben-Trarbach, Alemanya.

column1: Cyberbunker served as a web host for The Pirate Bay and as one of the many WikiLeaks mirrors.[1][2] CyberBunker has also been accused of being a host for spammers, botnet command-and-control servers, malware and online scams.[3] The company has also been involved in Border Gateway Protocol hijacks of IP addresses used by Spamhaus and the United States Department of Defense.[4] The Spamhaus hijack was part of an exceptionally large distributed denial of service attack launched against them in March 2013. Because of the size of this attack it received considerable mainstream media attention.
column2: Cyberbunker va actuar, entre d'altres, com a servidor per a The Pirate Bay o WikiLeaks.[1][2] També ha estat acusat de donar servei a serveis de correu brossa, botnets, llocs de programari maliciós i enganys en línia.[3] El març de l'any 2013 va rebre atenció mediàtica degut a que va rebre un atac de denegació de servei a gran escala, dut a terme per Spamhaus i el Departament de Defensa dels Estats Units.[4]

column1: In October 2009 BitTorrent tracker The Pirate Bay, which had been subjected to legal action by various anti-piracy groups including Dutch copyright organisation BREIN,[18] moved away from Sweden to CyberBunker.
column2: L'octubre de l'any 2009, l'agregador de BitTorrent The Pirate Bay va abandonar Suècia després d'una operació anti-pirateria contra ells.

column1: In 2010 the Hamburg district court ruled that CyberBunker, operating in Germany as CB3Rob Ltd & Co KG, was no longer allowed to host The Pirate Bay, being subject to a €250,000 fine or up to 2 years imprisonment for each infringement.[2]
column2: Va moure el seu allotjament a CyberBunker fins que, l'any 2010, un tribunal del districte d' Hamburg va resoldre que CyberBunker no podia seguir allotjant The Pirate Bay, amb penes de 250.000€ o fins a 2 anys de presó per cada infringiment[1]

column1: In March 2013, Spamhaus added CyberBunker to its blacklist.
column2: el març del 2013, Spamhaus va afegir CyberBunker a la seva llista negra.

column1: Shortly afterwards a distributed denial of service (DDoS) attack of previously unreported scale (peaking at 300 Gbit/s; an average large-scale attack is often around 50 Gbit/s, while the largest known previously publicly reported attack was 100 Gbit/s)[21] was launched against Spamhaus email and web servers using a Domain Name System (DNS) amplification attack;[22][23] as of 27 March 2013[update] the attack had lasted for over a week. Steve Linford, chief executive for Spamhaus, said that they had withstood the attack.
column2: Poc després, un atac de denegació distribuïda de servei (DDoS per les seves sigles en anglès) d'una escala mai vista (fins a 300 Gbit/s, mentre el més gran fins aleshores havia estat de només 100 Gbit/s)[1] va ser llançat contra el servidor web i de correu electrònic d'Spamhaus [2] Steve Linford, executiu en cap d' Spamhaus, va assegurar que havien evitat l'atac.

column1: Other companies, such as Google, had made their resources available to help absorb the traffic.[23] The attack was being investigated by five different national cyber-police-forces around the world.
column2: Altres empreses, com Google, van prestar ajuda per tal de redirigir el trànsit.[3] L'atac va ser investigat per cinc agències de policia del món.

column1: Spamhaus alleged that Cyberbunker, in cooperation with "criminal gangs" from Eastern Europe and Russia, was behind the attack; Cyberbunker did not respond to the BBC's request for comment on the allegation.[23]
column2: Segons Spamhaus, Cyberbunker, en cooperació amb "bandes criminals" de Rússia i Europa Oriental, estava darrere de l'atac; Cyberbunker no va respondre a la petició de la BBC en referència a aquests fets.[4]

column1: Cloudflare, an Internet security firm located in San Francisco, California assisting Spamhaus in combating the DoS attack was also targeted.
column2: Cloudflare, una empresa de seguretat d' Internet amb seu a San Francisco, Califòrnia que va ajudar Spamhaus a combatre l'atac DDoS també va rebre un atac.

column1: On 28 March 2013, CyberBunker's website went offline for a short period of time, possibly becoming a victim of a DDoS attack themselves.[24]
column2: El 28 de març de 2013, la pàgina de CyberBunker va estar fore de línia durant un breu espai de temps, possiblement esdevenint una víctima d'un atac DDoS ells mateixos.[1]

column1: In 2013 the company purchased its second bunker, in Traben-Trarbach, Germany.[1] As early as 2015, German cybercrime investigators received a warrant to investigate the company by tapping its Internet traffic in and out of the bunker.[8] During this time, the company's clients are claimed to have included the dark web marketplaces Wall Street Market, Cannabis Road and Flugsvamp, as well Fraudsters, a forum for exchanging illegal drugs, counterfeit money and fake identification.[8][31] In September 2019, 600 German police raided the bunker.[3] Seven people were arrested in the raid.[32] Police later said that the bunker was the location from which a late 2016 denial of service attack on Deutsche Telekom was launched.[32]
column2: L'any 2013, la companyia va comprar el seu segon búnquer, a Traben-Trarbach, Alemanya.[1] L'any 2015, la policia alemanya va rebre permís per a fer un seguiment de les possibles activitats delictives dins aquest nou espai.[1] En aquesta època, alguns clients de l'empresa són acusats d'allotjar mercats del web fosc com ara Wall Street Market, Cannabis Road i Flugsvamp, així com Fraudsters, un fòrum per intercanviar fàrmacs il·legals, falsificació de bitllets i de documents d'identitat.[1][2] El setembre de l'any 2019, 600 agents de la polícia alemanya va assaltar el búnquer.[3] Set persones van ser arrestades en la incursió.[4] La policia més tard assegurà que el búnquer havia estat la base d'operacions d'un atac DDoS contra Deutsche Telekom l'any 2016.[4]

column1: In September 2019, the German police stormed and shut down the company's operations in its Traben-Trarbach bunker. Seven suspects were arrested.[7]
column2: El setembre de l'any 2019, la policia alemanya va dur a terme una operació dins el seu búnquer de Traben-Trarbach i en va tancar l'activitat.[1]

column1: In 1995, Herman-Johan Verwoert-Derksen bought a 20,000 square foot bunker just outside the small town of Kloetinge in the south of the Netherlands, which had been formerly used by NATO.[1][9] built in 1955.
column2: L'any 1995, Herman-Johan Verwoert-Derksen va comprar un bunquer prop de la petita ciutat neerlandesa de Kloetinge. La instal·lació, construïda l'any 1955 i d'uns 1800 metres quadrats, havia estat anteriorment utilitzada per l'OTAN.

column1: The bunker, originally used as a wartime Provincial Military Command Center (Dutch: Provinciaal Militair Commando) of the Dutch military, was built to withstand a nuclear attack.[10] The bunker was de-assessed by the Dutch military in 1994.[11]
column2: [1][2] Originalment, havia estat un Centre de Comandament Militar de l'exèrcit neerlandès i va ser construït per a suportar un atac nuclear.[3] Fou abandonat per l'exèrcit l'any 1994.[4]

column1: With collaborators, Verwoert-Derksen formed the Cyberbunker company within the bunker, to offer "bulletproof hosting" of web sites.[1][2] The company's customers during the 1990s consisted largely of pornography web sites.[8][9] Its policy was to accept any web site except those related to child pornography and terrorism.[12]
column2: Amb l'ajuda d'altres col·laboradors, Verwoert-Derksen va formar l'empresa Cyberbunker dins del búnquer, per oferir "allotjament a prova de bales" de llocs de web.[1][2] La majoria de clients durant els anys 90 eren llocs de pornografia.[1][2]

column1: In 2002, a fire broke out in the Dutch Bunker.
column2: L'any 2002, un incendi es va iniciar a les instal·lacions.

column1: After the fire was put out, it was discovered that besides Internet hosting services, an MDMA laboratory was in operation.[13][8][3] Three of the four men charged with the operation of the lab were convicted to three-year prison sentences; the fourth was acquitted due to a lack of evidence.[14] Following the fire the local town denied the company a business license, resulting in the Cyberbunker servers being moved to above-ground locations, including Amsterdam.[8][15]
column2: Després d'apagar el foc, es va descobrir que, a més dels serveis d'allotjament web, hi havia un laboratori de MDMA dins el búnquer.[1][2][3] Quatre homes van ser detinguts en relació a aquest fet[4] i, a resultes d'això, la ciutat va rebutjar a l'empresa la llicència d'activitats, amb el qual els servidors van haver de ser allotjats a instal·lacions sobre terra a diferents localitats, entre elles Amsterdam.[2][5]

column1: In its publicity, the company continued to claim that it operated from the bunker.[1] On 29 March 2013, the secure data storage company BunkerInfra issued a press release stating they had been the owners of the Kloetinge bunker since 2010, and that any claims made by CyberBunker regarding their continued usage of the complex were false, and that they have not been operating from the bunker since the fire in 2002.[16] Businessweek reported them as stating that the bunker was "full of junk" when they acquired it, and quoted Guido Blaauw, their general manager, as stating that the CyberBunker publicity material was "all Photoshop".[17]
column2: El 29 de març de 2013, l'empresa d'emmagatzematge segur de dades BunkerInfra va emetre una nota de premsa en què declarava haver estat els propietaris del búnquer de Kloetinge des de l'any 2010, i que CyberBunker no havien estat operant dins el búnquer des del foc de l'any 2002.[2] Businessweek va informar que l'empresa havia assegurat trobar un búnquer "ple de porqueria" quan el van adquirir, i Guido Blaauw, el seu director general, va declarar que tot el material publicitari de CyberBunker era "tot Photoshop".[2]

column1: Lilly Becher (née Korpus, 27 January 1901, Nuremberg, Middle Franconia – 20 September 1978, Berlin) was a German writer, journalist, and communist activist.
column2: Lilly Becher (née Korpus, 27 de gener de 1901, Nuremberg – 20 de setembre de 1978, Berlín) fou una escriptora alemanya, periodista, i activista comunista.

column1: Becher died on September 20, 1978.
column2: Becher va morir el 20 de setembre de 1978.

column1: Noted as one of the first anti-Nazi writers to produce documentary work dealing with the persecution of Jews in Nazi Germany during the 1930s, Lilly Becher was the wife of noted writer Johannes Becher and achieved significant recognition in East Germany as a writer in her own right.[1]
column2: Considerada com una de les primeres escriptores anti-nazis a produir treballs documentals que tractaven la persecució de jueus en l'Alemanya Nazi durant els 1930s, Lilly Becher va ser la muller del reconegut escriptor Johannes Becher i va adquirir reconeixement significatiu en la República Democràtica Alemanya com a escriptora.[1]

column1: Lilly Becher was born as Lilly Korpus in Nuremberg on January 27, 1901, and studied in Munich and Heidelberg.
column2: Lilly Becher va néixer com a Lilly Korpus a Nuremberg el 27 de gener de 190, i va estudiar a Munic i a Heidelberg.

column1: Joining the Communist Party of Germany (KPD) during the first political climaxes of the post-World War I turmoil in 1919, she began a long career as a political journalist in the 1920s, working for the KPD newspaper Die Rote Fahne in 1921 and organizing a women's section of the Communist Party in 1922-1923.
column2: S'uní al Partit Comunista d'Alemanya (KPD) durant els primers clímaxs polítics de l'agitació post-Primera Guerra Mundial en 1919. Va començar una llarga carrera com a periodista política en els 1920s, treballant pel diari del KPD, Die Rote Fahne en 1921 i organitzant la secció de dones del Partit Comunista en 1922-1923.

column1: She moved to Vienna in 1933, the year of Hitler's assumption of power in Germany, remaining for a year before moving to work for the Éditions du Carrefour publishing firm in Paris, where she helped publicize and document the plight of German Jews under her homeland's Nazi regime in Éditions du Carrefour's 1936 collection Der Gelbe Fleck: die Ausrottung von 500000 dt.
column2: Es va traslladar a Viena el 1933, l'any de l'arribada al poder de Hitler, on s'hi va quedar per un any abans de traslladar-se a París per treballar pel Éditions du Carrefour, una empresa editorial, on va ajudar a publicar i documentar la situació dels jueus sota el règim Nazi, en la col·lecció de l'editorial de 1936 Der Gelbe Fleck: die Ausrottung von 500000 dt.

column1: Juden, (The yellow spot: the extinction of 500000 dt.
column2: Juden, (La taca groga: l'extinció de 500000 dt.

column1: The Jews), one of the first such documentary works on the subject.
column2: Els Jueus), una de les primeres feines documentals sobre el tema.

column1: The book's foreword was written by Lion Feuchtwanger.
column2: El pròleg del llibre va ser escrit per Lion Feuchtwanger.

column1: After meeting and marrying Johannes R. Becher, a revolutionary poet and fellow refugee from the Nazis in Paris, the two moved to the Soviet Union, living there until 1945.
column2: Després de conèixer i casar-se amb Johannes R. Becher, un poeta revolucionari i company refugiat dels Nazis a París, el dos es van traslladar a la Unió Soviètica, on hi van viure fins el 1945.

column1: Both joined the National Committee for a Free Germany following the German invasion of the Soviet Union.
column2: Tots dos van unir-se al Comitè Nacional per una Alemanya Lliure després de la invasió alemanya de la Unió Soviètica.

column1: With Germany's defeat in the Second World War, the Bechers returned to the Soviet occupation zone of the divided Allied-occupied Germany.
column2: Amb la derrota d'Alemanya en la Segona Guerra Mundial, els Bechers van retornar a la zona d'ocupació soviètica de les zones d'ocupació aliada a Alemanya.

column1: Lilly Becher worked as head editor of the Neuen Berliner Illustrierten, a major East German weekly magazine, from 1945 until 1950.
column2: Lilly Becher va treballar com a editor cap del Neuen Berliner Illustrierten, una important revista setmanal de la RDA, de 1945 fins 1950.

column1: Johannes Becher composed the lyrics to the German Democratic Republic's national anthem, Auferstanden aus Ruinen, during the same period.
column2: Johannes Becher va compondre la lletra de l'himne nacional de la República Democràtica Alemanya, Auferstanden aus Ruinen, durant el mateix període.

column1: Becher completed her husband's biography in 1963, five years after his death in 1958.
column2: Becher va completar la biografia del seu marit el 1963, cinc anys després de la seva mort en 1958.

column1: She won high official recognition by the East German government in the 1960s and 1970s, among them the prestigious East German Banner of Labor (Banner der Arbeit) for outstanding achievement in 1969.
column2: Va guanyar un alt reconeixement oficial pel govern de la RDA en els 1960s i 1970s, entre ells la prestigiosa Bandera del Treball (Banner der Arbeit) per assoliments excepcionals en 1969.

column1: Bella Paalen, real name Isabella Pollak (9 July[1][2][3] or 9 December[4] 1881 – 28 July 1964) was an Austrian-American operatic soprano of Hungarian origin.[5] She was engaged for 31 years at the k.-k. Hofoper in Vienna, later the State Opera, was appointed Kammersängerin there in 1933 and had to leave the country after the Anschluss because of her Jewish origins.
column2: Bella Paalen, de nom real Isabella Pollak (Pásztó, Àustria-Hongria, 9 de juliol[1][2][3] o 9 de desembre[4] de 1881 - Nova York, 28 de juliol de 1964) fou una soprano operística austríaca-americana d'origen hongarès.[5] Va estar contractada al llarg de 31 a l'Òpera Estatal de Viena, on va ser nomenada Kammersängerin el 1933. Va haver d'abandonar el país després de l'Anschluss a causa dels seus orígens jueus.

column1: As it was no longer safe for Paalen to stay in Vienna due to her Jewish origins, she emigrated to the United States in 1939 with the help of Lotte Lehmann.
column2: Va emigrar als EUA el 1939, amb l'ajuda de Lotte Lehmann, després de veure que ja no era per ella romandre a Viena a causa dels seus orígens jueus.

column1: Her brother B. F. Dolbin, a press illustrator, had also fled Germany for the US.
column2: El seu germà BF Dolbin, il·lustrador de premsa, també havia fugit d'Alemanya cap als Estats Units.

column1: The late timing of her escape from Nazi Vienna indicates that she had probably felt protected by her 30-plus years of membership in the Vienna State Opera.[8] Like her brother, the singer settled in New York City, but was unable to find an engagement.
column2: El moment tardà de la seva fugida de la Viena nazi indica que probablement s'havia sentit protegida pels seus més de 30 anys de pertinença a l'Òpera Estatal de Viena.[1] A l'igual que el seu germà, la cantant es va establir a la ciutat de Nova York, però no va poder aconseguir cap contracte.

column1: From then on she worked as a singing teacher until 1959.
column2: Des de llavors va treballar com a professora de cant fins al 1959.

column1: She became a US citizen in 1944 and died in New York in 1964, aged 83.
column2: Es va convertir en ciutadana dels Estats Units el 1944 i va morir a Nova York el 1964, als 83 anys.

column1: Born in Pásztó Austria-Hungary, Paalen was the daughter of Ernst Pollak (1851–1935) and Laura Pollak née Jamnitz (1858–1935).[6] The father came from Jungbunzlau, the mother from Vienna where her two brothers B. F. Dolbin (1883-1971) and Otto Friedrich Pollak (1885-1915) were born.
column2: Va néixer a Pásztó, Àustria-Hongria, filla d'Ernst Pollak (1851-1935) i de Laura Pollak, de nom de soltera Jamnitz (1858-1935).[1] El pare provenia de Jungbunzlau, la mare de Viena, on van néixer els seus dos germans Benno Fred (1883-1971) i Otto Friedrich Pollak (1885-1915).

column1: Paalen's second brother and her parents also died in Vienna.
column2: Tan el segon germà de Paalen com els seus pares van morir a Viena.

column1: In 1912, her brother Benno Fred changed his family name to Dolbin.[6]
column2: El 1912, el seu germà Benno Fred va canviar el seu nom de família per Dolbin.[1]

column1: She studied singing with Rosa Papier and Johannes Ress.
column2: Va estudiar cant amb Rosa Papier i Johannes Ress.

column1: In 1904, she made her debut at the Düsseldorfer Opernhaus - as Fidès in Meyerbeer's Le prophète.
column2: El 1904 va debutar a la Düsseldorfer Opernhaus, com a Fidès a Le prophète de Giacomo Meyerbeer.

column1: In 1905 and 1906, she was at the Stadttheater Graz.
column2: El 1905 i el 1906 es trobava al Stadttheater de Graz.

column1: The Viennese court opera director and composer Gustav Mahler heard her in Graz as soloist in his Symphony No. 3, was impressed and engaged her to his house.
column2: El director i compositor d'òpera de la cort vienesa Gustav Mahler la va sentir a Graz com a solista a la seva Simfonia núm. 3 i va quedar impressionat per la seva veu, contractant-la per a la cort vienesa.

column1: From 1 September 1907 to 1 September 1937, Paalen was a member of the ensemble of the Imperial Court Opera and from 1918 of the Vienna State Opera.
column2: De l'u de setembre de 1907 a l'u de setembre de 1937, Paalen va ser membre del conjunt de l'Òpera de la Cort Imperial i des de 1918 de l'Òpera Estatal de Viena.

column1: She sang leading roles there, but also medium, small and minor parts.
column2: Hi va cantar papers principals, però també parts mitjanes, petites i menors.

column1: She took part in two Viennese premieres, in 1907 as Kate Pinkerton in Puccini's Madama Butterfly and in 1911 as Annina in Der Rosenkavalier by Hugo von Hofmannsthal and Richard Strauss.
column2: Va participar en dues estrenes vieneses, el 1907 com Kate Pinkerton a Madama Butterfly de Giacomo Puccini i el 1911 com Annina a Der Rosenkavalier d'Hugo von Hofmannsthal i Richard Strauss.

column1: This role became her parade role in Vienna, she sang Annina in a total of 173 state opera performances.[7]
column2: Aquest paper es va convertir en el seu paper més representat a Viena, va cantar Annina en un total de 173 representacions d'òpera estatal.[1]

column1: Acoustic recordings at Pathé, 1910 Strauss: Der Rosenkavalier Excerpts (end of Act 1 and beginning of Act 2), with Lotte Lehmann, Elisabeth Schumann, Maria Olczewska, Richard Mayr, Hermann Gallos, Viktor Madin, Bella Paalen, Karl Ettl und Aenne Michalsky.
column2: Enregistraments acústics a Pathé, 1910 Strauss: fragments de Der Rosenkavalier (final de l'acte 1 i començament de l'acte 2), amb Lotte Lehmann, Elisabeth Schumann, Maria Olczewska, Richard Mayr, Hermann Gallos, Viktor Madin, Bella Paalen, Karl Ettl und Aenne Michalsky.

column1: Wiener Philharmoniker, Konzertvereinigung Wiener Staatsopernchor [de], conductor: Robert Heger, Vienna 1934, HMV (3xLP, Mono + Box) The Koch/Schwann edition published excerpts from performances at the Vienna State Opera, in which she, among other things, performed Magdalene, Herodias, Mary, Annina, Fricka, Grimgerde and sings a Norn.
column2: Orquestra Filharmònica de Viena, director: Robert Heger, Viena 1934, HMV (3xLP, Mono + Box) Koch / Schwann va publicar fragments d'actuacions a l'Òpera Estatal de Viena, en què interpretava, entre altres coses, Magdalena, Heròdies, Maria, Annina, Fricka, Grimgerde i canta un Norn.

column1: On EJS, parts from Götterdämmerung, Staatsoper Vienna, 1935
column2: EJS, peces de Götterdämmerung, Staatsoper Vienna, 1935

column1: In Aufbau (New York), vol. 13, 21.
column2: A Aufbau (Nova York), vol. 13, 21.

column1: She appeared on stage at the Vienna State Opera 58 times as Amneris in Verdi's Aida, 54 times as Rosalia in d'Albert's Tiefland, 46 times as Herodias, 39 times as Ortrud, 32 times as Clytemnestra and 31 times as Ulrica.
column2: Va aparèixer a l'escenari de l'Òpera Estatal de Viena 58 vegades com Amneris d'Aida de Giuseppe Verdi, 54 vegades com Rosalia a Tiefland d'Eugen d'Alber, 46 vegades com Herodias, 39 vegades com Ortrud, 32 vegades com Clitemnestra i 31 vegades com Ulrica.

column1: She was part of the cast of the Vienna Un ballo in maschera in 1924, still considered legendary today, with Richard Tauber as Gustaf III, Mattia Battistini as René Ankarström and the ladies Vera Schwarz (Amelia), Bella Paalen (Ulrica) and Selma Kurz (Oscar).
column2: Va formar part del repartiment de la pel·lícula vienesa Un ballo in maschera de 1924, encara avui considerada llegendària, amb Richard Tauber com a Gustaf III, Mattia Battistini com a René Ankarström i les dones Vera Schwarz (Amelia), Bella Paalen (Ulrica) i Selma Kurz (Oscar).

column1: In the 31 seasons in which the artist was engaged at the Vienna Opera, she demonstrated her versatility.
column2: En les 31 temporades en què l'artista va participar a l'Òpera de Viena, va demostrar la seva versatilitat.

column1: She was equally at home in the heavy Wagnerian repertoire as in German Spieloper and Viennese operettas, she sang the Italian and French repertoire with aplomb, as well as works from the Slavic repertoire.
column2: Cantava repertori wagnerià, obres de singspiel alemany i operetes vieneses, repertori italià i francès així com obres del repertori eslau.

column1: And she proved herself as a stand-in for smaller and larger roles. She took on the title role in Carmen, in which she had otherwise always impersonated Mercedes, and Mamma Lucia in Cavalleria rusticana, twice as Wigelis in Feuersnot, once as Gertrud in Hans Heiling and, surprisingly, on 17 January 1913, as the Steersman in Hans Heiling.
column2: Va arribar a cantar el paper principal de Carmen, una obra a la qual sempre havia fet el de Mercédes, i Mamma Lucia de Cavalleria rusticana, dues vegades Wigelis de Feuersnot, una vegada Gertrud de Hans Heiling i, sorprenentment, el 17 de gener de 1913, va actuar com a Director de Hans Heiling.

column1: Jänner 1913 the Steuermann in Der fliegende Holländer, a tenor role.
column2: El gener de 1913 va cantar el paper de Steuermann de Der fliegende Holländer, un paper de tenor.

column1: Karl J. Kutsch, Leo Riemens: Großes Sängerlexikon.
column2: Karl J. Kutsch, Leo Riemens : Großes Sängerlexikon .

column1: Volume 2: M – Z. München: Saur 1987 (*9.7.)
column2: Volum 2: M - Z. Munic: Saur 1987 (* 9.7.)

column1: Wien: Aktionskomitee 100 Jahr-Feier der Wiener Staatsoper 1969, S. 100 Erich Hermann Müller: Deutsches Musiker-Lexikon, Dresden 1929 Walter Pass, Gerhard Scheit, Wilhelm Svoboda: Orpheus im Exil.
column2: Viena: Aktionskomitee 100 Jahr-Feier der Wiener Staatsoper 1969, p.100 Erich Hermann Müller: Deutsches Musiker-Lexikon, Dresden, 1929 Walter Pass, Gerhard Scheit, Wilhelm Svoboda: Orpheus im Exil.

column1: Die Vertreibung der österreichischen Musik von 1936-1945, Vienna 1995 Horst Seeger: Opernlexikon, Berlin 1978 (1987) Theophil Stengel, Herbert Gerigk: Lexikon der Juden in der Musik.
column2: Die Vertreibung der österreichischen Musik von 1936-1945, Viena 1995 Horst Seeger : Opernlexikon, Berlín 1978 (1987) Theophil Stengel, Herbert Gerigk : Lexikon der Juden in der Musik.

column1: Mit einem Titelverzeichnis jüdischer Werke.
column2: Amb una llista de títols d'obres jueves.

column1: Zusammengestellt im Auftrag der Reichsleitung der NSDAP auf Grund behördlicher, parteiamtlich geprüfter Unterlagen.
column2: Recopilat en nom de la direcció del Reich del NSDAP sobre la base de documents oficials comprovats oficialment pel partit.

column1: In Veröffentlichungen des Institutes der NSDAP.
column2: A Veröffentlichungen des Institutes der NSDAP.

column1: 2, Berlin 1940 Eva Weissweiler: Ausgemerzt!
column2: 2, Berlín 1940 Eva Weissweiler : Ausgemerzt!

column1: Paalen Bella on Operissimo Literature by and about Bella Paalen in the German National Library catalogue Wiener Staatsoper 1933-1936, Operntagebuch eines anonymen Opernfans Bella Paalen discography at Discogs
column2: Paalen Bella a Operissimo Literature by and about Bella Paalen Wiener Staatsoper 1933-1936, diari d'òpera d'un fan anònim de l'òpera Bella Paalen

column1: Paalen was highly associated with the State Opera and was awarded the title Kammersängerin for her achievements in 1933.
column2: Paalen va estar abastament relacionada amb l'Òpera Estatal de Viena i va rebre el títol de Kammersängerin pels seus èxits el 1933.

column1: Paalen made guest appearances - parallel to her engagement at the Vienna Opera - in Holland, Spain, England and Czechoslovakia.
column2: Paalen va fer aparicions com a convidada, paral·lel al seu compromís a l'Òpera de Viena, a Holanda, Espanya, Anglaterra i Txecoslovàquia.

column1: In 1911 and 1912, she sang Fricka in Die Walküre at the Amsterdam Wagner Society.
column2: El 1911 i el 1912 va cantar Fricka a Die Walküre a la Societat Wagner d'Amsterdam.

column1: In 1925, she made a successful guest appearance at the Royal Opera House in London - in four Wagner roles (as Ortrud, Magdalene, Mary and Fricka) as well as Annina in Der Rosenkavalier.
column2: El 1925 va fer una exitosa aparició com a convidada al Royal Opera House de Londres, en quatre papers de Wagner (com Ortrud, Magdalene, Mary i Fricka), així com Annina a Der Rosenkavalier .

column1: From 1934 to 1937, she sang two minor roles at the Salzburg Festival, in Der Corregidor by Hugo Wolf and in Elektra by Richard Strauss.
column2: Del 1934 al 1937, va cantar dos papers menors al Festival de Salzburg, a Der Corregidor d'Hugo Wolf i a Elektra de Richard Strauss.

column1: According to Kutsch/Riemens, these guest performances brought her "great success".
column2: Segons Kutsch / Riemens, aquestes actuacions com a convidada li van proporcionar un "gran èxit".

column1: Rafiq Nishonovich Nishonov (Cyrillic Uzbek: Рафиқ Нишонович Нишонов; Russian: Рафик Нишанович Нишанов Rafik Nishanovich Nishanov) (born 15 January 1926) served as the twelfth First Secretary of the Communist Party of the Uzbek SSR.[1]
column2: Rafiq Nishonovich Nishonov (Ciríl·lic Uzbek: Рафиқ Нишонович Нишонов; rus: Rafik Nishanovich Nishanov) va nèixer el 15 gener 1926 i va servir com el dotzè Primer Secretari del Partit Comunista de la RSS d'Uzbekistan.[1]

column1: Nishonov held this position for 17 months, from 12 January 1988 to 23 June 1989.
column2: Nishonov va ocupar aquest càrrec durant 17 mesos, del 12 de gener de 1988 al 23 de juny de 1989.

column1: His replacement was Islam Karimov.[2] Prior to that, he also served as the Chairman of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the Uzbek SSR between 1986 and 1988.
column2: El seu substitut va ser Islam Karimov.[1] Abans d'això, també va ocupar el càrrec de President del Presidium del Soviet Suprem RSS de l'Uzbekistan entre el 1986 i el 1988.

column1: He was also Chairman of the Soviet of Nationalities from 1989 to 1991.[3]
column2: També va ser president del Soviet de les Nacionalitats del 1989 al 1991.[2]

column1: In 1970-78 he served as Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary to Sri Lanka and the Maldives.
column2: Entre els anys 1970 i 1978 va exercir com a ambaixador extraordinari i plenipotenciari a Sri Lanka i les Maldives.

column1: Sergei Lavrov, who has since 2004 served as the Foreign Minister of Russia, served as his Sinhala interpreter.[4]
column2: Sergei Lavrov, que des del 2004 exerceix com a ministre d'Exteriors de Rússia, va ser el seu intèrpret de cingalès . [1]

column1: Kevin Owen McCarthy (born January 26, 1965) is an American politician serving as House Minority Leader in the United States House of Representatives since 2019. A member of the Republican Party, he previously served as House Majority Leader under Speakers John Boehner and Paul Ryan from 2014 to 2019. He has been the U.S. Representative for California's 23rd congressional district since 2007.
column2: Kevin Owen McCarthy (Bakersfield, Califòrnia, 26 de gener de 1965) és un polític estatunidenc del Partit Republicà que ocupa el càrrec de líder de les minoria a la Cambra de Representants dels Estats Units des del 2019.[1] Va exercir anteriorment com a líder de la majoria de la Cambra sota els presidents John Boehner i Paul Ryan del 2014 al 2019.

column1: The district, numbered as the 22nd district from 2007 to 2013, is based in Bakersfield and includes large sections of Kern and Tulare counties, as well as part of the Quartz Hill community in northwest Los Angeles County.
column2: Des del 2007 és representant dels Estats Units pel 23è districte congressional de Califòrnia.[2]

column1: He was formerly chairman of the California Young Republicans and the Young Republican National Federation. McCarthy worked as district director for U.S. Representative Bill Thomas, and in 2000 was elected as a trustee to the Kern Community College District.
column2: Va ser anteriorment president dels Joves Republicans de Califòrnia i de la Federació Nacional Jove Republicana.[1] McCarthy va treballar com a director de districte per al representant dels Estats Units, Bill Thomas,[2] i el 2000 va ser elegit administrador del districte de Kern Community College.

column1: He then served in the California State Assembly from 2002 to 2006, the last two years as Minority Leader. When Thomas retired from the U.S. House in 2006, McCarthy ran to succeed him and won the election.
column2: Després va formar part de l'Assemblea de l'Estat de Califòrnia del 2002 al 2006, els dos darrers anys com a líder de la minoria.[3] Quan Thomas es va retirar de la Cambra dels Estats Units el 2006, McCarthy va presentar-se per succeir-lo i va guanyar les eleccions.[4]

column1: McCarthy with Donald Trump in Bakersfield, California, in 2020.
column2: McCarthy amb Donald Trump a Bakersfield, Califòrnia, el 2020.

column1: McCarthy was born in Bakersfield, California, the son of Roberta Darlene (née Palladino; November 16, 1940–),[4] a homemaker, and Owen McCarthy (June 12, 1941 – January 28, 2000),[5][6] an assistant city fire chief.[7][8] McCarthy is a fourth-generation resident of Kern County. His maternal grandfather was an Italian immigrant.[9] McCarthy is the first Republican in his immediate family, as his parents were members of the Democratic Party.[10][8] He attended California State University, Bakersfield, where he obtained a Bachelor of Science in marketing in 1989 and a Master of Business Administration in 1994.[12]
column2: McCarthy és resident de quarta generació del comtat de Kern. El seu avi matern fou un immigrant italià.[6] McCarthy és el primer republicà de la seva família més propera, ja que els seus pares eren membres del Partit Demòcrata.[2][3] Va assistir a la Universitat Estatal de Califòrnia, a Bakersfield, on va obtenir una Llicenciatura en Ciències de Màrqueting el 1989 i un Màster en Administració d'Empreses el 1994.[4]

column1: The Musée Grévin – Forum des Halles was a wax museum located in the Forum des Halles, level 1, in the 1st arrondissement of Paris at 1 Rue Pierre Lescot, Paris, France. It opened in 1981 and closed in 1996.
column2: El Museu Grévin – Fòrum des Halles va ser un museu de cera localitzat en el Fòrum des Halles, nivell 1, en el 1r arrondissement de Paris al número 1 del carrer Pierre Lescot, Paris, França. Va obrir el 1981 i va tancar el 1996. http://paris-bise-art.blogspot.com/2016/10/paris-la-lente-agonie-des-musees.html https://fracademic.com/dic.nsf/frwiki/644645 https://www.pinterest.com/pin/139330182208534846/

column1: The museum was an annex of its main Musée Grévin, and devoted to life in the Belle Époque (1885-1900).
column2: El museu era un annex del Museu Grévin, dedicat a la vida de la Belle Époque (1885-1900).

column1: It featured 21 animated scenes with sound effects.
column2: Va presentar 21 escenes animades amb efectes de so.

column1: RAS syndrome (where "RAS" stands for "redundant acronym syndrome", making the phrase "RAS syndrome" homological) is the use of one or more of the words that make up an acronym (or other initialism) in conjunction with the abbreviated form.
column2: La síndrome de l'acrònim redundant o síndrome SAR és un terme festiu per definir aquells termes compostos d'una paraula i un acrònim en què la paraula es repeteix.

column1: This means, in effect, repeating one or more words from the acronym. Three common examples are "PIN number" / "VIN number" (the "N" in PIN and VIN stands for "number") and "ATM machine" (the "M" in ATM stands for "machine").
column2: En són exemples "número PIN" (número d'identificació personal: en anglès es repeteix "número") o "pantalla LCD" (en anglès es repeteix "pantalla") o "virus VIH" (es repeteix "virus") o "memòria RAM" (es repeteix "memòria").

column1: The term RAS syndrome was coined in 2001 in a light-hearted column in New Scientist.[1][2][3]
column2: El terme va aparèixer en un article lúdic a New Scientist.[1][2][3]

column1: Labrinth started his career by producing the track "Dead End" for recording artist Master Shortie from the album A.D.H.D. (2009).
column2: Labrinth va començar la seva carrera produint el tema "Dead End" per a l'enregistrament de l'artista Master Shortie de l'àlbum ADHD (2009).

column1: The track generated interest in McKenzie as a producer and songwriter.
column2: El tema va generar interès per McKenzie com a productor i compositor.

column1: Guy Moot of EMI Music Publishing offered the artist a publishing deal.
column2: Guy Moot, d'EMI Music Publishing, va oferir a l'artista un acord editorial.

column1: From 2010 to 2011, Labrinth mentored the Urban Development Vocal Collective (UDVC) alongside his sister, ShezAr.
column2: Des del 2010 fins al 2011, Labrinth va fer de mentor del Urban Development Vocal Collective (UDVC) al costat de la seva germana, ShezAr.

column1: He also produced multiple tracks for the collective, contributing towards a nine-track project titled Urban Development.
column2: També va produir diverses pistes per al col·lectiu, contribuint a un projecte de nou pistes titulat Urban Development .

column1: The vocalists also provided backing vocals for Labrinth's original tracks.[10][11][12]
column2: Els vocalistes també van proporcionar corals per a les pistes originals de Labrinth.[1][2][3]

column1: McKenzie appeared as an uncredited guest artist on British rapper Tinie Tempah's debut single, "Pass Out," released on 28 February 2010.
column2: McKenzie va aparèixer com a artista convidat sense acreditar al single de debut del raper britànic Tinie Tempah, "Pass Out", publicat el 28 de febrer de 2010.

column1: He had also produced and co-written the track.
column2: També havia produït i coescrit el tema.

column1: The single debuted at number-one on the UK Singles Chart, number six on the Irish Singles Chart, and number seventy in Australia.[1][13] Having spent two weeks at the summit in the United Kingdom, "Pass Out" was awarded Best British Single at the 2011 Brit Awards and Best Contemporary Song at the 2011 Ivor Novello Awards.
column2: El senzill va debutar al número 1 de la llista de singles del Regne Unit, al número sis de la llista de singles irlandesos i al setanta a Austràlia.[1][2] Després de passar dues setmanes al número 1 del Regne Unit, "Pass Out" va ser guardonat amb el millor single britànic als Brit Awards del 2011 i la millor cançó contemporània als Ivor Novello Awards del 2011.

column1: It achieved platinum certification from the British Phonographic Industry for surpassing sales of 600,000 copies.[14] Several months later the two artists collaborated for a second time in the release of Tempah's second single, "Frisky," also co-written and produced by McKenzie.
column2: Va aconseguir la certificació de platí de la indústria fonogràfica britànica per superar les vendes de 600.000 exemplars.[3] Diversos mesos després, els dos artistes van col·laborar per segona vegada en el llançament del segon senzill de Tempah, "Frisky", també coescrit i produït per McKenzie.

column1: The single debuted at number two in the United Kingdom,[5] beaten only by the charity single "Shout" by Dizzee Rascal and James Corden.[15] The track had chart success in Scotland, where it became the duo's second consecutive number one single, also peaking at number three in Ireland.[13]
column2: El single va debutar al número dos del Regne Unit,[1] només superat pel senzill solidari " Shout " de Dizzee Rascal i James Corden . [4] El tema va tenir èxit a Escòcia, on es va convertir en el segon senzill número u consecutiu del duo, que va arribar també al número tres d' Irlanda.[2]

column1: Throughout 2010, McKenzie continued writing material for a number of high-profile artists, including Professor Green for the track "Oh My God" (Alive Till I'm Dead), Ola Svensson for the track "Let It Hit You" (Ola), and Loick Essien for "Love Drunk" (Identity).
column2: Al llarg del 2010, McKenzie va continuar escrivint material per a diversos artistes de gran renom, entre ells Professor Green amb la cançó "Oh My God" ( Alive Till I'm Dead), Ola Svensson la cançó "Let It Hit You" (Ola), i Loick Essien per " Love Drunk " (Identity).

column1: Following chart success as a writer and producer, McKenzie was approached in June 2010 and signed to Simon Cowell's record label, Syco.
column2: Després de l'èxit de la llista com a escriptor i productor, McKenzie va signar amb el segell discogràfic de Simon Cowell, Syco el 2010.

column1: The signing marked a milestone for the label, with McKenzie becoming the first signing in six years who had not gained exposure on one of Cowell's reality talent shows.
column2: El fitxatge va marcar una fita per al segell, ja que McKenzie es va convertir en el primer fitxatge en sis anys que no havia obtingut fama en un dels programes de talents de Cowell.

column1: Through Syco, Labrinth released his debut single "Let the Sun Shine" on 27 September 2010 in the United Kingdom.
column2: A través de Syco, Labrinth va llançar el seu senzill debut "Let the Sun Shine" el 27 de setembre de 2010 al Regne Unit.

column1: The track debuted at number three in the UK, also reaching number thirty-two in Ireland.[1] Labrinth was featured as an artist a third time on 3 January 2011, with the release of British rapper Devlin's single "Let It Go."
column2: La pista va debutar al número tres del Regne Unit, arribant també al número trenta-dos a Irlanda.[1] Labrinth va aparèixer com a artista per tercera vegada el 3 de gener de 2011, amb el llançament del single "Let It Go" del raper britànic Devlin .

column1: This had limited chart success, peaking at number fifty-nine in the UK.
column2: Aquest va tenir un èxit a les llistes limitat, arribant al número cinquanta-nou al Regne Unit.

column1: He also participated in a remake of Charles Wright & the Watts 103rd Street Rhythm Band's "Express Yourself".[2]
column2: També va participar en un remake de "Express Yourself" de Charles Wright & the Watts 103rd Street Rhythm Band[2]

column1: Over the course of the next year, Labrinth produced tracks by Yasmin and Ms. Dynamite, as well as the 2011 Children in Need charity single “Teardrop”, on which he also appeared as a guest performer.[16][17] The single, which was performed both at Children in Need 2011 and Children in Need Rocks Manchester on 17 November 2011 debuted at number twenty-four on the UK Singles Chart.[18]
column2: Al llarg de l'any següent, Labrinth va produir temes de Yasmin i Ms. Dynamite, així com el senzill "Teardrop" de la caritat Children in Need (2011), on també va aparèixer com a intèrpret convidat.[1][2] El senzill, que es va representar tant a Children in Need 2011 com a Children in Need Rocks Manchester el 17 de novembre de 2011, va debutar al número vint-i-quatre de la llista de singles del Regne Unit.[3]

column1: Labrinth released his second single, "Earthquake" on 23 October 2011 – featuring long-term collaborator Tinie Tempah.
column2: Labrinth va llançar el seu segon senzill, " Terratrèmol ", el 23 d'octubre de 2011, amb la col·laboradora a llarg termini Tinie Tempah.

column1: The single debuted at number two on the UK chart with first week sales of 115,530 copies – the second highest selling number-two behind X Factor winners Little Mix and their cover of Damien Rice's "Cannonball".[1] The track also saw international chart success, peaking at number twelve in Ireland,[2] number five in New Zealand and number twenty-one in Australia;[19] achieving gold certification from the Australian Recording Industry Association and platinum certification from the Recording Industry Association of New Zealand.
column2: El senzill va debutar al número dos de la llista del Regne Unit amb vendes de 115.530 còpies la primera setmana, el segon número més venut per darrere dels guanyadors de X Factor Little Mix i la seva portada de "Cannonball" de Damien Rice.[1] La pista també va tenir èxit en les llistes internacionals, assolint el número dotze a Irlanda,[2] número cinc a Nova Zelanda i el número vint-i-u a Austràlia;[3] aconseguint la certificació d'or de la Australian Recording Industry Association i la certificació de platí de la Recording Industry Association de Nova Zelanda.

column1: Following a third single release, "Last Time", which was released on 18 March 2012 as a four-track digital EP alongside remixes from Knife Party and Gareth Emery, Labrinth released his debut album Electronic Earth on 2 April 2012.[20][21]
column2: Després d'un tercer senzill, " Last Time ", que es va publicar el 18 de març de 2012 com un EP digital de quatre pistes junt amb remescles de Knife Party i Gareth Emery, Labrinth va llançar el seu àlbum de debut Electronic Earth el 2 d'abril de 2012.[4][5]

column1: On 23 May 2012, Labrinth performed at the Cheltenham racecourse to celebrate the occasion of the Olympic torch coming through Cheltenham.
column2: El 23 de maig de 2012, Labrinth va actuar a l' hipòdrom de Cheltenham per celebrar l'ocasió de la torxa olímpica que passava per Cheltenham.

column1: He also performed at several university shows including University of Leeds’ Summer Ball, Nottingham Trent University Graduation Ball, and University of Surrey’s End of Year Show.
column2: També va actuar en diversos espectacles universitaris, com ara Summer Ball de la University of Leeds, Ball de graduació de la Universitat de Nottingham Trent i Show of End of Year de la Universitat de Surrey.

column1: On 29 June, Labrinth performed at VG-lista top 20 in Norway in front of a crowd consisting of 90,000 people.
column2: El 29 de juny, Labrinth va actuar al top 20 de VG-lista a Noruega davant d'una multitud formada per 90.000 persones.

column1: Labrinth also performed at GFest in Preston on 8 September 2012 to celebrate Preston Guild 2012.[22] The song "Beneath Your Beautiful", which features Emeli Sandé was released as the album's sixth single and peaked at number one November 2012 on the UK singles chart, and was Labrinth's first entry into the Billboard Hot 100 at number 34.[2]
column2: Labrinth també va actuar al GFest de Preston el 8 de setembre de 2012 per celebrar el Preston Guild 2012. [1] La cançó "Beneath Your Beautiful", que compta amb Emeli Sandé, es va publicar com el sisè senzill de l'àlbum i va arribar al número 1 del novembre de 2012 a la llista de singles del Regne Unit, i va ser la primera entrada de Labrinth al Billboard Hot 100 al número 34.[2]

column1: In July 2012, it was revealed that Labrinth would be working with Rihanna, which resulted in him co-writing and co-producing her song "Lost In Paradise" from her album 'Unapologetic'.[23][24] Labrinth also collaborated with Ed Sheeran, producing his and Devlin's single "Watchtower", which was released in August 2012.[25] Labrinth also worked with Sheeran in 2014, and produced his single "Save Myself" from the March 2017 album '÷'.[26][27]
column2: Al juliol de 2012, es va revelar que Labrinth treballaria amb Rihanna, va fer coescriure i coproduir la seva cançó "Lost In Paradise" del seu àlbum "Unapologetic".[1][2] Labrinth també va col·laborar amb Ed Sheeran, produint el seu senzill "Watchtower" i el de Devlin, que es va publicar l'agost del 2012.[3] Labrinth també va treballar amb Sheeran el 2014 i va produir el seu senzill "Save Myself" de l'àlbum ' ÷ ' del març del 2017.[4][5]

column1: On 25 December 2012, Labrinth released the Atomic EP for free download via SoundCloud.
column2: El 25 de desembre de 2012, Labrinth va publicar l'Etom Atomic per descarregar-lo gratuïtament mitjançant SoundCloud.

column1: It features Plan B, Devlin, Wretch 32, Ed Sheeran, Maxsta, Lady Leshurr and Etta Bond among others.[28]
column2: Compta amb Plan B, Devlin, Wretch 32, Ed Sheeran, Maxsta, Lady Leshurr i Etta Bond entre d'altres.[1]

column1: Timothy Lee McKenzie (born 4 January 1989),[1][2] better known by his stage name Labrinth, is a British singer, songwriter, composer, rapper and record producer.
column2: Timothy Lee McKenzie (nascut el 4 de gener de 1989), [1] [2] més conegut pel seu nom artístic Labrinth, és un cantant, compositor, compositor, raper i productor discogràfic britànic.

column1: After initially pursuing a career in music production, Simon Cowell signed him to his record label Syco Music as a recording artist, after which Labrinth became the first singer who Cowell signed without having competed on a talent show in six years.[3] He has been referred to as “one of the most important British musicians of his generation.”[4]
column2: Després de començar una carrera professional en la producció musical, Simon Cowell el va contractar amb el seu segell discogràfic Syco Music, després del qual Labrinth es va convertir en el primer cantant que va signar Cowell sense haver competit en un show de talent en sis anys.[3] Se l'ha anomenat "un dels músics britànics més importants de la seva generació".[4]

column1: Labrinth began working on his second studio album in 2013.
column2: Labrinth va començar a treballar en el seu segon àlbum d'estudi el 2013.

column1: That year he also appeared on two tracks for Tinie Tempah's second studio album Demonstration: the third single "Lover Not a Fighter" and the album track "It's OK".
column2: Aquell any també va aparèixer en dos temes per a l'àlbum Demonstration de Tinie Tempah : el tercer senzill "Lover Not a Fighter" i el tema del disc "It's OK".

column1: In July 2013, Labrinth was picked as Elvis Duran's Artist of the Month and was featured on NBC's Today show hosted by Kathy Lee Gifford and Hoda Kotb, where he performed live his song "Beneath Your Beautiful".
column2: Al juliol de 2013, Labrinth va ser escollit com a Artista del mes d'Elvis Duran i va aparèixer a l'espectacle Today de NBC, presentat per Kathy Lee Gifford i Hoda Kotb, on va interpretar en directe la seva cançó "Beneath Your Beautiful".

column1: In October 2014, Labrinth released his single "Jealous", which he wrote during a trip to Nashville.[29] The song would eventually peak at #7 on the UK Official Singles Chart in December 2014.[2] The single has received acknowledgement from a number of artists including Adele, who listened to the song to help her cry on command while shooting her "Hello" video, and Jessie Ware, who covered it for the BBC Radio 1 Live Lounge.[30][31]
column2: L'octubre de 2014, Labrinth va publicar el seu senzill "Jealous", que va escriure durant un viatge a Nashville.[1] La cançó arribaria finalment al número 7 de la llista oficial de singles del Regne Unit el desembre de 2014.[2] El senzill ha rebut el reconeixement de diversos artistes, inclosa Adele, que va escoltar la cançó per ajudar-la a plorar al comandament mentre rodava el seu vídeo "Hello", i Jessie Ware, que el va cobrir per a la BBC Radio 1 Live Lounge.[3][4]

column1: Released in August 2015, Labrinth features on the track "Losers", which he also co-produced, on The Weeknd's album Beauty Behind the Madness.[32][33] His contribution to the album earned him his first Grammy nomination for Album of the Year at the 58th Annual Grammy Awards.[34] Labrinth later co-produced "Stargirl Interlude" on The Weeknd's 2016 album 'Starboy'.[35] Labrinth also did a duet on the track "Fragile", the lead promotional single from Kygo's debut studio album Cloud Nine.
column2: Publicat a l'agost del 2015, Labrinth apareix al tema "Losers", que també va coproduir, a l'àlbum de The Weeknd Beauty Behind the Madness.[1][2] La seva contribució a l'àlbum li va valer la seva primera nominació als Grammy per a l'àlbum de l'any a la 58a edició dels premis Grammy.[3] Labrinth va coproduir més tard "Stargirl Interlude" a l'àlbum de 2016 de The Weeknd 'Starboy'. [4] També va fer un duet a la pista "Fragile", el senzill promocional principal de l'àlbum debut de Kygo, Cloud Nine .

column1: In 2016, Labrinth worked alongside Mike Posner on Posner's widely successful album At Night, Alone.
column2: El 2016, Labrinth va treballar al costat de Mike Posner en l'àlbum amb gran èxit de Posner At Night, Alone.

column1: Labrinth is featured and co-wrote on the sixth single, "Silence".
column2: Labrinth apareix i coescriu al sisè senzill, "Silence".

column1: The album was officially released on 6 May 2016.
column2: L'àlbum es va publicar oficialment el 6 de maig de 2016.

column1: Silence was written by both Posner and Labrinth.
column2: Silence va ser escrit tant per Posner com per Labrinth.

column1: The song was produced by Posner and Terefe.
column2: La cançó va ser produïda per Posner i Terefe.

column1: He also produced and was featured in "Make Me (Cry)", Noah Cyrus' debut single, released on 14 November 2016.[36] Labrinth also featured alongside Cyrus in the song's music video and performances on The Tonight Show and The Late Late Show.[37][38] The single eventually peaked at #22 on the Billboard Hot 100 in February 2017.[39] Over the following 2 years Labrinth and Cyrus continued collaborating, with Labrinth lending writing and production duties to Cyrus' May 2017 single "I'm Stuck", September 2017 single "Again", and August 2018 single "Live Or Die." [40][41] In December 2016, Labrinth performed a medley of "Frozen" and "Like A Prayer" at the annual Billboard Women in Music event, where Madonna, who had personally selected him to perform, was honored as Woman of the Year.[42][43]
