column2: Alighiero e Boetti, part del projecte, Origen i destinació, Societe des Expositions du Palais des Beaux-Arts de Bruxelles, Brussel·les, Bèlgica, 1994 Alighiero Boetti, Galleria Civica d'Arte Moderna e Contemporanea, Torí, Itàlia; Musee d'Art Moderne, Villeneuve d'Ascq, França; Museum Moderner Kunst, Stiftung Ludwig, Viena, Àustria, 1996–97 Alighiero Boetti: Mettere al mondo il mondo ("Portar el món al món") - Museum für Moderne Kunst, Frankfurt del Main, Alemanya, i Galerie Jahrhunderthalle Hoechst, Alemanya, 1998 Boetti; l'esperit inconformista d'Art Povera, Whitechapel Art Gallery, Londres, 1999 Zero to Infinity, Arte Povera 1962–1972 - Tate Modern, Londres, ' Walker Art Center, Minneapolis, MN, 2001-2002 Quan l'1 és 2: The Art of Alighiero e Boetti - Contemporary Arts Museum Houston, TX, 2002 Quasi Tutto, Galleria d'Arte Moderna e Contemporanea, Bèrgam, Itàlia, 2004.

column1: Alighiero Boetti: Game Plan MoMA, NY, 2012.
column2: Alighiero Boetti: Game Plan MoMA, Nova York, 2012.

column1: Alighiero Boetti is represented by Sprüth Magers Berlin London, Gagosian Gallery and Tornabuoni Art.
column2: Alighiero Boetti està representat per Sprüth Magers Berlin London, Gagosian Gallery i Tornabuoni Art .

column1: Tornabuoni Art held an exhibition of the artist in 2010 in his parisian gallery, which included about 90 pieces.[33][34] In 1995, the Archivio Alighiero Boetti, seated in Rome, was created for the issuance of certificates of authenticity for works by Boetti.
column2: Tornabuoni Art va realitzar una exposició de l'artista el 2010 a la seva galeria parisenca, que incloïa unes 90 peces. [1] [2] El 1995 es va crear l'Archivio Alighiero Boetti, situat a Roma, per a l'emissió de certificats d'autenticitat de les obres de Boetti.

column1: In 2008, lawsuits were filed between Sperone Westwater Gallery (the artist's primary dealer at the time) and the Archivio Alighiero Boetti (and some family members) over the authenticity of 15 works exhibited and sold by the gallery its 2002 show "Simmetria Asimmetria".
column2: El 2008 es van presentar demandes entre la galeria Sperone Westwater (distribuïdor principal de l'artista en aquell moment) i l'Archivio Alighiero Boetti (i alguns membres de la família) per l'autenticitat de 15 obres exposades i venudes per la galeria la seva mostra del 2002 "Simmetria Asimmetria".

column1: In a January 2008 suit by the archive against the gallery in Milan, the archive sought declaratory judgment that it is not liable to the gallery for not authenticating the works in dispute, and additionally claims that the gallery violated its "moral rights" by exhibiting, publishing, and selling works of art attributed to Boetti.
column2: En una demanda del gener de 2008 presentada per l'arxiu contra la galeria de Milà, l'arxiu va demanar un judici declaratiu que no respon davant la galeria per no autenticar les obres en disputa i, addicionalment, afirma que la galeria va violar els seus "drets morals" en exhibir, publicar i vendre obres d'art atribuïdes a Boetti.

column1: Sperone Westwater, in return, sued the Boetti Archive in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York for what it alleges is a broad scheme to discredit it by capriciously questioning the authenticity of Boetti artworks it has shown and sold in the United States; this included one that was purchased by the Art Institute of Chicago.
column2: Sperone Westwater, a canvi, va demandar l'Arxiu Boetti al Tribunal de Districte dels Estats Units per al Districte Sud de Nova York pel que al·lega que és un ampli esquema per desacreditar-lo qüestionant capritxosament l'autenticitat de les obres d'art Boetti que ha mostrat i venut als Estats Units. Estats; això incloïa un que va ser comprat per l' Institut d'Art de Chicago .

column1: In the New York suit, Sperone Westwater asked the judge to make a declaratory judgment that the archive has no moral rights claims and also seeks damages "for the Defendants' injuries to the gallery's business and reputation," on counts of breach of implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing, negligent misrepresentation, and interference with business relations.[35]
column2: En la demanda de Nova York, Sperone Westwater va demanar al jutge que pronunciés un judici declaratiu segons el qual l'arxiu no té reclamacions de drets morals i també demana danys i perjudicis "per les lesions dels negocis i la reputació de la galeria", per motius d'infracció del pacte implícit de bona fe i tracte just, tergiversació negligent i interferència en les relacions comercials. [1]

column2: Germano Celant, Alighiero Boetti, (Milà, Skira, 2001, publicat en relació amb l'exposició Alighiero Boetti.

column1: At seventeen, Boetti discovered the works of the German painter Wols and the cut canvases of Argentine-Italian artist Lucio Fontana.
column2: Als disset anys, Boetti va descobrir les obres del pintor alemany Wols i els llenços tallats de l'artista argentí-italià Lucio Fontana .

column1: Boetti's own works of his late teen years, however, are oil paintings somewhat reminiscent of the Russian painter Nicolas de Staël.
column2: Les obres pròpies de Boetti durant la seva adolescència, però, són pintures a l'oli que recorden una mica el pintor rus Nicolas de Staël .

column1: At age twenty, Boetti moved to Paris to study engraving.
column2: Als vint anys, Boetti es va traslladar a París per estudiar gravat.

column1: In 1962, while in France he met art critic and writer Annemarie Sauzeau, whom he was to marry in 1964 and with whom he had two children, Matteo (1967) and Agata (1972).[2] From 1974 to 1976, he travelled to Guatemala, Ethiopia, Sudan.
column2: El 1962, mentre es trobava a França, va conèixer la crítica i escriptora d'art Annemarie Sauzeau, amb qui s'havia de casar el 1964 i amb qui va tenir dos fills, Matteo (1967) i Agata (1972). [1] Del 1974 al 1976 va viatjar a Guatemala, Etiòpia, Sudan.

column1: Boetti was passionate about non-western cultures, particularly of central and southern Asia, and travelled to Afghanistan and Pakistan numerous times in the 1970s and 1980s, although Afghanistan became inaccessible to him following the Soviet invasion in 1979.
column2: Boetti era un apassionat de les cultures no occidentals, especialment de l'Àsia central i meridional, i va viatjar diverses vegades a l'Afganistan i al Pakistan als anys setanta i vuitanta, tot i que l'Afganistan li va resultar inaccessible després de la invasió soviètica el 1979.

column1: In 1975, he went back to New York.
column2: El 1975 va tornar a Nova York.

column1: The maps delineate the political boundaries of the countries.[22][2] In one map, the sea is unexpectedly coloured pink rather than blue, as landlocked Afghans had no tradition of mapping, certainly not of oceans.[3] The border texts contain dates or details relative to the work's production, Boetti's signature and sayings, as well as excerpts from Sufi poetry.
column2: The maps delineate the political boundaries of the countries.[1][2] In one map, the sea is unexpectedly coloured pink rather than blue, as landlocked Afghans had no tradition of mapping, certainly not of oceans.[3] The border texts contain dates or details relative to the work's production, Boetti's signature and sayings, as well as excerpts from Sufi poetry.

column1: Joan Bagaria Pigrau (born August 17, 1958) is a Catalan mathematician, logician and set theorist at ICREA and University of Barcelona.
column2: Joan Bagaria Pigrau (17 d'agost de 1958) és un matemàtic català, expert en lògica i teoria de conjunts a ICREA i Universitat de Barcelona.

column1: He has made many contributions concerning forcing, large cardinals, infinite combinatorics and their applications to other areas of mathematics.
column2: Ha fet moltes contribucions sobre forcing, nombres cardinals grans, combinatòria infinita i les seves aplicacions a d'altres àrees de les matemàtiques.

column1: He earned his Ph.D. in Logic & the Methodology of Science at Berkeley in 1991 under the supervision of Haim Judah and W. Hugh Woodin.[1] Since 2001, he has been ICREA Research Professor at University of Barcelona.[2] He served as the first president of the European Set Theory Society (2007-11).
column2: Es va doctorar en Lògica i Metodologia de la Ciència a Berkeley el 1991 sota la supervisió de Haim Judah i W. Hugh Woodin.[1] D'ençà 2001, ha estat Professor de Recerca ICREA a la Universitari de Barcelona.[2] Fou el primer president de la Societat de Teoria de Conjunts europea (2007-11).

column1: His research work is widely cited,[3] and he has given talks to the general public.[4][5]
column2: Els seus treballs de recerca són àmpliament citats, i ha fet xerrades de divulgació científica.[1][2][3]

column1: He is also an active Catalan independentist.[6]
column2: És també un actiu independentista català.[1]

column1: Home page at ICREA Personal Profile at ResearchGate
column2: Pàgina web a ICREA a ICREA Perfil personal a ResearchGate

column1: She died of breast cancer on July 16, 1995, and is buried in Nelson Cemetery, Nelson, New Hampshire.[9]
column2: Va morir d'un càncer de pit el 16 de juliol del 1995, i és enterrat al cementiri de Nelson, New Hampshire.[1]

column1: May Sarton wrote 53 books, including 19 novels, 17 books of poetry, 15 nonfiction works, 2 children's books, a play, and additional screenplays.[10][11] According to The Poetry Foundation, Sarton's style as defined by critics is "calm, cultured, and urbane."[12] In much of her writing, Sarton maintains a politically conscious lens, but what is considered May Sarton's best and most enduring work lies in her journals and memoirs, particularly Plant Dreaming Deep (about her early years at Nelson, ca. 1958-68), Journal of a Solitude (1972-1973, often considered her best), The House by the Sea (1974-1976), Recovering (1978-1979) and At Seventy (1982-1983).
column2: Maig Sarton va escriure 53 llibres, entre ells 19 novel·les, 17 llibres de poesia, 15 obres d'assaig, dos llibres juvenils, una obra de teatre i uns quants guions.[1][2] Segons The Poetry Foundation, l'estil de Sarton segons els crítics és "tranquil, cultivat i sofisticat."[3] En una bona part de la seva obra, Sarton manté una visió políticament conscient, però el que es considera la obra millor i més duradera de la May Sarton són els seus dietaris i memòries, en particular Plant Dreaming Deep (sobre els seus primers anys a Nelson, entre 1958-68), Journal of a Solitude (1972-1973, sovint considerada la seva obra millor), The House by the Sea (1974-1976), Recovering (1978-1979) i At Seventy (1982-1983).

column1: In these fragile, rambling and honest accounts of her solitary life, she deals with such issues as aging, isolation, solitude, friendship, love and relationships, lesbianism, self-doubt, success and failure, envy, gratitude for life's simple pleasures, love of nature (particularly of flowers), the changing seasons, spirituality and, importantly, the constant struggles of a creative life.
column2: En aquests recomptes fràgils, honestos i divagants de la seva vida solitària, tracta temes com l'envelliment, l'aïllament, la solitud, l'amistat, l'amor i les relacions, el lesbianisme, el dubte sobre un mateix, l'èxit i el fracàs, l'enveja, la gratitud pels plaers senzills de la vida, l'amor de la naturalesa (sobre tot les flors), el canvi de les estacions, l'espiritualitat i, sobre tot, les llluites constants per tenir una vida creativa.

column1: Sarton's later journals are not of the same quality, as she endeavored to keep writing through ill health and by dictation.
column2: Els dietaris posteriors, quan intentava escriure malgrat una salut deteriorada per dictat, no tenen la mateixa qualitat.

column1: Although many of her earlier works, such as Encounter in April, contain vivid erotic female imagery, May Sarton often emphasized in her journals that she didn't see herself as a "lesbian" writer: "The vision of life in my work is not limited to one segment of humanity...and has little to do with sexual proclivity".[13] Rather she wanted to touch on what is universally human about love in all its manifestations.
column2: Tot i que moltes de les seves obres anteriors, com Encounter in April, contenen imatges vives i eròtiques feminines, May Sarton subratllava sovint en els seus dietaris que no es veia com una escriptora "lesbiana": La visió de la vida en la meva obra no es limita a un segment de la humanitat... i té poc a veure amb la proclivitat sexual".[1] A canvi, volia comentar el que és universalment humà sobre l'amor en totes les seves manifestacions.

column1: When publishing her novel Mrs. Stevens Hears the Mermaids Singing in 1965, she feared that writing openly about lesbianism would lead to a diminution of the previously established value of her work.
column2: En publicar la seva novel·la Mrs. Stevens Hears the Mermaids Singing, l'any 1965, tenia por que escriure obertament sobre el lesbianisme disminuiria el valor de la seva obra ja publicada. “La por de la homosexualitat és tan gran que es va necessitar coratge per escriure Mrs.

column1: The fear of homosexuality is so great that it took courage to write Mrs. Stevens Hears the Mermaids Singing, she wrote in Journal of a Solitude, "to write a novel about a woman homosexual who is not a sex maniac, a drunkard, a drug-taker, or in any way repulsive, to portray a homosexual who is neither pitiable nor disgusting, without sentimentality ..." [14] After the book's release, many of Sarton's works began to be studied in university level women's studies classes, being embraced by feminists and lesbians alike.[3] However, Sarton's work should not be classified as 'lesbian literature' alone, as her works develop many deeply human issues of love, loneliness, aging, nature, self-doubt etc., common to both men and women.
column2: Stevens Hears the Mermaids Singing," va escriure al Journal of a Solitude, "per escriure una novel·la sobre una dona homosexual que no és una maníac sexual, una borratxa, una drogata, ni de cap manera repulsiva, mostrar una homosexual que no desperta ni pena ni revulsió, sense sentimentalitat..."[2] Després de la publicació del llibre, moltes de les seves obres es van començar a estudiar a nivell universitari en les classes d'estudis sobre la dona, tant per feministes com lesbianes.[3] Tot i així, l'obra de la Sarton no s'hauria de classificar només com a 'literatura lesbiana', ja que la seva obra desenvolupa temes profundament humans com l'amor, la soledat, l'envelliment, la natura, el dubte en un mateix, etc., que són presents tant als homes com a les dones.

column1: Margot Peters' controversial biography (1998) revealed May Sarton as a complex individual who often struggled in her relationships.[15] A selected edition of Sarton's letters was edited by Susan Sharman in 1997[3] and many of Sarton's papers are held in the New York Public Library.[16]
column2: La biografia polèmica de la Margot Peters (1998) revela la Sarton com a un individu complexe que sovint tenia problemes amb les seves relacions.[1] Una edició d'una tria de les cartes de Sarton va ser editada per Susan Sharman el 1997 i molts dels papers de la Sarton estan arxivats a la Biblioteca Pública de la ciutat de Nova York.[2][3]

column1: May Sarton was the pen name of Eleanore Marie Sarton (May 3, 1912 – July 16, 1995), a Belgian-American poet, novelist and memoirist.
column2: Maig Sarton era el pseudònim d'Eleanore Marie Sarton (3 de maig de 1912 – 16 de juliol de 1995), una poeta, novelista i escriptora de memòries belga-americana.

column1: Although her best work is strongly personalised with erotic female imagery, she resisted the label of ‘lesbian writer’, preferring to convey the universality of human love.
column2: Tot i que la seva obra més important és fortament marcada amb imatgeria eròtica feminina, va resistir l'etiqueta de ‘escriptora lesbiana', preferint en el seu lloc intentar communicar la universalitat de l'amor humà.

column1: Sarton was born in Wondelgem, Belgium (today a part of the city of Ghent), the only child of historian of science George Sarton and his wife, English artist Mabel Eleanor Elwes.
column2: Sarton va néixer a Wondelgem, Bèlgica (avui una part de la ciutat de Gant), filla única de l'historiador de la ciència George Sarton i la seva muller, l'artista anglesa Mabel Eleanor Elwes.

column1: When German troops invaded Belgium after the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand in 1914, her family fled to Ipswich, England, where Sarton's maternal grandmother lived.[citation needed]
column2: Quan les tropes alemanyes van envair Bèlgica després del'assassinat de l'Arxiduc Franz Ferdinand al 1914, la seva família va fugir a Ipswich, Anglaterra, on vivia l'àvia materna de Sarton.

column1: One year later, they moved to Boston, Massachusetts, where her father started working at Harvard University.
column2: Un any més tard, la família es va traslladar a Boston, Massachusetts, on el pare va començar a treballar a la Universitat d'Harvard.

column1: Sarton started theatre lessons in her late teens but continued writing poetry throughout her adolescence.
column2: Sarton va començar a fer classes de teatre durant la seva adolescència però va continuar escrivint poesia.

column1: She went to school in Cambridge, Massachusetts, graduating from Cambridge High and Latin School in 1929.[citation needed]
column2: Va assistir a l'escola a Cambridge, Massachusetts, i es va graduar de la Cambridge High and Latin School l'any 1929.

column1: Sarton won a scholarship to Vassar but felt drawn to the theater after seeing Eva Le Gallienne perform in The Cradle Song.
column2: Sarton va guanyar una beca per assistir a la universitat de Vassar però va sentir-se atreta pel teatre després de veure Eva Le Gallienne en La Cançó de Bressol.

column1: She joined Le Gallienne's Civic Repertory Theatre in New York and spent a year working as an apprentice.
column2: Va juntar-se a la companyia de Le Gallienne, el Cívic Repertory Teatre a Nova York i va passar un any treballant d'aprenent.

column1: However, Sarton continued to write poetry.
column2: Tanmateix, Sarton va continuar escrivint poesia.

column1: When she was seventeen, she published a series of sonnets in December 1930, some of which were featured in her first published volume, Encounter in April (1937).[1][2]
column2: Quan tenia disset anys, el desembre del 1930, va publicar una sèrie de sonets, alguns dels quals van ser presentats en el seu primer volum publicat, Encounter in April (1937).[1][2]

column1: When she was nineteen, Sarton traveled to Europe, living in Paris for a year.
column2: Quan tenia dinou anys, Sarton va viatjar a Europa, i va viure a París durant un any.

column1: In this time, she met such literary and cultural figures as Virginia Woolf, Elizabeth Bowen, Julian Huxley and Juliette Huxley, Lugné-Pöe, Basil de Sélincourt, and S. S. Koteliansky.
column2: Durant aquest temps, va conèixer figures literàries i culturals importants com Virginia Woolf, Elizabeth Bowen, Julian Huxley i Juliette Huxley, Lugné-Pöe, Basil de Sélincourt i S. S. Koteliansky.

column1: Sarton had affairs with both of the Huxleys.[1] It was within this environment and community that she published her first novel, The Single Hound (1938).[4]
column2: Sarton va tenir afers amb els dos Huxleys.[1] Va ser dins d'aquest entorn i comunitat en que va publicar la seva primera novel·la, The Single Hound (1938).[2]

column1: In 1945 in Santa Fe, New Mexico, she met Judith "Judy" Matlack (September 9, 1898–December 22, 1982), who became her partner for the next thirteen years.
column2: El 1945 a Santa Fe, Nou Mèxic, va conèixer Judith "Judy" Matlack (9 de setembre de 1898–22 de desembre de 1982), qui es va esdevenir la seva parella durant els propers tretze anys.

column1: They separated in 1956, when Sarton's father died and Sarton moved to Nelson, New Hampshire.
column2: Es van separar el 1956, quan el pare de Sarton va morir i ella va traslladar-se a Nelson, New Hampshire.

column1: Honey in the Hive (1988) is about their relationship.[5] In her memoir At Seventy, Sarton reflected on Judy's importance in her life and her Unitarian Universalist upbringing.[6] She was elected a fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences in 1958.[7]
column2: Va escriure Honey en el Hive (1988) sobre la seva relació.[1] En les seves memòries At Seventy, Sarton reflecteix sobre la importància que va tenir la Judy i l'esglèsia Unitarian Universalist en la seva vida.[2] Va ser elegida membre de l'Acadèmia americana d'Arts i Ciències l'any 1958.[3]

column1: Sarton later moved to York, Maine.
column2: Més tard, la Sarton es va traslladar a York, Maine.

column1: In 1990, she was temporarily debilitated by a stroke.
column2: L'any 1990, va tenir un ictus i va estar temporalment incapacitada.

column1: Since writing was difficult, she used a tape recorder to record and transcribe her journal Endgame: A Journal of the Seventy-Ninth Year (1992). Despite her physical difficulties, she maintained her sense of independence.
column2: Com que li costava escriure, feia servir un magnetòfon per gravar i transcriure el seu dietari Endgame: A Journal of the Seventy-Ninth Year (1992). Malgrat les seves dificultats físiques, va mantenir el seu sentit de la indepenència.

column1: Endgame was followed by the journal Encore: A Journal of the Eightieth Year (1993), a celebration of Sarton's life.
column2: Endgame va ser seguit pel dietari Encore: A Journal of the Seventy-Ninth Year (1993), una celebració de la seva vida.

column1: She won the Levinson Prize for Poetry in 1993.
column2: Va guanyar el premi Levinson de la Poesia l'any 1993.

column1: Her final book, Coming Into Eighty (1995), published after her death, covers the year from July 1993 to August 1994, describing her attitude of gratitude for life as she wrestled with the experience of aging.[8]
column2: El seu últim llibre, Coming into Eighty (1995), es va publicar després de la seva mort i cobreix des del juliol del 1993 fins l'agost del 1994, i descriu la seva actitud d'agraïment per la vida mentre lluitava amb l'experiència de l'envelliment.[1]

column1: A generation is "all of the people born and living at about the same time, regarded collectively."
column2: Una generació són "totes les persones que neixen i viuen al mateix temps, considerades en conjunt".

column1: It can also be described as, "the average period, generally considered to be about 20–⁠30 years, during which children are born and grow up, become adults, and begin to have children."
column2: També es pot descriure com "el període de mitjana, generalment entre 20 i ⁠30 anys, durant el qual els nens neixen i creixen, es fan adults i comencen a tenir fills".

column1: In kinship terminology, it is a structural term designating the parent-child relationship.
column2: En la terminologia de parentiu, és un terme estructural que designa la relació pare-fill.

column1: It is known as biogenesis, reproduction, or procreation in the biological sciences.
column2: Es coneix com a biogènesi, reproducció o procreació en les ciències biològiques.

column1: Social generations are cohorts of people born in the same date range and who share similar cultural experiences.[9] The idea of a social generation, in the sense that it is used today, gained currency in the 19th century.
column2: Les generacions socials són conjunts de persones nascudes en un mateix interval de dates i que comparteixen experiències culturals similars.[1] La idea d'una generació social, en el sentit que s'utilitza avui en dia, va guanyar popularitat al segle XIX.

column1: Prior to that the concept "generation" had generally referred to family relationships and not broader social groupings.
column2: Abans, el concepte "generació" s'havia referit generalment a les relacions familiars i no a les agrupacions socials més àmplies.

column1: In 1863, French lexicographer Emile Littré had defined a generation as, "all people coexisting in society at any given time".[10]:19
column2: El 1863, el lexicògraf francès Emile Littré havia definit una generació com "totes les persones que conviuen en la societat en un moment donat".[2]: 19

column1: Several trends promoted a new idea of generations, as the 19th century wore on, of a society divided into different categories of people based on age.
column2: Diverses tendències van promoure una nova idea de generacions, a mesura que avançava el segle XIX, d'una societat dividida en diferents categories de persones segons l'edat.

column1: These trends were all related to the processes of modernisation, industrialisation, or westernisation, which had been changing the face of Europe since the mid-18th century.
column2: Totes aquestes tendències estaven relacionades amb els processos de modernització, industrialització o occidentalització, que havien anat canviant la cara d'Europa des de mitjan segle XVIII.

column1: One was a change in mentality about time and social change.
column2: Un va ser un canvi de mentalitat sobre el temps i el canvi social.

column1: The increasing prevalence of enlightenment ideas encouraged the idea that society and life were changeable, and that civilization could progress.
column2: La creixent prevalença d'idees de la il·lustracióvan fomentar la idea que la societat i la vida eren canviants i que la civilització podia progressar.

column1: This encouraged the equation of youth with social renewal and change.
column2: Això va fomentar la identificació de la joventut amb la renovació i el canvi social.

column1: Political rhetoric in the 19th century often focused on the renewing power of youth influenced by movements such as Young Italy, Young Germany, Sturm und Drang, the German Youth Movement, and other romantic movements.
column2: La retòrica política del segle XIX es va centrar sovint en el poder renovador de la joventut influït per moviments com la Jove Itàlia, la Jove Alemanya, Sturm und Drang, el Moviment Juvenil Alemany i altres moviments inspirats en el Romanticisme.

column1: By the end of the 19th century, European intellectuals were disposed toward thinking of the world in generational terms—in terms of youth rebellion and emancipation.[1]
column2: A finals del segle XIX, els intel·lectuals europeus estaven disposats a pensar el món en termes generacionals, en termes de rebel·lió i emancipació dels joves.[1]

column1: Two important contributing factors to the change in mentality were the change in the economic structure of society.
column2: Dos canvis importants en el canvi de mentalitat van ser el canvi en l'estructura econòmica de la societat.

column1: Because of the rapid social and economic change, young men particularly were less beholden to their fathers and family authority than they had been.
column2: A causa del ràpid canvi social i econòmic, els homes joves estaven menys atesos pels seus pares i la família va perdre autoritat.

column1: Greater social and economic mobility allowed them to flout their authority to a much greater extent than had traditionally been possible.
column2: Una major mobilitat econòmica i social els va permetre evitar la seva autoritat molt més del que tradicionalment havia estat possible.

column1: Additionally, the skills and wisdom of fathers were often less valuable than they had been due to technological and social change.[1] During this time, the period between childhood and adulthood, usually spent at university or in military service, was also increased for many people entering white-collar jobs.
column2: A més, les habilitats i saviesa dels pares sovint eren menys valuoses del que havien estat a causa del canvi tecnològic i social.[1] Durant aquest temps, el període comprès entre la infància i l'edat adulta, que normalment passava a la universitat o al servei militar, també es va augmentar per a moltes persones que ingressaven en feines de coll blanc.

column1: This category of people was very influential in spreading the ideas of youthful renewal.[10]
column2: Aquesta categoria de persones va influir molt en la difusió de les idees de renovació juvenil.[1]

column1: Another important factor was the breakdown of traditional social and regional identifications.
column2: Un altre factor important va ser el desglossament de les identificacions socials i regionals tradicionals.

column1: The spread of nationalism and many of the factors that created it (a national press, linguistic homogenisation, public education, suppression of local particularities) encouraged a broader sense of belonging beyond local affiliations.
column2: La difusió del nacionalisme i molts dels factors que el van crear (premsa nacional, homogeneïtzació lingüística, educació pública, supressió de les particularitats locals) van fomentar un sentit més ampli de pertinença més enllà de les afiliacions locals.

column1: People thought of themselves increasingly as part of a society, and this encouraged identification with groups beyond the local.[1] Auguste Comte was the first philosopher to make a serious attempt to systematically study generations.
column2: La gent es veia cada vegada més com a part d'una societat i això va fomentar la identificació amb grups més enllà del local.[1] Auguste Comte va ser el primer filòsof que va intentar seriosament estudiar sistemàticament les generacions.

column1: In Cours de philosophie positive Comte suggested that social change is determined by generational change and in particular conflict between successive generations.[11] As the members of a given generation age, their "instinct of social conservation" becomes stronger, which inevitably and necessarily brings them into conflict with the "normal attribute of youth"—innovation.
column2: A Cours de philosophie positive, Comte va suggerir que el canvi social està determinat pel canvi generacional i, en particular, pel conflicte entre generacions successives.[2] A mesura que es fa més fort l'instint de conservació social d'una determinada generació, aquesta entra en conflicte inevitablement i necessària, entren en conflicte amb el que s'espera d'ells i apareix la innovació.

column1: Other important theorists of the 19th century were John Stuart Mill and Wilhelm Dilthey.
column2: Altres teòrics importants del segle XIX van ser John Stuart Mill i Wilhelm Dilthey.

column1: Sociologist Karl Mannheim was a seminal figure in the study of generations.
column2: El sociòleg Karl Mannheim va ser una figura clau en l'estudi de les generacions.

column1: He elaborated a theory of generations in his 1923 essay The Problem of Generations.[1] He suggested that there had been a division into two primary schools of study of generations until that time.
column2: Va elaborar una teoria de les generacions en el seu assaig de 1923 El problema de les generacions. [1] Va suggerir que hi havia hagut una divisió en dues escoles pel que fa a l'estudi de generacions fins aquell moment.

column1: Firstly, positivists such as Comte measured social change in designated life spans.
column2: En primer lloc, positivistes com Comte van mesurar el canvi social en els períodes de vida designats.

column1: The other school, the "romantic-historical" was represented by Dilthey and Martin Heidegger.
column2: L'altra escola, la "romàntica-històrica", estava representada per Dilthey i Martin Heidegger.

column1: This school focused on the individual qualitative experience at the expense of social context.
column2: Aquesta escola es va centrar en l'experiència qualitativa individual del context social.

column1: Mannheim emphasised that the rapidity of social change in youth was crucial to the formation of generations, and that not every generation would come to see itself as distinct.
column2: Mannheim va subratllar que la rapidesa del canvi social en la joventut era crucial per a la formació de generacions i que no totes les generacions arribarien a veure's diferents.

column1: In periods of rapid social change a generation would be much more likely to develop a cohesive character.
column2: En els períodes de ràpid canvi social, és més probable que una generació desenvolupi un caràcter cohesionat.

column1: He also believed that a number of distinct sub-generations could exist.[1]
column2: També creia que podrien existir diverses subgeneracions diferents. [1]

column1: Shared temporal location – generational site or birth cohort Shared historical location – generation as actuality or exposure to a common era Shared sociocultural location – generational consciousness or "entelechy"
column2: Ubicació temporal compartida: lloc generacional o cohort de naixement Ubicació històrica compartida: generació com a actualitat o exposició a una era comuna Ubicació sociocultural compartida: consciència generacional o "entelèquia"

column1: Authors William Strauss and Neil Howe developed the Strauss-Howe generational theory outlining what they saw as a pattern of generations repeating throughout American history.
column2: William Strauss i Neil Howe van desenvolupar la teoria generacional Strauss-Howe descrivint allò que veien com un patró de generacions que es repetien al llarg de la història nord-americana.

column1: This theory became quite influential with the public and reignited an interest in the sociology of generations.
column2: Aquesta teoria va influir bastant i va tornar a generar un interès per la sociologia de les generacions.

column1: This led to the creation of an industry of consulting, publishing, and marketing in the field.[13] The theory has alternatively been criticized by social scientists and journalists who argue it is non-falsifiable, deterministic, and unsupported by rigorous evidence.[14][15][16]
column2: Això va conduir a la creació d'una indústria de consultoria, publicació i màrqueting en el camp.[1] La teoria ha estat criticada alternativament per científics i periodistes socials que argumenten que no és falsificable, determinista i que no es recolza en proves rigoroses.[2] [3] [4]

column1: While the concept of a generation has a long history and can be found in ancient literature,[17] there are also psychological and sociological dimensions in the sense of belonging and identity which may define a generation.
column2: Tot i que el concepte de generació té una llarga història i es pot trobar a la literatura antiga,[1] també hi ha dimensions psicològiques i sociològiques en el sentit de pertinença i identitat que poden definir una generació.

column1: The concept of a generation can be used to locate particular birth cohorts in specific historical and cultural circumstances, such as the "Baby boomers".[17]
column2: El concepte de generació es pot utilitzar per localitzar cohorts de naixement concretes en circumstàncies històriques i culturals específiques, com ara els "baby boomers".[1]

column1: Generation is also often used synonymously with cohort in social science; under this formulation it means "people within a delineated population who experience the same significant events within a given period of time".[1] Generations in this sense of birth cohort, also known as "social generations", are widely used in popular culture, and have been the basis for sociological analysis.
column2: La generació també s'utilitza sovint com a sinònim de cohort en ciències socials; sota aquesta formulació significa "persones dins d'una població delimitada que experimenten els mateixos esdeveniments significatius en un període de temps determinat".[1] Les generacions en aquest sentit de la cohort de naixement, també conegudes com a "generacions socials", són àmpliament utilitzades en la cultura popular i han estat la base per a l'anàlisi sociològica.

column1: Serious analysis of generations began in the nineteenth century, emerging from an increasing awareness of the possibility of permanent social change and the idea of youthful rebellion against the established social order.
column2: Al segle XIX es va iniciar una anàlisi seriosa de les generacions, que va sorgir d'una consciència creixent sobre la possibilitat d'un canvi social permanent i la idea de la rebel·lió juvenil contra l'ordre social establert.

column1: Some analysts believe that a generation is one of the fundamental social categories in a society, while others view its importance as being overshadowed by other factors including class, gender, race, and education, among others.
column2: Alguns analistes creuen que una generació és una de les categories socials fonamentals d'una societat, mentre que d'altres consideren la seva importància com a eclipsada per altres factors, com ara la classe, el gènere, la raça i l'educació, entre d'altres.

column1: Historian Hans Jaeger shows that, during this long history, two schools of thought coalesced regarding how generations form: the "pulse-rate hypothesis" and the "imprint hypothesis."[18] According to the pulse-rate hypothesis, a society's entire population can be divided into a series of non-overlapping cohorts, each of which develops a unique "peer personality" because of the time period in which each cohort came of age.[19] The movement of these cohorts from one life-stage to the next creates a repeating cycle that shapes the history of that society.
column2: L'historiador Hans Jaeger demostra que, durant aquesta llarga història, es van unir dues escoles de pensament sobre com es formen les generacions: la "hipòtesi del ritme de pols" i la "hipòtesi de l'empremta".[1] Segons la hipòtesi del ritme de pols, tota la població d'una societat es pot dividir en una sèrie de cohorts no superposades, cadascuna de les quals desenvolupa una "personalitat entre iguals" única a causa del període de temps en què cada cohort va arribar a la majoria d'edat.[2] El moviment d'aquestes cohorts d'una etapa de vida a l'altra crea un cicle que es repeteix i conforma la història d'aquesta societat.

column1: Currently, the most prominent example of pulse-rate generational theory is the Strauss-Howe generational theory; however, Jose Ortega y Gasset and Julián Marías followed this approach before them.
column2: Actualment, l'exemple més destacat de la teoria generacional del ritme de pols és la teoria generacional de Strauss-Howe; tanmateix, Jose Ortega i Gasset i Julián Marías ja havien fet aquest enfocament abans.

column1: Social scientists tend to reject the pulse-rate hypothesis because, as Jaeger explains, "the concrete results of the theory of the universal pulse rate of history are, of course, very modest.
column2: Els científics socials tendeixen a rebutjar la hipòtesi del pols perquè, com explica Jaeger, "els resultats concrets de la teoria del pols universal de la història són, per descomptat, molt modestos.

column1: With a few exceptions, the same goes for the partial pulse-rate theories.
column2: Amb algunes excepcions, el mateix passa amb les teories parcials del ritme de pols.

column1: Since they generally gather data without any knowledge of statistical principles, the authors are often least likely to notice to what extent the jungle of names and numbers which they present lacks any convincing organization according to generations."[20]
column2: Com que generalment recopilen dades sense cap coneixement dels principis estadístics, els autors solen notar fins a quin punt la selva de noms i nombres que presenten no té cap organització convincent segons les generacions."[1]

column1: Social scientists follow the "imprint hypothesis" of generations, which can be traced to Karl Mannheim's theory of generations.
column2: Els científics socials segueixen la "hipòtesi de l'empremta" de les generacions, que es pot remuntar a la teoria de les generacions de Karl Mannheim.

column1: According to the imprint hypothesis, generations are only produced by specific historical events that cause young people to perceive the world differently than their elders.
column2: Segons la hipòtesi de l'empremta, les generacions només són produïdes per esdeveniments històrics específics que fan que els joves percebin el món de manera diferent que els seus avantpassats.

column1: Thus, not everyone may be part of a generation; only those who share a unique social and biographical experience of an important historical moment will become part of a "generation as an actuality."[21] When following the imprint hypothesis, social scientists face a number of challenges.
column2: Per tant, no tothom pot formar part d'una generació; només aquells que comparteixin una experiència social i biogràfica única d'un moment històric important passaran a formar part d'una "generació com a realitat".[1] Quan segueixen la hipòtesi de l'empremta, els científics socials s'enfronten a diversos desafiaments.

column1: They cannot accept the labels and chronological boundaries of generations that come from the pulse-rate hypothesis (like Generation X or Millennial); instead, the chronological boundaries of generations must be determined inductively and who is part of the generation must be determined through historical, quantitative, and qualitative analysis.[22]
column2: No poden acceptar les etiquetes i els límits cronològics de les generacions que provenen de la hipòtesi del ritme de pols (com la generació X o el Millennial); en canvi, els límits cronològics de les generacions s'han de determinar de manera inductiva i s'ha de determinar qui forma part de la generació mitjançant una anàlisi històrica, quantitativa i qualitativa.[2]

column1: While all generations have similarities, there are differences among them as well.
column2: Tot i que totes les generacions tenen similituds, també hi ha diferències entre elles.

column1: A 2007 Pew Research Center report called "Millennials: Confident.
column2: Un informe del 2007 Pew Research Center anomenat "Millennials: Confident.

column1: Open to Change" noted the challenge of studying generations: "Generational analysis has a long and distinguished place in social science, and we cast our lot with those scholars who believe it is not only possible, but often highly illuminating, to search for the unique and distinctive characteristics of any given age group of Americans.
column2: Open to Change" va assenyalar el repte d'estudiar generacions: "L'anàlisi generacional té un llarg i distingit lloc en les ciències socials, i donem suport als estudiosos que creuen que no només és possible, sinó que sovint és molt il·luminador, buscar allò únic i característiques distintives de qualsevol grup d'edat dels nord-americans.

column1: But we also know this is not an exact science.
column2: Però també sabem que això no és una ciència exacta.

column1: We are mindful that there are as many differences in attitudes, values, behaviors, and lifestyles within a generation as there are between generations.
column2: Som conscients que hi ha tantes diferències en actituds, valors, comportaments i estils de vida dins d'una generació com entre generacions.

column1: But we believe this reality does not diminish the value of generational analysis; it merely adds to its richness and complexity."[23] Another element of generational theory is recognizing how youth experience their generation, and how that changes based on where they reside in the world.
column2: Però creiem que aquesta realitat no disminueix el valor de l'anàlisi generacional; només afegeix a la seva riquesa i complexitat." [1] Un altre element de la teoria generacional és reconèixer com els joves experimenten la seva generació i com això canvia en funció de la seva residència al món.

column1: Analyzing young people's experiences in place contributes to a deeper understanding of the processes of individualization, inequality, and of generation.[24] Being able to take a closer looks at youth cultures and subcultures in different times and places adds an extra element to understanding the everyday lives of youth.
column2: Analitzar les experiències dels joves al seu lloc contribueix a una comprensió més profunda dels processos d'individualització, desigualtat i generació.[2] Poder aprofundir en les cultures i subcultures juvenils en diferents moments i llocs afegeix un element addicional a la comprensió de la vida quotidiana dels joves.

column1: This allows a better understanding of youth and the way generation and place play in their development.[25]
column2: Això permet una millor comprensió de la joventut i de la manera com la generació i el lloc juguen en el seu desenvolupament. [3]

column1: It is not where the birth cohort boundaries are drawn that is important, but how individuals and societies interpret the boundaries and how divisions may shape processes and outcomes.
column2: No és on es dibuixen els límits de la cohort de naixement que és important, sinó com els individus i les societats interpreten els límits i com les divisions poden configurar els processos i els resultats.

column1: However, the practice of categorizing age cohorts is useful to researchers for the purpose of constructing boundaries in their work.[26]
column2: No obstant això, la pràctica de classificar les cohorts d'edat és útil per als investigadors amb la finalitat de construir fronteres en el seu treball.[1]

column1: Norman Ryder, writing in American Sociological Review in 1965, shed light on the sociology of the discord between generations by suggesting that society "persists despite the mortality of its individual members, through processes of demographic metabolism and particularly the annual infusion of birth cohorts".
column2: Norman Ryder, que va escriure a American Sociological Review el 1965, va impulsar la sociologia de la discòrdia entre generacions en suggerir que la societat "persisteix malgrat la mortalitat dels seus membres individuals, a través de processos de metabolisme demogràfic i particularment de la infusió anual de cohorts de naixement".

column1: He argued that generations may sometimes be a "threat to stability" but at the same time they represent "the opportunity for social transformation".[27] Ryder attempted to understand the dynamics at play between generations.
column2: Va argumentar que les generacions de vegades poden ser una "amenaça per a l'estabilitat", però al mateix temps representen "l'oportunitat de transformació social". [1] Ryder va intentar entendre la dinàmica jugant entre generacions.

column1: Karl Mannheim, in his 1952 book Essays on the Sociology of Knowledge asserted the belief that people are shaped through lived experiences as a result of social change.
column2: Karl Mannheim, en el seu llibre Assaigs sobre sociologia del coneixement de 1952, afirmava la creença que les persones es conformen a través d'experiències viscudes com a resultat d'un canvi social.

column1: Howe and Strauss also have written on the similarities of people within a generation being attributed to social change.
column2: Howe i Strauss també han escrit sobre les similituds de les persones d'una generació atribuïdes al canvi social.

column1: Based on the way these lived experiences shape a generation in regard to values, the result is that the new generation will challenge the older generation's values, resulting in tension.
column2: A partir de la forma en què aquestes experiències viscudes configuren una generació pel que fa als valors, el resultat és que la nova generació desafiarà els valors de la generació més antiga, resultant en tensió.

column1: This challenge between generations and the tension that arises is a defining point for understanding generations and what separates them.[29]
column2: Aquest repte entre generacions i la tensió que sorgeix és un punt determinant per entendre les generacions i el que les separa. [1]

column1: The Western world includes Western Europe, the Americas, and Australasia.
column2: El món occidental inclou Europa occidental, les Amèriques i Australàsia.

column1: Many variations may exist within these regions, both geographically and culturally, which means that the list is broadly indicative, but very general.
column2: Poden existir moltes variacions dins d'aquestes regions, tant geogràficament com culturalment, cosa que significa que la llista és molt general.

column1: The contemporary characterization of these cohorts used in media and advertising borrows, in part, from the Strauss–Howe generational theory[1][30] and generally follows the logic of the pulse-rate hypothesis.[31]
column2: La caracterització contemporània d'aquestes cohorts es basa parcialment en la teoria generacional Strauss – Howe [1] [2] i segueix generalment la lògica de la hipòtesi del ritme de pols. [3]

column1: The Lost Generation, also known as the "Generation of 1914" in Europe,[32] is a term originating from Gertrude Stein to describe those who fought in World War I. The Lost Generation is defined as the cohort born from 1883 to 1900 who came of age during World War I and the Roaring Twenties.[33] The Greatest Generation, also known as the "G.I. Generation",[34] includes the veterans who fought in World War II. They were born from 1901 to 1927;[35] older G.I.s (or the Interbellum Generation) came of age during the Roaring Twenties, while younger G.I.s came of age during the Great Depression and World War II.
column2: La generació perduda, també coneguda com la "generació de 1914" a Europa, [1] és un terme originari de Gertrude Stein per descriure els que van lluitar a la Primera Guerra Mundial. La generació perduda es defineix com la cohort nascuda del 1883 al 1900 que va arribar a la majoria d'edat durant la Primera Guerra Mundial i els anys vint.[2] La Gran generació o "generació GI", [3] inclou els veterans que van lluitar a la Segona Guerra Mundial.

column1: Journalist Tom Brokaw wrote about American members of this cohort in his book The Greatest Generation, which popularized the term.[36] The Silent Generation, also known as the "Lucky Few", is the cohort who came of age in the post–World War II era.
column2: Van néixer del 1901 al 1927. [4] La generació Interbellum van arribar a la majoria d'edat durant els anys vint, mentre que els IG més joves van arribar a la majoria d'edat durant la Gran Depressió i la Segona Guerra Mundial.

column1: They were born from 1928 to 1945.[37][38] In the U.S., this group includes most of those who may have fought the Korean War and many of those who may have fought during the Vietnam War. Baby boomers, also known as the Me Generation, are the people born following World War II from 1946 to 1964.
column2: El terme s'utilitza sobretot als Estats Units.[5] La generació silenciosa és la cohort que va arribar a la majoria d'edat a l'època posterior a la Segona Guerra Mundial. Van néixer del 1928 al 1945.

column1: Increased birth rates were observed during the post–World War II baby boom, making them a relatively large demographic cohort.[39][40] In the U.S., many older boomers may have fought in the Vietnam War or participated in the counterculture of the 1960s, while younger boomers (or Generation Jones) came of age in the "malaise" years of the 1970s.[41] Generation X (or Gen X for short) is the cohort following the baby boomers.
column2: [6] [7] Els baby boomers, també coneguts com la generació EM, són les persones nascudes després de la Segona Guerra Mundial del 1946 al 1964. Es va observar un augment de la natalitat durant el baby boom de la segona guerra mundial, cosa que els va convertir en una cohort demogràfica relativament gran.[8] [9] [10] La generació X és la cohort que segueix els baby boomers.

column1: The generation is generally defined as people born between 1965 to 1980.[42] The term has also been used in different times and places for a number of different subcultures or countercultures since the 1950s. In the U.S., some called Xers the "baby bust" generation because of a drop in birth rates following the baby boom.[43] Millennials, also known as Generation Y[44] (or Gen Y for short), are the generation following Generation X who grew up around the turn of the 3rd millennium.
column2: La generació es defineix generalment com a persones nascudes entre 1965 i 1980. [11] El terme també s'ha utilitzat en diferents èpoques i llocs per a diverses subcultures o contracultures diferents des dels anys cinquanta.[12] Els millennials, també coneguts com a generació Y [13] són la generació següent a la generació X que va créixer al final del tercer mil·lenni.

column1: The generation is widely accepted as having been born between 1981 and 1996.[45] According to the Pew Research Center, Millennials surpassed the Baby Boomers in U.S. numbers in 2019, with an estimated 71.6 million Boomers and 72.1 million Millennials.[46] Generation Z (or Gen Z for short), also known as Zoomers,[47] are the people succeeding the Millennials.
column2: És àmpliament acceptat que pertanyen a aquesta generació les persones nascudes entre el 1981 i el 1996.[14] La generació Z, també coneguda com Zoomers, [15] és la gent que succeeix als Millennials. Normalment, els investigadors i els mitjans de comunicació apunten que són nascuts entre la meitat de la dècada de 1990 i principis de la dècada de 2010.

column1: Researchers and popular media typically use the mid-to-late 1990s as starting birth years and the early 2010s as ending birth years. Pew Research Center specifies the years 1997 to 2012.[48] Generation Alpha (or Gen Alpha for short) is the one succeeding Generation Z. Researchers and popular media typically use the early 2010s as starting birth years and the mid-2020s as ending birth years.
column2: El Pew Research Center especifica els anys 1997 a 2012.[16] La generació Alfa succeeix a la generació Z. Els investigadors i els mitjans de comunicació utilitzen els primers anys de la dècada del 2010 com a anys inicials de naixement i mitjans de la dècada del 2020 com a anys finals del naixement.

column1: Generation Alpha is the first to be born entirely in the 21st century.[49] As of 2015, there were some two-and-a-half million people born every week around the globe, and Gen Alpha is expected to reach two billion in size by 2025.[50]
column2: La generació Alfa és la primera que neix completament al segle XXI.[17] A partir del 2015, hi havia uns dos milions i mig de persones nascudes cada setmana a tot el món, i s'espera que el Gen Alpha arribi als dos mil milions el 2025. [18]

column1: The word generate comes from the Latin generāre, meaning "to beget".[2] The word generation as a group or cohort in social science signifies the entire body of individuals born and living at about the same time, most of whom are approximately the same age and have similar ideas, problems, and attitudes (e.g., Beat Generation and Lost Generation).[3]
column2: La paraula generar prové del llatí generāre, que significa "engendrar".[1] La paraula generació com a grup o cohort en ciències socials significa tot el cos d'individus nascuts i que viuen al mateix temps, la majoria dels quals tenen aproximadament la mateixa edat i tenen idees, problemes i actituds similars (per exemple, generació beat i generació perduda).[2]

column1: Five generations of one Armenian family—a child with her mother, grandmother, great-grandmother and great-great-grandmother. (photograph dated from book published in 1901)
column2: Cinc generacions d'una família armènia: un nen amb la seva mare, àvia, besàvia i besàvia. (fotografia d'un llibre publicat el 1901)

column1: A familial generation is a group of living beings constituting a single step in the line of descent from an ancestor.[4] In developed nations the average familial generation length is in the high 20s and has even reached 30 years in some nations.[5] Factors such as greater industrialisation and demand for cheap labour, urbanisation, delayed first pregnancy and a greater uncertainty in both employment income and relationship stability have all contributed to the increase of the generation length from the late 18th century to the present.
column2: Una generació familiar és un grup d'éssers vius que constitueix un sol pas en la línia de descendència d'un avantpassat.[1] A les nacions desenvolupades, la durada mitjana de la generació familiar és de vint anys i fins i tot arriba als 30 anys en algunes nacions.[2] Factors com una major industrialització i la demanda de mà d'obra barata, la urbanització, el primer embaràs retardat i una major incertesa tant en els ingressos laborals com en l'estabilitat de les relacions han contribuït a l'augment de la durada de la generació des de finals del segle XVIII fins a l'actualitat.

column1: These changes can be attributed to social factors, such as GDP and state policy, globalization, automation, and related individual-level variables, particularly a woman's educational attainment.[6] Conversely, in less-developed nations, generation length has changed little and remains in the low 20s.[5][7]
column2: Aquests canvis es poden atribuir a factors socials, com ara el PIB i la política estatal, la globalització, l'automatització i variables individuals, en particular el nivell educatiu de la dona.[3] Per contra, a les nacions menys desenvolupades, la durada de la generació ha canviat poc i es manté en poc més de dues dècades.[2] [4]

column1: An intergenerational rift in the nuclear family, between the parents and two or more of their children, is one of several possible dynamics of a dysfunctional family.
column2: Una fractura intergeneracional en la família nuclear, entre els pares i dos o més dels seus fills, és una de les diverses dinàmiques possibles d'una família disfuncional.

column1: Coalitions in families are subsystems within families with more rigid boundaries and are thought to be a sign of family dysfunction.[8]
column2: Les coalicions en famílies són subsistemes dins de famílies amb límits més rígids i es creu que són un signe de disfunció familiar.[1]

column1: The generation was named after the President and long-term Communist leader of Czechoslovakia, Gustáv Husák.[51] This was due to his political program to boost the growth of population.
column2: The generation was named after the President and long-term Communist leader of Czechoslovakia, Gustáv Husák.[1] This was due to his political program to boost the growth of population.

column1: Growing up in modern China, the Post-80s has been characterised by its optimism for the future, newfound excitement for consumerism and entrepreneurship and acceptance of its historic role in transforming modern China into an economic power.[52] There is also the similarly named Post-90s (Chinese: 九零后), referring to modern teenagers and college students.[citation needed] A broader generational classification would be the "one-child generation" born between the introduction of the one-child policy in 1980 and its softening into a "two-child policy" in 2013.
column2: Growing up in modern China, the Post-80s has been characterised by its optimism for the future, newfound excitement for consumerism and entrepreneurship and acceptance of its historic role in transforming modern China into an economic power.[2] There is also the similarly named Post-90s (Chinese: 九零后), referring to modern teenagers and college students. A broader generational classification would be the "one-child generation" born between the introduction of the one-child policy in 1980 and its softening into a "two-child policy" in 2013.

column1: People born post-1980s in Hong Kong are for the most part different from the same generation in mainland China.[53] The term "Post-80s" (八十後) came into use in Hong Kong between 2009 and 2010, particularly during the opposition to the Guangzhou-Hong Kong Express Rail Link, during which a group of young activists came to the forefront of Hong Kong's political scene.[54] They are said to be "post-materialist" in outlook, and they are particularly vocal in issues such as urban development, culture and heritage, and political reform.
column2: People born post-1980s in Hong Kong are for the most part different from the same generation in mainland China.[3] The term "Post-80s" (八十後) came into use in Hong Kong between 2009 and 2010, particularly during the opposition to the Guangzhou-Hong Kong Express Rail Link, during which a group of young activists came to the forefront of Hong Kong's political scene.[4] They are said to be "post-materialist" in outlook, and they are particularly vocal in issues such as urban development, culture and heritage, and political reform.

column1: Some researchers have also found signs of trauma in third-generation Holocaust survivors.[55] In Germany, generations widely follow the Western world pattern but have many aspects of different Vergangenheitsbewältigung.
column2: Some researchers have also found signs of trauma in third-generation Holocaust survivors.[5] In Germany, generations widely follow the Western world pattern but have many aspects of different Vergangenheitsbewältigung.

column1: In German history the start and abolition of Gleichschaltung in mass movements (Nazi Hitlerjugend and later communist Free German Youth) also shaped generations.[citation needed] The baby boomer generation was heavily challenging their parents and relatives with their past in Nazi Germany and in World War II as well as their (individual) responsibility for the Holocaust but also the survival of the Third Reich in (West) German administration, science, legislation and culture due to claimed unsuccessful denazification.
column2: In German history the start and abolition of Gleichschaltung in mass movements (Nazi Hitlerjugend and later communist Free German Youth) also shaped generations. The baby boomer generation was heavily challenging their parents and relatives with their past in Nazi Germany and in World War II as well as their (individual) responsibility for the Holocaust but also the survival of the Third Reich in (West) German administration, science, legislation and culture due to claimed unsuccessful denazification.

column1: Later, Generation Golf (named after the VW Golf) is very similar to Generation X describing the generation that was raised in late West Germany with the specific background of the German separation, then deadlocked German question and cold-war threats.[citation needed] The East German generation which was born in the mid-eighties and later was little influenced and indoctrinated by East German Communist education system and not captured by Free German Youth.
column2: Later, Generation Golf (named after the VW Golf) is very similar to Generation X describing the generation that was raised in late West Germany with the specific background of the German separation, then deadlocked German question and cold-war threats. The East German generation which was born in the mid-eighties and later was little influenced and indoctrinated by East German Communist education system and not captured by Free German Youth.

column1: Children in the New states of Germany who were not older than seven years during German Reunification are often in a stronger cultural contrast to their parents and relatives while those who were slightly older saw a massive change in their school system, syllabi and breakdown of the youth welfare but also unexpected opportunities and chances in modern Germany.[citation needed] In Poland, two important groups with a shared generational identity are recognized: the Generation of Columbuses, who were born during the brief period of Polish independence in the interbellum and survived World War II, and the "generation of free Poland", born after the dissolution of communism in 1989.[citation needed] In Romania, all people who were born in 1989 are called the Revolution Generation because communism fell that year and Romania experienced a violent revolution that ended the communist regime of Nicolae Ceaușescu and brought democracy to Romania.[citation needed] There was also a demographic called "Decrețeii", representing those that were born during the effect of the communism regime applied Decree 770, which lasted between 1967 and 1989.
column2: Children in the New states of Germany who were not older than seven years during German Reunification are often in a stronger cultural contrast to their parents and relatives while those who were slightly older saw a massive change in their school system, syllabi and breakdown of the youth welfare but also unexpected opportunities and chances in modern Germany. In Poland, two important groups with a shared generational identity are recognized: the Generation of Columbuses, who were born during the brief period of Polish independence in the interbellum and survived World War II, and the "generation of free Poland", born after the dissolution of communism in 1989. In Romania, all people who were born in 1989 are called the Revolution Generation because communism fell that year and Romania experienced a violent revolution that ended the communist regime of Nicolae Ceaușescu and brought democracy to Romania.

column1: In Singapore, people born before 1949 are referred to as the "Pioneer Generation" for their contributions to Singapore during the nation's nascency.
column2: There was also a demographic called "Decrețeii", representing those that were born during the effect of the communism regime applied Decree 770, which lasted between 1967 and 1989.

column1: The Shin-se-dae generation are mostly free from ideological or political bias.[64] In India, generations tend to follow a pattern similar to the broad Western model, although there are still major differences, especially in the older generations.[65] One interpretation sees India's independence in 1947 as India's major generational shift.
column2: The Shin-se-dae generation are mostly free from ideological or political bias.[14] In India, generations tend to follow a pattern similar to the broad Western model, although there are still major differences, especially in the older generations.[15] One interpretation sees India's independence in 1947 as India's major generational shift.

column1: They experienced India's economic ascendance.[citation needed] In the Philippines people born before or during the Second World War (as well as those living as adults in that period) constituting an unofficial generation.
column2: They experienced India's economic ascendance. In the Philippines people born before or during the Second World War (as well as those living as adults in that period) constituting an unofficial generation.

column1: Martial Law Babies are generally defined as people born in the time period between the imposition of Martial Law by President Ferdinand Marcos on 21 September 1972 and its formal lifting in January 1981.[66] The term is sometimes extended to anyone born within Marcos' entire 21-year rule, while those born after the 1986 People Power Revolution that toppled the regime are sometimes termed "EDSA Babies".[67] In Taiwan, the term Strawberry generation refers to Taiwanese people born after 1981 who "bruise easily" like strawberries – meaning they can not withstand social pressure or work hard like their parents' generation; the term refers to people who are insubordinate, spoiled, selfish, arrogant, and sluggish in work.
column2: Martial Law Babies are generally defined as people born in the time period between the imposition of Martial Law by President Ferdinand Marcos on 21 September 1972 and its formal lifting in January 1981.[16] The term is sometimes extended to anyone born within Marcos' entire 21-year rule, while those born after the 1986 People Power Revolution that toppled the regime are sometimes termed "EDSA Babies".[17] In Taiwan, the term Strawberry generation refers to Taiwanese people born after 1981 who "bruise easily" like strawberries – meaning they can not withstand social pressure or work hard like their parents' generation; the term refers to people who are insubordinate, spoiled, selfish, arrogant, and sluggish in work.

column1: Are named and given descriptions of Russian generations: the Generation of Winners,[68] the generation of the Cold War, the generation of Perestroika, the first non-Soviet generation (the children of Perestroika, the Witnesses of Perestroika), the digital generation.[69] In Sweden, it is common to talk about people based on the decades of their births: "40-talist" (a person that was born in the 1940s), "50-talist" (a person that was born in the 1950s), etc.
column2: Are named and given descriptions of Russian generations: the Generation of Winners,[18] the generation of the Cold War, the generation of Perestroika, the first non-Soviet generation (the children of Perestroika, the Witnesses of Perestroika), the digital generation.[19] In Sweden, it is common to talk about people based on the decades of their births: "40-talist" (a person that was born in the 1940s), "50-talist" (a person that was born in the 1950s), etc.

column1: Lü Chao (March 9, 1890 – July 20, 1951), born in Xuzhou Fu, Yibin County, Sichuan, was a military and political figure in the early Republic of China's Warlord Era, active in his home province of Sichuan.
column2: Lü Chao (9 de març de 1890 – 20 de juliol de 1951), nascut a Xuzhou Fu, al comtat de Yibin, Sichuan, va ser una figura militar i política de l' era del senyor de la guerra de la República de la Xina, activa a la seva província natal, Sichuan.

column1: He is known for fighting against Liu Cunhou and the Beijing Government and being one of the strongest supporters of Sun Yat-Sen in Sichuan.
column2: És conegut per lluitar contra Liu Cunhou i el govern de Pequín i ser un dels més ferms partidaris de Sun Yat-Sen a Sichuan.

column1: As a direct subordinate of Sun Yat-Sen, Lü Chao was responsible for negotiations with political and military factions such as the Guominjun.
column2: Com a subordinat directe de Sun Yat-Sen, Lü Chao va ser responsable de les negociacions amb faccions polítiques i militars com el Guominjun .

column1: In May 1923, Lü was promoted by Sun to the Generalissimo's Chief of Staff.
column2: El maig de 1923, Sun va ser promogut per Sun al cap de gabinet del generalíssim.

column1: In June, he was appointed Commander-in-Chief of the Sichuan Anti-Thief (referring to political opponents) Army, directly leading its 1st Army.
column2: Al juny, va ser nomenat Comandant en Cap de l'Exèrcit Anti-Lladre de Sichuan (en referència als oponents polítics), dirigint directament el seu primer exèrcit.

column1: He was responsible for fighting the pro-Beijing warlords Yang Sen and Liu Xiang.
column2: Va ser el responsable de lluitar contra els senyors pro-Beijing, Yang Sen i Liu Xiang .

column1: In March 1924, Xiong Kewu was defeated.
column2: El març de 1924, Xiong Kewu fou derrotat.

column1: Lü remained in Sichuan to fight against Governor of Sichuan Yang Sen. In November 1926, Lü was appointed High Pacification Commissioner of Sichuan by the National Government, an echo of the beginning of the Northern Expedition.
column2: Lü va romandre a Sichuan per lluitar contra el governador de Sichuan Yang Sen. El novembre de 1926, Lü va ser nomenat comissari d'alta pacificació de Sichuan pel govern nacional, un ressò del començament de l' expedició del nord .

column1: After the end of the Northern Expedition, Lü Chao joined Li Zongren's New Guangxi Clique.
column2: Després del final de l'expedició del nord, Lü Chao es va unir a la nova clica de Li Zongren de Guangxi.

column1: He fought against Chiang Kai-Shek but lost.
column2: Va lluitar contra Chiang Kai-Shek però va perdre.

column1: In October 1939, Lü established the Chinese Anti-Japanese Reclamation Society in Chongqing to promote reclamation of territory from Japan.
column2: L'octubre de 1939, Lü va establir la Societat Xinesa de Recuperació Anti-Japonesa a Chongqing per promoure la recuperació del territori des del Japó.

column1: In January 1948, he started serving in the Supervisory Committee of the Control Yuan.
column2: El gener de 1948 va començar a formar part del Comitè de Supervisió del Control Yuan .

column1: In 1949, he engaged in counterespionage operations against the Chinese Communist Party.
column2: El 1949 va participar en operacions de contraespionatge contra el Partit Comunista Xinès .

column1: In 1950, he was made a member of the Southwest Military and Political Committee of the Republic of China.
column2: El 1950 fou nomenat membre del Comitè Militar i Polític del Sud-oest de la República de la Xina .

column1: Lü Chao was born to a family originating in Hunan province in 1890.
column2: Lü Chao va néixer en una família originària de la província de Hunan el 1890.

column1: He entered the first phase of the Sichuan Army Elementary School, graduating in 1909.
column2: Va entrar a la primera fase de l'escola primària de l'exèrcit de Sichuan, graduant-se el 1909.

column1: He entered the Fourth Middle School of the Army in Nanjing.
column2: Va ingressar a la quarta escola mitjana de l'exèrcit a Nanjing .

column1: During his time there, he picked up revolutionary ideals and sympathies, causing him to join the Tongmenghui.
column2: Durant la seva estada allà, va recollir ideals i simpaties revolucionaris, cosa que el va fer unir-se als Tongmenghui . A la primavera de 1910, es va unir a l' Acadèmia Militar de Baoding .

column1: In spring 1910, he joined the Baoding Military Academy.
column2: L'octubre de 1911, amb el començament de l' aixecament de Wuchang, Lü va anar a Xangai . Sota les ordres de Chen Qimei, es va dirigir cap al nord amb Li Shizeng i Wang Jingwei (aleshores conegut com Wang Zhaoming), on va fundar la sucursal Beijing-Tianjin Tongmenghui a Pequín. El febrer de 1912, sota les ordres de Yuan Shikai, la 3a divisió de l'exèrcit de Beiyang va destruir la branca Beijing-Tianjin del Tongmenghui.

column1: In October 1911, with the beginning of the Wuchang Uprising, Lü went to Shanghai.
column2: Lü va fugir de nou a Sichuan. Després de tornar a Sichuan, Lü Chao es va unir a l'exèrcit de Sichuan sota el comandament de Xiong Kewu, comandant de la 5a divisió de l'exèrcit de Sichuan.

column1: Under orders from Chen Qimei, he headed North with Li Shizeng and Wang Jingwei (then known as Wang Zhaoming), where he founded the Beijing-Tianjin Tongmenghui Branch in Beijing.
column2: El 1913, Lü va ser ascendit a comandant del 2n Regiment del 5è Exèrcit. Va participar en la Segona Revolució i va fugir a Xangai després que fracassés. Va marxar al Japó per estudiar, on es va unir a la Haoran Society .

column1: In February 1912, under the orders of Yuan Shikai the 3rd Division of the Beiyang Army destroyed the Beijing-Tianjin branch of the Tongmenghui.
column2: El 1914, mentre Sun Yat-Sen organitzava el Kuomintang al Japó, Lü s'hi va unir. Al desembre del mateix any, va tornar secretament a la Xina i va començar a participar en activitats anti-Yuan Shikai.

column1: In 1915, with the breaking out of the National Protection War, Lü Chao served as the commander of revolutionary forces in Southern Sichuan, where he fought with Cai E's 1st Division against Yuan Shikai.
column2: El 1915, amb l'esclat de la Guerra de Protecció Nacional, Lü Chao va ser el comandant de les forces revolucionàries al sud de Sichuan, on va lluitar amb la 1a divisió de Cai E contra Yuan Shikai.

column1: In June 1916, Lü was made the commander of the 58th Regiment of the 5th Division.
column2: El juny de 1916, Lü va ser nomenat comandant del 58è regiment de la 5a divisió.

column1: In February 1918, Sun Yat-Sen appointed Lü as the commander of the Sichuan Jingguojun.
column2: El febrer de 1918, Sun Yat-Sen va nomenar Lü com a comandant del Sichuan Jingguojun .

column1: Shortly after, Lü attacked Chengdu, defeating the Beijing Government-appointed military governor Liu Cunhou, expelling him from the province.
column2: Poc després, Lü va atacar Chengdu, derrotant el governador militar designat pel govern de Pequín, Liu Cunhou, expulsant-lo de la província.

column1: Xiong Kewu replaced him as military governor, with Yang Shukan as civilian governor and Lü being appointed commander of the 5th Division.
column2: Xiong Kewu el va substituir com a governador militar, amb Yang Shukan com a governador civil i Lü nomenat comandant de la 5a divisió.

column1: In 1919, Xiong Kewu started to advocate for Chinese Federalism with Chen Jiongming, Tang Jiyao, and Zhao Hengti, opposing Sun Yat-Sen.
column2: El 1919, Xiong Kewu va començar a defensar el federalisme xinès amb Chen Jiongming, Tang Jiyao i Zhao Hengti, oposant-se a Sun Yat-Sen.

column1: In April 1920, Lü Chao and other Kuomintang forces launched the "Anti-Xiong War", leading to the expulsion of Xiong Kewu from Chengdu, with Lü taking the position of commander-in-chief of the Sichuan Army.
column2: L'abril de 1920, Lü Chao i altres forces del Kuomintang van llançar la "Guerra Anti-Xiong", que va conduir a l'expulsió de Xiong Kewu de Chengdu, amb Lü ocupant el lloc de comandant en cap de l'exèrcit de Sichuan.

column1: However, Xiong and his former enemy Liu Cunhou reconciled and fought back, expelling Lü, who, in September, was defeated and fled to Shanghai.[2][3]
column2: Tanmateix, Xiong i el seu antic enemic Liu Cunhou es van reconciliar i van lluitar, expulsant a Lü, que al setembre va ser derrotat i va fugir a Xangai. [1] [2]

column1: Lu Chao (born October 9, 1988) is a Chinese baseball pitcher who plays with the Guangdong Leopards in the China Baseball League.
column2: Lu Chao (nascut el 9 d'octubre de 1988) és un llançador de beisbol xinès que juga amb els lleopards de Guangdong a la Lliga de Beisbol de la Xina. Chao va representar la Xina al Clàssic Mundial de Beisbol del 2017 . [1]

column1: Chao Lu (born 6 March 1970) is a Chinese boxer.
column2: Chao Lu (nascut el 6 de març de 1970) és un boxador xinès.

column1: He competed in the men's middleweight event at the 1992 Summer Olympics.[1]
column2: Va competir en la prova de pes mitjà masculí als Jocs Olímpics d'estiu de Barcelona del 1992. [1]

column1: Lu Chao (Chinese: 陆超) was born in 1988 in Shenyang, China.
column2: Actualment l'artista viu i treballa entre Londres i Pequín . [1] Les pintures de Lu Chao estan plenament representades en forma d'esbossos d'un gran nombre de cares diferents, evocant una sensació de misteri i d'estranyesa. [2] Per a l'artista, la incògnita és sublim i evita fer servir el seu treball com a portador d'opinions, preferint deixar la porta oberta perquè els espectadors interpretin les peces pel seu compte.

column1: The artist currently lives and works between London and Beijing.[1]
column2: [3] El seu objectiu és establir un intercanvi entre els espectadors i l'univers més gran que els envolta integrant un món en expansió en el seu propi laberint de patrons personalitzats. [4] A través de les seves obres, Lu Chao ens exposa a la incògnita i l'estranyesa de la nostra vida, del nostre món i del nostre estat d'ànim. Ens costa entendre de debò la nostra pròpia personalitat i ens resulta encara més esgotador comprendre el món que ens envolta.

column1: Excellent Sketching Award, Central Academy of Fine Art, Beijing, China
column2: Excel·lent premi de dibuix, Acadèmia Central de Belles Arts de Pequín, Xina

column1: Silver Prize, Giant Cup Today National Art Students Awards, Today Art Museum, Beijing, China
column2: Premi Plata, Giant Cup Today National Art Students Awards, Today Art Museum, Pequín, Xina

column1: China Central Academy of Fine art
column2: Acadèmia Central de Belles Arts de la Xina

column1: Lu Chao completed his Masters at the Painting Department of the Royal College of Art (London, UK) in 2014[5] and finished his Bachelor at the Central Academy of Fine Arts (Beijing, China) oil painting department in 2012.
column2: Lu Chao va completar els seus màsters al Departament de Pintura del Royal College of Art (Londres, Regne Unit) el 2014 [1] i va acabar el batxiller al Departament de pintura a l'oli de l'Acadèmia Central de Belles Arts (Pequín, Xina).
