column2: (Ed, 2002), Strategy for Business, A Reader, Sage Publications, London, 2002, , 378 pages.

column1: Mazzucato, M. (2000), Firm Size, Innovation and Market Structure: The Evolution of Market Concentration and Instability, Edward Elgar, Northampton, MA, ISBN 1-84064-346-3, 138 pages.
column2: Mazzucato, M. (2000), Firm Size, Innovation and Market Structure: The Evolution of Market Concentration and Instability, Edward Elgar, Northampton, MA, , 138 pages.

column1: Mazzucato is married to Carlo Cresto-Dina, an Italian film producer, and they have four children.[6]
column2: Mazzucato està casada amb Carlo Cresto-Dina, un productor de pel·lícula italià, i tenen quatre fills.[1]

column1: An advance tax ruling is a tool for multinational corporations and for individual taxfilers for clarifying and conforming particular taxation arrangements. A written interpretation of tax laws is issued by tax authorities to corporations and individuals who request clarification of taxation arrangements.
column2: Un acord fiscal previ, més conegut per la seva nomenclatura anglosaxona advance tax ruling és una eina per empreses multinacionals per negociar acords particulars en matèria d'impostos amb el territori on tinguin l'adreça fiscla.

column1: An advance tax ruling binds tax authorities to comply with the tax arrangements set out in the ruling.
column2: Aquest tipus d'acords obliga els estats o l'autoritat impositiva a mantenir l'acord signat amb la multinacional.

column1: Advance tax rulings are common in numerous countries.
column2: Aquest tipus d'acords són comuns a diversos països.

column1: The Luxembourg Leaks provide insight into the practice of advance tax rulings in Luxembourg used by corporations as a tool for devising strategies that help them avoid taxes.[1][2]
column2: Els LuxLeaks van demostrar que, a la pràctica, era una eïna que feien servir diverses multinacionals a Luxemburg amb l'objectiu d'evitar impostos.[1][2]

column1: On 5 March 2021, a suicide car bombing occurred outside a restaurant in Mogadishu, Somalia.[1] The attack killed at least 20 people and injured another 30.[2] Jihadist group al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.[3]
column2: El 5 de març de 2021, un cotxe bomba suïcida va explotar a fora d'un restaurant a Mogadiscio, Somàlia.[1] L'atac va deixar com a mínim 20 persones mortes i altres 30 ferides.[2] El grup gihadista al-Shabaab es va responsabilitzar de l'atac.[3]

column1: Paulette Guinchard-Kunstler (3 October 1949 – 4 March 2021) was a French politician.[1] She served on the National Assembly representing Doubs's 2nd constituency as a member of the Socialist Party.
column2: Paulette Guinchard-Kunstler (Reugney, França, 3 d'octubre de 1949 – Suïssa, 4 de març de 2021) va ser una política francesa.[1] Va servir en l'Assemblea Nacional representant la segona circumscripció de Doubs com a membre del Partit Socialista.

column1: In 2002, Guinchard-Kunstler returned to the National Assembly and became a Vice President, alongside Hélène Mignon.
column2: El 2002, Guinchard-Kunstler va tornar a l'Assemblea Nacional i es va convertir en vicepresident, al costat d' Hélène Mignon .

column1: On International Women's Day in 2005, she presided over the National Assembly and answered questions on television for one hour.
column2: El Dia Internacional de la Dona, el 2005, va presidir l'Assemblea Nacional i va respondre les preguntes a la televisió durant una hora.

column1: In 2007, she became a part of the think tank Réformer [fr], which was run by the Socialist Party.
column2: El 2007, va formar part del think tank Réformer dirigit pel Partit Socialista.

column1: She decided not to seek reelection in the 2007 French legislative election.
column2: Va decidir no buscar la reelecció a les eleccions legislatives franceses del 2007.

column1: In 2013, Guinchard-Kunstler became head of the Fondation de gérontologie.[2] She then launched with Serge Guérin [fr] the Appel pour l'équité en faveur des aidants.[3] The goal was to provide France's 10 million caregivers support and health protections.
column2: El 2013, Guinchard-Kunstler es va convertir en el cap de la Fondation de gérontologie. [1] Després va llançar amb Serge Guérin una crida per l'equitat a favor des aidants. [2] L'objectiu era proporcionar als 10 milions de cuidadors francesos assistència i protecció de la salut.

column1: She achieved the rank of Officer of the Legion of Honour on 14 April 2017.[4]
column2: Va aconseguir el rang d'oficial de la Legió d'Honor el 14 d'abril de 2017. [3]

column1: In 1983, Guinchard-Kunstler was appointed Deputy Mayor of Besançon by Robert Schwint [fr], a position she held until 1995, when she was elected to the municipal council.
column2: El 1983, Guinchard-Kunstler va ser nomenada tinent d'alcalde de Besançon per Robert Schwint, càrrec que va ocupar fins al 1995, quan va ser elegida al consell municipal .

column1: In 1997, she was elected to the National Assembly, serving in Doubs's 2nd constituency.
column2: El 1997 va ser elegida membre de l'Assemblea Nacional, representant la segona circumscripció de Doubs.

column1: In 2001, she left the National Assembly following her appointment as Secretary of State for the Elderly by Prime Minister Lionel Jospin.
column2: El 2001, va deixar l'Assemblea Nacional després del seu nomenament com a secretària d'Estat per a la Gent Gran pel primer ministre Lionel Jospin .

column1: That year, Robert Schwint announced his retirement as Mayor of Besançon.
column2: Aquell any, Robert Schwint va anunciar la seva retirada com a alcalde de Besançon.

column1: Guinchard-Kunstler's name was floated as a possibility, but Jean-Louis Fousseret obtained the Socialist Party nomination and eventually the seat.
column2: El nom de Guinchard-Kunstler va aparèixer com a possibilitat, però Jean-Louis Fousseret va obtenir la nominació del Partit Socialista i, finalment, el lloc.

column1: São João, or São João Baptista, is a former freguesia ("civil parish"), located in the municipality of Abrantes, in Santarém District, Portugal.
column2: São João, o São João Baptista, és una antiga freguesia ("parròquia civil"), situada al municipi d'Abrantes, al districte de Santarém, Portugal.

column1: In 2013, the parish merged into the new parish Abrantes (São Vicente e São João) e Alferrarede.[1] The population in 2011 was 1,699,[2] in an area of 2.21 km².[3] It was one of the three parishes that make up the urbanized area of the city.
column2: El 2013, la parròquia es va fusionar amb la nova parròquia Abrantes (São Vicente e São João) e Alferrarede.[1] La població el 2011 era de 1.699 habitants,[2] en una superfície de 2,21 km².[3] Era una de les tres parròquies que conformen la zona urbanitzada de la ciutat.

column1: Fortaleza de Abrantes (English: Fort of Abrantes)
column2: Fortalesa d'Abrantes (en English: )

column1: Igreja de Santa Maria do Castelo (English: Church of Blessed Virgin Mary of the Castle) Igreja de São João Baptista (English: Church of Saint John the Baptist) Igreja da Misercórdia (English: Church of Forgiveness) Convento de São Domingos (English: Convent of Saint Dominic)
column2: Església de Santa Maria do Castelo Església de São João Baptista Església da Misercórdia Convent de São Domingos

column1: The Festas de Abrantes (English: Festivals of Abrantes), celebrated on the second week of June and which each year attract about 250,000 visitors, are the principal socio-cultural event of the parish.
column2: Les Festas de Abrantes, celebrada la segona setmana de juny i que cada any atrau prop de 250.000 visitants, són el principal esdeveniment sociocultural de la parròquia.

column1: The religious Festa da Nossa Senhora da Boa Viagem (English: Feast/Festival of Our Lady of Good Voyage), in the locality of Barreiras do Tejo, is celebrated each year in August/September.
column2: La religiosa Festa da Nossa Senhora da Boa Viagem, a la localitat de Barreiras do Tejo, se celebra cada any a l'agost/setembre.

column1: The origin of São João has its base in the early settlement of Abrantes, first documented in 1176. Afonso Henriques granted its castle to the Order of Santiago de la Espada in 1173.
column2: L'origen de São João comença en el primer assentament d'Abrantes, documentat per primera vegada el 1176 d.C. Afons Henriques va concedir el seu castell a l'Orde de Santiago de l'Espada el 1173 d.C..

column1: Three years later, he granted its fish channel to the Monastery of Lorvão.
column2: Tres anys més tard, va concedir el seu canal de peixos al monestir de Lorvão.

column1: The grant was partly in aid of the residents, but entitled the King to nine-tenths of the catch.
column2: La subvenció va ser en part en ajut dels residents, però va donar dret al rei a nou dècimes parts de la captura.

column1: In 1179, Afonso Henriques granted a foral to Abrantes, which was confirmed by King Afonso II in 1217.
column2: El 1179, Afonso Henriques concedí un foral a Abrantes, confirmat pel rei AfonsoII el 1217.

column1: On 24 April 1281, King Denis granted Abrantes to his wife, Queen Elizabeth of Portugal.
column2: El 24 d'abril de 1281, el rei Dionís I va concedir Abrantes a la seva dona, la reina Elisabet de Portugal.

column1: He continued to expand the fort, building the detention block.
column2: Va continuar ampliant el fort, construint el bloc de detenció.

column1: With the aim of expanding the settlement, he extended its jurisdiction to include Punhete (today's Constância).
column2: Amb l'objectiu d'ampliar l'assentament, va ampliar la seva jurisdicció fins a incloure Punhete (l'actual Constância).

column1: In the 17th and 18th centuries, Abrantes was an important military base, classified a Praça de Guerra de 1.ª Ordem (English: War Plaza of the First Order).
column2: Als segles XVII i XVIII, Abrantes era una important base militar, classificada com a Praça de Guerra de 1. ª Ordem (English: ).

column1: In 1807, during the Napoleonic invasions of the peninsula, the fort and parish were a staging point for Marshall Jean-Andoche Junot's troops (23 November).[4] Later, Marshall André Masséna's forces encircled the fort and settlement, but the Anglo-Portuguese troops and local inhabitants defended the parish, until he was forced to retire from Portugal to Spain.[5]
column2: El 1807, durant les invasions napoleòniques a la península, el fort i la parròquia van ser un punt de partida per a les tropes del mariscal Jean-Andoche Junot (23 de novembre).[1] Més tard, les forces del mariscal André Masséna van encerclar la fortificació i l'assentament, però les tropes anglo-portugueses i els habitants locals van defensar la parròquia, fins que es va veure obligat a retirar-se de Portugal a Espanya.[2]

column1: The Church of Saint John the Baptist (Portuguese: Igreja de São João Baptista) was founded in 1300, by Queen Elizabeth of Portugal, and the settlement was elevated to parish rank shortly after (in 1326).
column2: L'església de Sant Joan Baptista (en portugués: Igreja de São João Baptista) va ser fundada el 1300, per la reina Elisabet de Portugal, i l'assentament va ser elevat a rang parroquial poc després (el 1326).

column1: It was from this church that King John I departed for Aljubarrota, after Mass on 8 August 1385, vowing to return and offer thanksgiving for success in battle.
column2: Va ser des d'aquesta església que el rei Joan I va partir cap a Aljubarrota, després de la missa del 8 d'agost de 1385, prometent tornar i oferir acció de gràcies per l'èxit en la batalla.

column1: With victory achieved, he returned and had a rock sculpture of John the Baptist erected.
column2: Amb la victòria aconseguida, va tornar i va fer erigir una escultura rupestre de Joan Baptista.

column1: The parish is a circular administrative division located on the northern margin of the Tagus River, at the southern border of the city of Abrantes.
column2: La parròquia és una divisió administrativa circular situada al costat nord del riu Tajo, a la frontera sud de la ciutat d'Abrantes.

column1: Neighbouring parishes include Alferrarede (to the east), Rossio ao Sul do Tejo (to the southwest), São Miguel do Rio Torto (to the southwest) and São Vicente (to the northwest).
column2: Les parròquies veïnes inclouen Alferrarede (a l'est), Rossio ao Sul do Tejo (al sud-oest), São Miguel do Rio Torto (al sud-oest) i São Vicente (al nord-oest).

column1: Erica Fawn Gimpel (born June 25, 1964) is an American actress, singer, songwriter and dancer.
column2: Erica Fawn Gimpel (Manhattan, Nova York, 25 de juny de 1964) és una actriu, cantant, compositora i ballarina nord-americana.

column1: She is best known for her roles on television shows Fame as Coco Hernandez[2] and on Profiler as Angel Brown.
column2: És coneguda sobretot pels seus papers en les sèries de televisió Fame com a Coco Hernandez [1] i Profiler com a Angel Brown.

column1: She is also known for her recurring roles on the television shows ER as Adele Newman and on Veronica Mars as Alicia Fennel.
column2: També és coneguda pels seus papers recurrents a les sèries ER com Adele Newman i a Veronica Mars com Alicia Fennel.

column1: From 2018-2020, Gimpel had a recurring role as Trisha on the series God Friended Me.
column2: Des de 2018-2020, Gimpel va tenir un paper recurrent com a Trisha a la sèrie God Friended Me.

column1: Gimpel was a judge on RTÉ One's Fame: The Musical, an Irish TV talent show seeking a boy and a girl to play Nick and Serena respectively in the Irish touring production of Fame.[3]
column2: Gimpel va ser jutge de Fame: The Musical de RTÉ One, un programa de talent de la televisió irlandesa que buscava un noi i una noia per interpretar respectivament a Nick i Serena a la producció de Fame en gira irlandesa.[1]

column1: In January 2010, Gimpel released her first CD, Spread your Wings and Fly.
column2: Al gener del 2010, Gimpel va publicar el seu primer CD, Spread your Wings and Fly.

column1: Gimpel was born in Manhattan, New York.
column2: Gimpel va néixer a Manhattan, Nova York.

column1: In 1982, she graduated from New York's High School of Performing Arts,[1] a few months after she started filming her role as a student at the same school for the television show Fame.
column2: El 1982 es va graduar a l'Escola Superior d'Arts Escèniques de Nova York,[1] uns mesos després de començar a filmar el seu paper d'estudiant a la mateixa escola per al programa de televisió Fame.

column1: She had toured the United States and Europe with her mother, singer Phyllis Bash, in the play Porgy and Bess.
column2: Havia fet gires pels Estats Units i Europa amb la seva mare, la cantant Phyllis Bash, a l'obra Porgy and Bess.

column1: Her father is Joseph Gimpel, a short story writer.
column2: El seu pare és Joseph Gimpel, un escriptor de contes.

column1: Year Title Role Notes 1990 King of New York Dr. Shute 1990 Penny Ante: The Motion Picture Dale Martinez 1991 Undertow Nina 1994 The Fence Jackie 1995 Smoke Doreen Cole 1996 Sticks & Stones Miss William 1997 Touch Me Kareen 2001 No Such Thing Judy 2003 Freaky Friday Harry's Teacher 2004 In Your Eyes Yolie 2004 Betty's Treats Mrs. Wilson Short film 2007 The List Gail 2009 Veronika Decides to Die Nurse White 2009 Blue Eyes Sandra 2010 Machete Joe Erica 2013 Tio Papi Det.
column2: Any Títol Paper Notes 1990 King of New York Dr. Shute 1990 Penny Ante: The Motion Picture Dale Martinez 1991 Undertow Nina 1994 The Fence Jackie 1995 Smoke Doreen Cole 1996 Sticks & Stones Miss William 1997 Touch Me Kareen 2001 No Such Thing Judy 2003 Freaky Friday Harry's Teacher 2004 In Your Eyes Yolie 2004 Betty's Treats Mrs. Wilson Curtmetratge 2007 The List Gail 2009 Veronika Decides to Die Nurse White 2009 Blue Eyes Sandra 2010 Machete Joe Erica 2013 Tio Papi Det.
