column1: Trevor Johnston of British film publication Sight & Sound wrote "While Sorry We Missed You may not be as sentimentally affecting as [I, Daniel Blake], it delivers a more nuanced, troubling and provocative state-of-the-nation address. As such, it’s surely among Loach and Laverty’s most sinewy efforts."[17]
column2: Trevor Johnston de la publicació sobre cinema britànic Sight & Sound va escriure "Així com Sorry We Missed You pot no ser tan intensa sentimentalment com [I, Daniel Blake], envia un missatge molt més matisat, problemàtic i actualitzada provocatiu."[1]

column1: Sorry We Missed You is a 2019 drama film directed by Ken Loach, written by Paul Laverty and produced by Rebecca O'Brien.[3][4]
column2: Sorry We Missed You és una pel·lícula dramàtica de 2019 dirigida per Ken Loach, escrita per Paul Laverty i produïda per Rebecca O'Brien.[1][2]

column1: Principal photography began in September 2018 in the Newcastle area in north-east England.[5][2][3] It was selected to compete for the Palme d'Or at the 2019 Cannes Film Festival.[6] Despite having a broken arm in a sling, Loach appeared to promote the film at Cannes, where he said that it would be his final film to compete at the festival.[7] At the 10th Magritte Awards, Sorry We Missed You received the Magritte Award for Best Foreign Film in Coproduction.[8]
column2: El rodatge va començar el setembre de 2018 en la zona de Newcastle, al nord-est d'Anglaterra.[1][2][3] Va ser seleccionat per competir per la Palma d'Or al 72è Festival Internacional de Cinema de Cannes.[4] Malgrat tenir el braç trencat en un cabestrell, Loach va aparèixer per promoure la pel·lícula a Cannes, on va dir que seria la seva última pel·lícula que competiria en un festival.[5] Als 10s Premis Magritte, Sorry We Missed You va rebre el Premi Magritte a la millor coproducció d'una pel·lícula estrangera.[6]

column1: Ricky (Kris Hitchen) and his family have been fighting an uphill struggle against debt since the 2008 financial crash.
column2: Ricky (Kris Hitchen) ha estat lluitant amb la seva família una dura lluita per un deute que té des de la crisi financera global del 2008.

column1: Ricky, who has no education or professional training, is given an opportunity when he is hired to run a franchise as a self-employed delivery driver under the supervision of the tough Maloney.
column2: A Ricky, que no té cap educació o formació professional, se li dóna una oportunitat en ser contractat per portar una franquícia com a autònom, com a conductor de lliurament, sota la supervisió de Maloney, una persona molt dura.

column1: In order to afford a van for the job, Ricky convinces his wife Abbie (who uses the car in her work as a home care nurse) to sell the family car.
column2: Per tal de permetre's una furgoneta per la feina, Ricky convenç la seva dona Abbie (que utilitza el cotxe a la seva feina com a infermera de cures a domicili) per vendre el cotxe familiar.

column1: The stress of the new job proves to be too great for Ricky.
column2: L'estrès de la feina nova acaba sent massa gran per Ricky.

column1: He is always under pressure to make his deliveries in time and is fined if he is late or makes mistakes.
column2: Es troba sempre sota pressió per fer els seus lliuraments a temps i és multat si arriba tard o comet equivocacions.

column1: Abbie also finds her work much more demanding without a car and frequently feels upset by the lack of time she is allowed to spend with her patients due to her demanding schedule.
column2: Abbie també troba la seva feina molt més dura sense un cotxe i freqüentment se sent trastornada per la manca de temps que té per estar amb els seus pacients a causa del seu exigent horari.

column1: The stress of both Ricky and Abbie is greatly increased by their son Seb (Rhys Stone) who both skips school and often gets into trouble with graffiti.
column2: L'estrès de tots dos, en Ricky i n'Abbie, es veu augmentat pel seu fill Seb (Rhys Stone) que se salta l'escola i sovint es posa en problemes relacionats amb el graffiti.

column1: After an argument, Seb tags over the family portraits during the night.
column2: Després d'una discussió, Seb pinta sobre els retrats familiars de nit.

column1: The next morning Ricky can't find the keys to his van and blames Seb.
column2: El matí següent, Ricky no pot trobar les claus de la seva furgoneta i culpa Seb.

column1: Seb denies any wrongdoing and in the ensuing argument, Ricky hits Seb.
column2: Seb nega haver fet res i en la conseqüent discussió, en Ricky pega el seu fill.

column1: His daughter Liza Jane (Katie Proctor) later tearfully admits that she hid the keys as she blames Ricky's new job for the family's problems.
column2: La seva filla Liza Jane (Katie Proctor) admet més tard, entre llàgrimes, que va ser ella qui va amagar les claus i culpa la nova feina del Ricky dels problemes familiars.

column1: Back at work, Ricky is robbed and brutally assaulted while making his deliveries.
column2: De nou a la feina, roben i assalten brutalment en Ricky mentre feia els seus lliuraments.

column1: While Ricky is in the waiting room at hospital, Maloney phones him and explains that he is facing fines of over £1,000 as his scanner was destroyed during the robbery.
column2: Quan Ricky és a l'habitació d'espera de l'hospital, Maloney li telefona i li explica que està fent front a multes de més de 1,000£ ja que el seu lector de codis de barres va ser destruït durant el robatori.

column1: After the assault, Seb finally warms up and re-joins the family.
column2: Després de l'agressió, Seb finalment fa pinya i es re-uneix amb la família.

column1: The film ends as Ricky drives off to work, still greatly injured and in tears as his family beg him to not leave.
column2: La pel·lícula acaba amb Ricky marxant cap a la feina en cotxe, encara greument ferit, i la seva família li suplica que es quedi, entre llàgrimes.

column1: Ever Given in March 2020
column2: Ever Given al març de 2020

column1: At the time of the incident, Ever Given was travelling from Tanjung Pelepas, Malaysia, to Rotterdam, Netherlands.[20][21] She was fifth in a northbound convoy, with fifteen vessels behind her when she ran aground.[3] All crew were Indian nationals.[22]
column2: En el moment de l'incident, Ever Given viatjava des de Tanjung Pelepas, Malàisia, fins a Rotterdam (Països Baixos).[1][2] Era el cinquè d'un comboi cap al nord, amb quinze vaixells darrere seu quan va encallar.[3] Tots els tripulants eren de nacionalitat índia.[4]

column1: On 23 March 2021, at 07:40 EST (UTC+2), Ever Given was travelling through the Suez Canal when she was caught in a sandstorm.
column2: El 23 de març de 2021, a les 07:40 (hora egípcia), l'Ever Given viatjava pel canal de Suez quan es va trobar enmig d'una tempesta de sorra.

column1: The strong wind, which reached 74 km/h (40 knots), resulted in the "loss of the ability to steer the ship", causing the hull to deviate.[1][2][23] Ever Given then ran aground at the 151 km (82 nmi) mark (measured from Port Said on the Mediterranean Sea, 10 km (5.4 nmi) from Suez Port on the Gulf of Suez), and turned sideways unable to free itself, blocking the canal on both sides.[2]
column2: El fort vent, que va arribar als 74 km / h (40 nusos), va provocar la pèrdua de control del vaixell, provocant que el casc es desviés.[1][2][3] L'Ever Given va encallar a 151km del Port Said i a 10 km des del port de Suez, impossibilitant el pas de qualsevol altre vaixell.[1]

column1: Over 200 vessels on both sides of the canal were obstructed by Ever Given, including five other container ships of similar size.[24] These include 41 bulk carriers and 24 crude tankers.[25] The affected vessels represented roughly 16.9 million tonnes of deadweight.[24]. Some docked at ports and anchorages in the area, while many remained in place. The ships in the area range from small cargo vessels to large ships, including the Russian Navy Altay-class oiler Kola, which had been involved in a minor collision with bulk carrier Ark Royal earlier that day.[26][27][28][29]
column2: Més de 200 vaixells a banda i banda del canal van quedar a l'espera de solucionar l'incident, inclosos cinc vaixells portacontenidors de mida similar,[24] 41 granelistes i 24 petrolers.[1] Alguns van poder atracar a port o fondejar, mentre que molts van romandre al seu lloc.

column1: Officials plan to move two vessels from behind Ever Given to make room for the refloating operation. Fuel, ballast water, and several containers were removed from the ship to help lighten her as heavy machinery worked to dig the bow out.[30] Eight tugboats are assisting in the attempt to pull her free.[31] An excavator was also used to free the front end of the cargo ship.[32] Peter Berdowski, Chief Executive of Royal Boskalis Westminster, stated that the operation "can take days to weeks".[33]
column2: Vuit remolcadors ajuden a intentar alliberar-lo.[1] També es va utilitzar una excavadora per alliberar l'extrem frontal del vaixell de càrrega.[2] Peter Berdowski, cap executiu de Royal Boskalis Westminster, va afirmar que l'operació "pot trigar de dies a setmanes".[3]

column1: On 25 March, the Suez Canal Authority (SCA) suspended navigation through the Suez Canal until Ever Given could be refloated.[34][35]
column2: El 25 de març, l'Autoritat del Canal de Suez (SCA) va suspendre la navegació pel canal fins que es pogués reflotar l'Ever Given.[1][2]

column1: About 12 percent of total global trade moves through the Suez Canal.
column2: Al voltant del 12 per cent del comerç mundial total passa pel canal de Suez.

column1: Experts have warned that this incident will likely result in shipping delays of everyday items for customers around the world.[36] Maritime historian Sal Mercogliano told the Associated Press, "Every day the canal is closed ... container ships and tankers are not delivering food, fuel and manufactured goods to Europe and goods are not being exported from Europe to the Far East."[2][3]
column2: Els experts han advertit que aquest incident probablement provocarà retards en l'enviament d'articles quotidians per a clients de tot el món.[1] L'historiador marítim Sal Mercogliano va afirmar a Associated Press que "Cada dia que es tanca el canal ... els vaixells portacontenidors i els tancs no lliuren menjar, combustible i productes manufacturats a Europa i no s'exporten mercaderies des d'Europa cap a l'extrem orient".[2][3]

column1: To mitigate shortages of goods in the long term, future shipments can be ordered earlier than normal until the difference has been made up.[38][11] However, a consultant at another firm noted that even a short-term disruption at the Suez Canal would have a domino effect for several months along the supply chain.[39]
column2: Lloyd's List calcula que cada dia que passa té un cost estimat de 9.000 milions de dòlars en mercaderies.[1][2] Michael Lynch, president de Strategic Energy & Economic Research, va atribuir l'augment del preu del petroli a l'accident.[3] Els experts van assenyalar que fins i tot una interrupció de pocs dies pot tenir efecte dominó durant diversos mesos al llarg de la cadena de subministrament.[4]

column1: On 23 March 2021 at 07:40 Eastern European Time (UTC+2), a 400-metre-long (1,300 ft) container ship, Ever Given, ran aground in the Suez Canal in Egypt, causing the 2021 Suez Canal obstruction.[2] The ship was buffeted by a sandstorm and blown by strong winds of up to 74 kilometres per hour (40 knots), causing her to be knocked off course.[3] The vessel ran aground on one of the canal's banks and became stuck, completely obstructing the canal and preventing any vessels from passing through.[4]
column2: El 23 de març de 2021 a les 07:40 (hora egípcia) l'Ever given, un vaixell portacontenidors, va encallar al canal de Suez a Egipte, provocant l'obstrucció del canal de Suez.[1] El vaixell es va trobar en mig d'una tempesta de sorra i amb vents de fins a 74 kilometres per hour (40 knots), desviant la seva trajectòria.[2] El vaixell va encallar en una de les ribes del canal i es va quedar atrapat, obstruint completament el canal i impedint el pas de qualsevol vaixell.[3]

column1: The alternative route for maritime traffic between Asia and Europe is around the African continent, a trip of around 9,000 km (4,900 nmi) and taking around 10 days.[40]
column2: La ruta alternativa per al trànsit marítim entre Àsia i Europa és al voltant del continent africà, un viatge d'uns 9.000 km i uns 10 dies.[1]

column1: By the day after the grounding, at least 15 other vessels were being held at anchorages and some 200 ships were queueing to pass through the canal while the situation is being resolved.[5][6][7] As of 26 March 2021[update], the vessel is still stuck in the canal.[8] The obstruction is well south of the section of the canal that has two channels, so there is no way for other ships to bypass Ever Given.[9]
column2: L'endemà, almenys 15 vaixells van haver de fondejar al canal i uns 200 van fer cua mentre es resol la situació.[1][2][3] L'obstrucció es troba al sud del tram del canal que té dos canals, de manera que no hi ha manera que altres vaixells puguin passar. [4]

column1: The Alba Party is a Scottish nationalist party in Scotland, founded by Laurie Flynn[1] and publicly launched by Alex Salmond on 26 March 2021.[2][3] The party announced plans to stand in the 2021 Scottish Parliament election.[3]
column2: El partit Alba és un partit nacionalista escocès a Escòcia, fundat per Laurie Flynn[1] i llançat públicament per Alex Salmond el 26 de març de 2021.[2][3] El partit va anunciar els seus plans per presentar-se a les eleccions al Parlament escocès del 2021.[3]

column1: Salmond was twice leader of the Scottish National Party (SNP; 1990-2000, 2004-2014) and the first First Minster of Scotland (2007-2014).
column2: Salmond va ser dues vegades líder del Partit Nacional Escocès (SNP; 1990-2000, 2004-2014) i el primer Primer Ministre d'Escòcia (2007-2014).

column1: His deputy and successor as First Minister and successor of his second period as leader of the SNP was Nicola Sturgeon.
column2: El seu diputat i successor com a primer ministre i successor del seu segon període com a líder del SNP va ser Nicola Sturgeon.

column1: From 2018-2021, there were tensions between Salmond and the current SNP leadership arising from allegations of sexual misconduct against Salmond and the subsequent mishandling of the Scottish Government's investigation into these.
column2: Des del 2018-2021, hi ha hagué tensions entre Salmond i l'actual direcció de l'SNP derivada de les denúncies de mala conducta sexual contra Salmond i la posterior manipulació indeguda de la investigació del govern escocès sobre el cas.

column1: A Scottish Parliament investigation into events, the Committee on the Scottish Government Handling of Harassment Complaints, was critical of the SNP Government's actions, reporting on 23 March 2021.
column2: El Committee on the Scottish Government Handling of Harassment Complaints del Parlament escocès va indestigar els fets, i va criticar les accions del govern de l'SNP, informant-ne el 23 de març de 2021.

column1: Flynn registered the party in January 2020, but handed over leadership to Salmond.[1]
column2: Flynn va registrar el partit el gener del 2020, però va lliurar el lideratge a Salmond.[1]

column1: The party announced plans to stand at least 4 candidates for the list vote in every region in the 2021 Scottish Parliament election.[1] Intended candidates are Salmond, Chris McEleny, Eva Comrie and Cynthia Guthrie.[2]
column2: El partit va anunciar els seus plans per presentar almenys 4 candidats a la llista a totes les regions a les eleccions al Parlament escocès del 2021.[1] Els candidats previstos serien Salmond, Chris McEleny, Eva Comrie i Cynthia Guthrie.[2]

column1: Original video of Forward, Comrades on Tudou Video with Russian subtitles on YouTube Forward, Comrades (2013) entry at Douban
column2: Video original de Forward, Camarades a Tudou Video with Russian subtitles

column1: The film has been uploaded onto YouTube and various domestic Russian websites with Russian subtitles and even a Russian dub, sparking a heated debate amongst various Russian internet users reflecting on the Soviet Union's legacy.[4]
column2: La pel·lícula s'ha penjat a YouTube i a diversos llocs web russos, amb subtítols i fins i tot una versió doblada, havent-s'hi produit novament debats entre els internautes. [1]

column1: Forward, Comrades (Russian: Вперед, товарищи; Chinese: 前进，达瓦里希; pinyin: Qiánjìn, dáwǎlǐxī; lit. 'Advance, tovarish') is a 2013 Chinese animated short film by Wang Liyin of the Beijing Film Academy.
column2: Endavant, camarades ( Russian ; Chinese 'Advance, tovarish ' ) és un curtmetratge d'animació xinés del 2013, realitzat per Wang Liyin de l'Acadèmia del Cinema de Beijing.

column1: The film focuses on the fall of the Soviet Union as its main theme, told from the perspective of a young girl.
column2: La pel·lícula se centra en la caiguda de la Unió Soviètica com a tema principal, explicada des de la perspectiva d'una xiqueta.

column1: As an original net animation with a strong political backdrop, the film has triggered strong reactions from various audiences.
column2: Com a animació en xarxa original amb un fort context polític, la pel·lícula va provocar reaccions de diversos públics.

column1: Set within the later era of the Soviet Union, the protagonist is an unnamed young girl who lives in a tattered bungalow alongside various domesticated animals, and likes to play with construction blocks.
column2: Situada en l'era posterior a la caiguda de la Unió Soviètica, la protagonista és una jove sense nom que viu en un bungalow estratxat juntament amb diversos animals domesticats i li agrada jugar amb blocs de construcció.

column1: She is friends with a cat named Comrade Vladimir (弗拉基米尔同志), a chicken named Comrade Felix (菲里克斯同志), and a duck named Comrade Beriya (贝利亚同志).
column2: És amiga d'un gat anomenat camarada Vladimir, d'un pollastre anomenat camarada Fèlix i d'un ànec anomenat camarada Beriya.

column1: Her mother is described as a schoolteacher "within our socialist motherland", who informs her that although their work is not supported by everybody, they cannot negate the merits of such work, and that their belief will never be effaced.
column2: Sa mare és descrita com a mestra d'escola dins de la nostra pàtria socialista, que li diu que, encara que el seu treball no rep el suport de tothom, ningú no pot negar els mèrits de la seua idea, per la qual cosa el seu pensament mai no s'ensorrarà.

column1: They have all betrayed us." Running away from home at night, the girl runs towards where her old bungalow is located, only to be blinded by a nuclear flash, and visions of the Soviet Red Army in the form of animals. As she sheds a tear and salutes, Felix, long dead and in military attire, passes her the note with the important command, to which she unfolds and reads: "Вперед, товарищи" (forward, comrades).
column2: Al final sa mare li regala joguets americans, mentre la televisió en color mostra el discurs històric de Mikhail Gorbatxov dissolent formalment la Unió Soviètica, en una metàfora de l'ensorrament de la URSS.

column1: Response to the film has largely been polarized. Commentary in China for both sides in favour and against the film have hotly debated the imagery and symbology, which is largely considered to reflect the disintegration of the Soviet Union and the fall of socialism.
column2: La pel·lícula tingué una recepció polaritzada entre els internautes xinesos, amb comparacions entre el desenvolupament del comunisme a la Xina en contrast amb el de la URSS,[1] D' i crítiques per blanquejar episodis de la història de Rússia com el terror vermell i d'altres excessos.

column1: Pronunciation is the way in which a word or a language is spoken.
column2: La pronunciació és la forma en què es parla un llenguatge.

column1: This may refer to generally agreed-upon sequences of sounds used in speaking a given word or language in a specific dialect ("correct pronunciation") or simply the way a particular individual speaks a word or language.
column2: Això pot referir-se tant a seqüències de sons generalment acordades que s'utilitzen en dir una paraula o un idioma determinats en un dialecte específic ("pronunciació correcta") o simplement la manera en què un individu en concret parla una paraula o un idioma.

column1: The Beijing Spectrometer III (BES III) is a particle physics experiment at the Beijing Electron–Positron Collider II (BEPC II) at the Institute of High Energy Physics (IHEP).
column2: BES III (Espectròmetre de Pequin III, en les seves sigles en anglès) és un experiment de física de partícules que es troba al col·lisionador electró-positró de Beijing (BEPC II) a l'Institut de Física d'Altes Energies (IHEP) d'aquesta ciutat.

column1: It is designed to study the physics of charm, charmonium, and light hadron decays.
column2: L'experiment és dissenyat per a estudiar la física del quark encant, charmonium, i desintegracions d'hadrons lleugers.

column1: It also performs studies of the tau lepton, tests of QCD, and searches for physics beyond the Standard Model.[1] The experiment started collecting data in the summer of 2008.
column2: També realitza estudis del leptó tau, de la teoria de la interacció forta (QCD), i cerques de física més enllà del Model Estàndard.[1] L'experiment va començar a recollir dades a l'estiu de 2008.

column1: BES III receives electron–positron collisions from BEPC II: a circular collider with a circumference of 240 m. BEPC II maintains a variable collision energy between 2 and 4.63 GeV, with a luminosity of 1033 cm−2·s−1. Each of the beams contains 93 electron or positron bunches of length 1.5 cm and a total current of 0.91 A.[2]
column2: El detector BES III analitza col·lisions electró–positró generades pel col·lisionador circular BEPC II amb una circumferència de 240 m) amb energies de col·lisió variable entre 2 i 4.63 GeV al centre de masses, i amb lluminositats de 1033 cm−2·s−1.[1]

column1: The BES III detector is a cylindrically symmetric 6-meter long and 7-meter diameter detector surrounding the interaction point of 2 beam pipe rings.
column2: El detector del BES III és un cilindre simètric de 6-metres de llarg i un diàmetre de 7 metres, envoltant el punt d'interacció a la intersecció dels feixos dels 2 anells de BEPC II.

column1: It has 4 major detector layers: a main drift chamber (MDC), time-of-flight counter (TOF), cesium-iodide electromagnetic calorimeter (CsI EMC), and a muon counter (Muon Chamber, MC, µC).[3] The inner three layers are inside of a 1 Tesla superconducting solenoid magnet.
column2: Està format de 4 capes de detector: una cambra de deriva principal (MDC), un comptador de temps-de-vol (TOF), un calorímetre electromagnètic de iodur de cesi (CsI EMC), i un comptador de muons (Cambra de Muóns, MC, µC).[1] Les tres capes interiors de la cambra de deriva són dins d'un imant de solenoide superconductor d'1 Tesla.

column1: Sigismund made Vlad a first-class member of the Order of the Dragon (a chivalric order established by Sigismund) in Nuremberg on 8 February 1431.[9] Other first-class members included Alfonso V of Aragon and Vytautas, Grand Duke of Lithuania.[9] The dragon-shaped badge of the order gave rise to his Romanian sobriquet, Dracul ("the Dragon"), for which his sons became known as Dracula ("son of Dracul").[9][10] Vlad swore fealty to Sigismund who declared him the lawful prince of Wallachia.[11] Vlad had to promise that he would protect the Roman Catholic Church.[11] However, Sigismund did not assist him to seize Wallachia.[2] In the summer, Vlad's half-brother, Alexander I Aldea, invaded Wallachia with Moldavian support and dethroned Dan II.[12]
column2: Sigismund va fer de Vlad un membre de primera classe de l'Ordre del Drac (un ordre cavalleresc establert per Sigismund) a Nuremberg el 8 de febrer de 1431. [9] Altres membres de primera classe van ser Alfons V d'Aragó i Vytautas, gran duc de Lituània. [9] La insígnia en forma de drac de l'ordre va donar lloc al seu sobriquet romanès, Dracul ("el drac"), pel qual els seus fills es van conèixer com Dràcula ("fill de Dràcul").

column1: Vlad did not abandon his claim to Wallachia and settled in Transylvania.[13][14] A Neo-Renaissance mural in a three-storey house in the main square of Sighișoara (which was uncovered on the 500th anniversary of the death Vlad Dracul's son, Dracula) may depict Vlad Dracul after an original painting, according to Radu Florescu.[15] The mural depicts a corpulent man with oval-shaped eyes and long moustaches wearing a white turban.[16]
column2: Vlad no va abandonar la seva demanda de Valàquia i es va establir a Transsilvània.[13] [14] Un mural neorenaixentista en una casa de tres plantes a la plaça principal de Sighișoara (que es va descobrir en el 500è aniversari de la mort, el fill de Vlad Dracul, Dràcula), pot representar a Vlad Dracul després d'una pintura original, segons a Radu Florescu.[15] El mural representa un home corpulent amb ulls de forma ovalada i llargs bigotis amb un turbant blanc.[16]

column1: Alexander Aldea went to Adrianople to do homage to the Ottoman Sultan, Murad II, in 1432.[13] Vlad wanted to invade Wallachia with the support of Wallachian boyars (or noblemen) who had fled to Transylvania, but Alexander Aldea's principal official, Albu, prevented the invasion.[13] Sigismund authorized Vlad to buy weapons and muster an army of exiled boyars only in 1434.[17] In 1435, Alexander Aldea fell seriously ill and never recovered.[18] Taking advantage of his brother's illness, Vlad broke into Wallachia, but Alexander Aldea and his Ottoman allies forced him to retreat.[18]
column2: Alexander Aldea va anar a Adrianòpolis per fer un homenatge al sultà otomà, Murad II, el 1432.[13] Vlad va voler envair Valàquia amb el suport de boards valacs (o nobles) que havien fugit a Transsilvània, però el principal funcionari d'Alexander Aldea, Albu, va evitar la invasió.[13] Sigismund va autoritzar Vlad a comprar armes i reunir un exèrcit de boixos exiliats només el 1434.[17] El 1435, Alexander Aldea va caure greument malalt i mai es va recuperar.[18] Aprofitant la malaltia del seu germà, Vlad va irrompre a Valàquia, però Alexander Aldea i els seus aliats otomans el van obligar a retirar-se.[18]

column1: Lands ruled around 1390 by Vlad Dracul's father, Mircea I of Wallachia
column2: Terres governades cap al 1390 pel pare de Vlad Dracul, Mircea I de Valàquia

column1: Alexander Aldea died in autumn 1436, enabling Vlad Dracul to seize Wallachia with Hungarian support.[18][14][19] He did not dismiss his predecessor's officials with the exception of Albu, who thus became his enemy.[20] Vlad did not confirm the treaty that Alexander Aldea had concluded with the Ottomans, provoking an Ottoman incursion against Wallachia in November.[18]
column2: Alexander Aldea va morir a la tardor de 1436, cosa que va permetre a Vlad Dracul apoderar-se de Valàquia amb el suport hongarès.[18] [14] [19] No va acomiadar els oficials del seu predecessor a excepció d'Albu, que es va convertir així en el seu enemic.[20] Vlad no va confirmar el tractat que Alexander Aldea havia conclòs amb els otomans, provocant una incursió otomana contra Valàquia al novembre.[18]

column1: Vlad's patron, Sigismund of Luxembourg, died on 9 December 1437.[21][22][23] Sigismund's death and the uprising of the Transylvanian peasants weakened Hungary, forcing Vlad to seek reconciliation with the Ottoman Empire.[22] He went to Edirne and swore fealty to Murad II.[22] He also promised to pay a yearly tribute to the sultan and to support the Ottomans' military campaigns at the sultan's order.[22][23] Before long, Murad II decided to invade Hungary and gathered his troops at Vidin.[24]
column2: [21] [22] [23] La mort de Sigismund i la insurrecció dels camperols transsilvans van debilitar Hongria, obligant Vlad a buscar la reconciliació amb l'Imperi otomà. [22] Va anar a Edirne i va jurar fidelitat a Murad II. [22] També es va comprometre a rendir un homenatge anual al sultà i a donar suport a les campanyes militars dels otomans a l'ordre del sultà.

column1: Albert of Habsburg (who was Sigismund of Luxembourg's son-in-law and successor)[25] wrote a letter to Vlad, ordering him to protect Transylvania.[24] Ignoring the king's command, Vlad joined Murad II who came to Wallachia at the head of his army in summer 1438, serving the sultan as his guide.[26] The Ottoman and Wallachian troops broke into Hungary at Orșova.[24] They routed the army of a local Vlach kenez, Cândea, near Hațeg.[22][27] They marched along the river Mureș, capturing Câlnic and Sebeș.[22] At Sebeș, Vlad convinced the leaders of the town to give in without resistance, promising to protect their property if they accompanied him to Wallachia.[27][28] The Ottomans and Wallachians laid siege to Sibiu, but the siege lasted only for 8 days.[22] They destroyed the outskirts of Brașov, before they left Hungary loaded with plunder and taking more than 30,000 captives.[22][29][27]
column2: Albert d'Habsburg (que era gendre i successor de Sigismund de Luxemburg) [25] va escriure una carta a Vlad, ordenant-li que protegís Transsilvània. [24] Ignorant l'ordre del rei, Vlad es va unir a Murad II, que va arribar a Valàquia al capdavant del seu exèrcit l'estiu de 1438, servint al sultà com a guia. [26] Les tropes otomanes i valaques van irrompre a Hongria a Orșova.

column1: After the Ottoman army left Wallachia, Vlad offered Albert of Habsburg to set the burghers who had been captured at Sebeș free, but the king (who regarded them traitors) refused his offer.[30] Vlad's attempts to maintain a balance between Hungary and the Ottomans made both the king and the sultan suspicious about his true intentions.[30] Albert allowed a pretender to the Wallachian throne, Basarab (who was a son of Dan II) to settle in Hungary.[30] The Ottomans strengthened the fortress of Giurgiu and sent new troops to garrison the town.[31]
column2: Després que l'exèrcit otomà abandonés Valàquia, Vlad va oferir a Albert d'Habsburg la llibertat dels burgesos que havien estat capturats a Sebeș, però el rei (que els considerava traïdors) va rebutjar la seva oferta. [30] Els intents de Vlad de mantenir un equilibri entre Hongria i els otomans van fer sospitar tant al rei com al sultà les seves veritables intencions. [30] Albert va permetre que un pretendent al tron valac, Basarab (que era fill de Dan II), s'establís a Hongria.

column1: Vlad II (Romanian: Vlad al II-lea), also known as Vlad Dracul (Vlad al II-lea Dracul) or Vlad the Dragon (before 1395 – November 1447), was Voivode of Wallachia from 1436 to 1442, and again from 1443 to 1447.
column2: Vlad II (en Romanian), també conegut com a Vlad Dracul (Vlad al II-lea Dracul) o Vlad el drac (abans de 1395 - novembre de 1447), va ser voivoda de Valàquia de 1436 a 1442, i de nou de 1443 a 1447.

column1: He is internationally known as the father of Vlad the Impaler, or Dracula.
column2: És conegut internacionalment com el pare de Vlad l'Impalador o Dràcula.

column1: Born an illegitimate son of Mircea I of Wallachia, he spent his youth at the court of Sigismund of Luxembourg, who made him a member of the Order of the Dragon in 1431 (hence his sobriquet).
column2: Nascut fill il·legítim de Mircea I de Valàquia, va passar la seva joventut a la cort de Sigismund de Luxemburg, que el va convertir en membre de l'Orde del Drac el 1431 (d'aquí el seu sobrenom).

column1: Sigismund also recognized him as the lawful voivode of Wallachia, allowing him to settle in nearby Transylvania.
column2: Sigismund també el va reconèixer com el voivoda lícit de Valàquia, cosa que li va permetre establir-se a la propera Transsilvània.

column1: Vlad could not assert his claim during the life of his half-brother, Alexander I Aldea, who acknowledged the suzerainty of the Ottoman Sultan, Murad II.
column2: Vlad no va poder afirmar la seva afirmació durant la vida del seu germanastre, Alexandre I Aldea, que va reconèixer la sobirania del sultà otomà, Murad II.

column1: Albert of Habsburg died on 27 October 1439.[32] The majority of the Hungarian noblemen elected Władysław III of Poland king in early 1440.[33] Władysław made the talented military commander, John Hunyadi, voivode of Transylvania in February 1441.[34] Hunyadi who decided to restore the influence of Hungary in Wallachia ordered the burghers of Brașov to mint coins for Vlad around 15 October.[35] Two or three weeks later, Hunyadi came to Târgoviște to meet Vlad, demanding him to join a crusade against the Ottoman Empire.[35][36]
column2: Albert d'Habsburg va morir el 27 d'octubre de 1439.[32] La majoria dels nobles hongaresos van escollir rei Władysław III de Polònia a principis de 1440.[33] Władysław va fer del talentós comandant militar, John Hunyadi, voivode de Transsilvània el febrer de 1441.[34] ] Hunyadi, que va decidir restablir la influència d'Hongria a Valàquia, va ordenar als burgesos de Brașov que encunyessin monedes per Vlad cap al 15 d'octubre.[35] Dues o tres setmanes després, Hunyadi va venir a Târgoviște per trobar-se amb Vlad, exigint-li que s'unís a una croada contra l'Imperi otomà.[35] [36]

column1: After Hunyadi defeated the Ottomans in Transylvania in March 1442,[37] the Ottoman governor of Bulgaria accused Vlad of treachery, according to the contemporaneous Ottoman historian, Neşri.[38][39] Murad summoned Vlad to Edirne to demonstrate his loyalty.[38] Before departing, Vlad made his eldest son, Mircea, the ruler of Wallachia.[38] Soon after he came to Edirne, he was captured at the sultan's command.[38] He was held in captivity in Gallipoli.[38]
column2: Després que Hunyadi derrotés els otomans a Transsilvània el març de 1442, [37] el governador otomà de Bulgària va acusar Vlad de traïció, segons l'historiador otomà contemporani, Neşri. [38] [39] Murad va convocar a Vlad a Edirne per demostrar la seva lleialtat. [38] Abans de marxar, Vlad va nomenar el seu fill gran, Mircea, el governant de Valàquia.

column1: Vlad Dracul's son, Vlad the Impaler (or Dracula)
column2: El fill de Vlad Dracul, Vlad Țepeș l'empalador (o Dràcula)

column1: Murad sent Hadım Şehabeddin, Beylerbey (or governor) of Rumelia, to annex Wallachia in August 1442.[40] Hunyadi annihilated the Ottoman army in the Carpathian Mountains in September,[37] and made Vlad's cousin, Basarab, voivode of Wallachia.[38] Before the end of the year, Murad II released Vlad.[38] Vlad had to pledge that he would not support the enemies of the Ottoman Empire and he would pay an annual tribute and send 500 Wallachian boys to serve as janissaries in the sultan's army.[39] He was also forced to leave his two sons, Vlad and Radu, as hostages in the Ottoman Empire.[38]
column2: [40] Hunyadi va aniquilar l'exèrcit otomà a les muntanyes dels Carpats al setembre, [37] i va fer que el cosí de Vlad, Basarab, fos el voivode de Valàquia. [38] Abans de finalitzar l'any, Murad II va alliberar Vlad. [38] Vlad va haver de comprometre's que no donaria suport als enemics de l'Imperi otomà i que pagaria un tribut anual i que enviaria 500 nois valacians perquè servissin de genissaris a l'exèrcit del soldà.

column1: The circumstances of Vlad's return to Wallachia are unknown.[41] He regained his throne between March and September 1443.[41] During Hunyadi's "Long Campaign" against the Ottoman Empire, which lasted from October 1443 to January 1444,[42] Vlad remained neutral, especially because the sultan promised the release of his two sons.[41][43] In the ensuing peace negotiations between Hungary and the Ottoman Empire, Murad II was willing to release Vlad from his obligation to personally visit his court,[44] but the papal legate, Julian Cesarini, prevented the ratification of the peace treaty.[45] Instead, he urged Władysław to continue the crusade against the Ottoman Empire.[45] On the other hand, Vlad tried to dissuade Władysław III from waging war against the Ottomans, reminding him that Murad II went hunting with more retainers than Władysław had troops, according to the Polish historian, Jan Długosz.[46] Nevertheless, he sent 4,000 horsemen under the command of his son, Mircea, to fight against the Ottomans.[47]
column2: [41] [43] En les següents negociacions de pau entre Hongria i l'Imperi otomà, Murad II estava disposat a alliberar Vlad de la seva obligació de visitar personalment la seva cort, [44] però el legat papal, Juli Cesarini, va impedir la ratificació del tractat de pau. [45] En lloc d'això, va instar Władysław a continuar la croada contra l'Imperi otomà. [45] D'altra banda, Vlad va intentar dissuadir a Władysław III de fer guerra contra els otomans, recordant-li que Murad II va anar a caçar amb més retenidors dels que Władysław tenia tropes, segons l'historiador polonès Jan Długosz.

column1: The crusade ended with the catastrophic defeat of the crusaders in the Battle of Varna on 10 November 1444.[46] After the battle Hunyadi wanted to return to Hungary through Wallachia, but he was captured by Wallachian soldiers at the Danube.[48] Vlad only released him after Lawrence Héderváry, Palatine of Hungary, threatened him with a war.[49] According to historian John Jefferson, Vlad held Hunyadi in captivity because he wanted to hand him over to the sultan.[49] Camil Mureşanu writes that Hunyadi was only imprisoned because the soldiers who captured him did not recognize him.[48] Historian Kurt W. Teptow says, Vlad held Hunyadi responsible for the catastrophe and almost killed him.[46] After releasing Hunyadi, Vlad gave him precious gifts and accompanied him as far as the Hungarian border.[49]
column2: [49] Camil Mureşanu escriu que Hunyadi només va ser empresonat perquè els soldats que el van capturar no el van reconèixer. [48] L'historiador Kurt W. Teptow diu que Vlad va responsabilitzar Hunyadi de la catàstrofe i gairebé el va matar. [46] Després d'alliberar Hunyadi, Vlad li va donar preciosos regals i el va acompanyar fins a la frontera hongaresa.

column1: John Hunyadi, who dethroned Vlad Dracul in 1447 (a sculpture by István Tóth in Budapest)
column2: John Hunyadi, que va destronar Vlad Dracul el 1447 (una escultura d' István Tóth a Budapest )

column1: A fleet of Burgundian crusaders attacked the Ottoman fleet on the Black Sea in the spring 1445.[50] The commander of the fleet, Walerand of Wavrin, sent envoys to Hungary to start negotiations about a joint campaign against the Ottoman Empire.[51] At Hunyadi's request, one of Wavrin's envoys, Pedro Vasque de Saavedra, visited Vlad and convinced him to meet Wavrin.[52] In July, Vlad went to Isaccea where he made an alliance with Wavrin.[52] Vlad mustered an army of 4,000–6,000 strong and placed it under the command of his son, Mircea.[53][54]
column2: Una flota de croats de Borgonya va atacar la flota otomana al mar Negre a la primavera de 1445. [50] El comandant de la flota, Walerand de Wavrin, va enviar enviats a Hongria per iniciar negociacions sobre una campanya conjunta contra l'Imperi otomà. [51] A petició d'Hunyadi, un dels enviats de Wavrin, Pedro Vasque de Saavedra, va visitar Vlad i el va convèncer de conèixer-se.

column1: The Burgundian and Wallachian army laid siege to Silistra in the middle of September, but they could not capture it.[53][46] Before long, however, they conquered and destroyed the small fort at Tutrakan.[53] Vlad convinced Wavrin to attack Giurgiu, saying that whenever the Ottomans "want to harry Wallachia or Transylvania, they and their horses can cross" the Danube near the fortified island at Giurgiu, connected to the Wallachian bank by a bridge.[53][55] During the siege of Giurgu, two iron rings of a large bombard suddenly broke, killing two soldiers, because Vlad, who was in the command of the fire, did not allow the bombard to cool down between blows.[56] The Ottoman garrison of the fortress capitulated on the condition that they were allowed to freely leave for the Ottoman Empire.[57] However, after they left the fortress, 2,000 Wallachian soldiers attacked and massacred them at Vlad's order, because he regarded the commander of the Ottoman garrison responsible for his captivity in 1442.[57]
column2: [53] [55] Durant el setge de Giurgu, de sobte es van trencar dos anells de ferro d'un gran bombardet que van matar dos soldats, perquè Vlad, que estava al comandament del foc, no va permetre que el bombardí es refredés entre cops. [56] La guarnició otomana de la fortalesa va capitular a condició que se'ls permetés marxar lliurement cap a l'Imperi otomà. [57] No obstant això, després de deixar la fortalesa, 2.000 soldats valacs els van atacar i massacrar per ordre de Vlad, perquè considerava el comandant de la guarnició otomana responsable de la seva captivitat el 1442.

column1: After Alexander Aldea died in 1436, Vlad seized Wallachia with Hungarian support.
column2: Després que Alexander Aldea morís el 1436, Vlad es va apoderar de Valàquia amb el suport hongarès.

column1: Following the death of Sigismund of Luxembourg in 1437, Hungary's position weakened, causing Vlad to pay homage to Murad II, which included participating in Murad II's invasion of Transylvania in the summer of 1438.
column2: Després de la mort de Sigismund de Luxemburg el 1437, la posició d'Hongria es va debilitar, cosa que va fer que Vlad fes un homenatge a Murad II, que incloïa la participació en la invasió de Murad II a Transsilvània l'estiu de 1438.

column1: John Hunyadi, Voivode of Transylvania, came to Wallachia to convince Vlad to join a crusade against the Ottomans in 1441.
column2: John Hunyadi, voivoda de Transsilvània, va arribar a Valàquia per convèncer Vlad de participar en una croada contra els otomans el 1441.

column1: After Hunyadi routed an Ottoman army in Transylvania, the sultan ordered Vlad to come to Edirne where he was captured in 1442.
column2: Després que Hunyadi derrotés un exèrcit otomà a Transsilvània, el sultà va ordenar a Vlad que vingués a Edirne, on va ser capturat el 1442.

column1: Hunyadi invaded Wallachia and made Vlad's cousin, Basarab II, voivode.
column2: Hunyadi va envair Valàquia i va fer voivode el cosí de Vlad, Basarab II.

column1: Before long, the Ottoman garrison at Ruse also capitulated.[58] Vlad gave asylum to more than 11,000 Bulgarians who had rebelled against the Ottomans, assisting them to cross the Danube into Wallachia.[58][59] The Burgundian crusaders and the Wallachians approached Nicopolis, where a Hungarian army under the command of John Hunyadi joined them on 14 September.[60] However, an early frost forced the crusaders to abandon the campaign in October, because they feared that the Danube would freeze over.[61]
column2: Al cap de poc temps, la guarnició otomana de Ruse també va capitular.[58] Vlad va donar asil a més d'11.000 búlgars que s'havien rebel·lat contra els otomans, ajudant-los a creuar el Danubi fins a Valàquia.[58] [59] Els croats de Borgonya i els valacs es van apropar a Nicòpolis, on un exèrcit hongarès sota el comandament de John Hunyadi es va unir a ells el 14 de setembre.[60] No obstant això, una gelada primerenca va obligar els croats a abandonar la campanya a l'octubre, perquè temien que el Danubi es congelés.[61]

column1: The relationship between Wallachia and Hungary soon deteriorated.[62] In a letter written late in 1445 to the townspeople of Brașov, Vlad complained that Wallachian merchants were arrested in Transylvania, although he had left his "little children to be butchered for Christian peace so that [he] and [his] country [could] be subjects" of the king of Hungary.[62][54] His words evidence that he was convinced that his two sons had been murdered in the Ottoman Empire, but the sultan did not harm the boys.[54] In 1446 or 1447, Vlad made peace with the Ottomans, even agreeing to return the Bulgarian refugees to the Ottoman Empire.[62][63] He intervened in the fight for the Moldavian throne in favor of Roman II of Moldavia in July 1447.[64][65] The Poles also supported Roman, but Roman's opponent, Peter II, was Hunyadi's protégé.[65]
column2: [62] En una carta escrita a finals de 1445 als habitants de Brașov, Vlad es va queixar que els comerciants valacians van ser arrestats a Transsilvània, tot i que havia deixat els seus "fills petits per ser assassinat per la pau cristiana perquè [ell] i [el seu] país [podrien] ser súbdits "del rei d'Hongria. [62] [54] Les seves paraules demostren que estava convençut que els seus dos fills havien estat assassinats a l'Imperi otomà, però el sultà no va fer mal als nois. [54] El 1446 o el 1447, Vlad va establir la pau amb els otomans, fins i tot va acordar tornar els refugiats búlgars a l'Imperi otomà.

column1: On 20 July 1447, John Hunyadi ordered the burghers of Brașov to give shelter to a pretender to the Wallachian throne, Vladislav, who was a cousin of Vlad.[64][66] Hunyadi unexpectedly broke into Wallachia in late November, taking with him Vladislav (also known as Dan).[66][67] Vlad fled from Târgoviște, but he was captured and killed in the marshes at Bălteni.[64][66][68] In a letter written on 4 December 1447, Hunyadi styled himself "voivode of the Transalpine land" (Wallachia) and referred to Târgoviște as his fortress, implying that he had taken control of Wallachia by that time.[69] Hunyadi placed Vladislav on the throne of Wallachia.[65][68]
column2: [64] [66] Hunyadi va irrompre inesperadament a Valàquia a finals de novembre, emportant-se a Vladislav (també conegut com Dan). [66] [67] Vlad va fugir de Târgoviște, però va ser capturat i assassinat als pantans de Bălteni. [64] [66] [68] En una carta escrita el 4 de desembre de 1447, Hunyadi es deia "voivoda de la terra transalpina" (Valàquia) i es referia a Târgoviște com la seva fortalesa, la qual cosa implicava que havia pres el control de Valàquia en aquell moment.

column1: The place of Vlad Dracul's burial has not been identified.[68] Cazacu says, he was most probably buried in the Monastery of Snagov.[68] Florescu writes, Vlad Dracul was buried in a chapel in the Dealu Monastery near Târgoviște.[68][70]
column2: El lloc de l'enterrament de Vlad Dracul no s'ha identificat. [68] Cazacu diu que probablement va ser enterrat al monestir de Snagov. [68] Florescu escriu que Vlad Dracul va ser enterrat en una capella del monestir de Dealu, prop de Târgoviște.

column1: According to a widely accepted scholarly theory, Vlad's wife was "Cneajna", a daughter of Alexander I of Moldavia.[15] She was called Eupraxia, according to Florescu.[70] Historian Matei Cazacu writes that she was his second wife.[68] He does not identify Vlad's first wife.[68] Vlad's descendants were known as Drăculești, because they adopted Vlad's sobriquet as their patronymic (Dracula).[11] The conflict between the Drăculești and the Dănești (the descendants of Dan I of Wallachia), and strifes between the members of the Drăculești line contributed to the political instability in 15th-century Wallachia.[72]
column2: [68] No identifica la primera dona de Vlad. [68] Els descendents de Vlad eren coneguts com a Drăculești, perquè van adoptar el sobriquet de Vlad com a patrònim (Dràcula). [11] El conflicte entre els Drăculești i els Dănești (els descendents de Dan I de Valàquia), i les disputes entre els membres de la línia Drăculești van contribuir a la inestabilitat política a la Valàquia del segle XV.

column1: Vlad's eldest sons, Mircea and Vlad Dracula, were first mentioned in a charter of Vlad on 20 January 1437.[73] Mircea was born in about 1428, Vlad between 1429 and 1431.[73] Their brother (Vlad Dracul's third son), Radu the Fair, was born before 2 August 1439.[73] Florescu writes that Vlad Dracul's daughter, Alexandra, married the Wallachian boyar Vintilă Florescu.[70] Vlad Dracul also fathered illegitimate children.[73] A Wallachian noblewoman, Călțuna, gave birth to Vlad the Monk.[73] Almost no information is known about the life of another illegitimate son, Mircea.[73]
column2: Els fills grans de Vlad, Mircea i Vlad Dracula, van ser esmentats per primera vegada en una carta de Vlad el 20 de gener de 1437. [73] Mircea va néixer al voltant de 1428, Vlad entre 1429 i 1431. [73] El seu germà (el tercer fill de Vlad Dracul), Radu el Fair, va néixer abans del 2 d'agost de 1439.

column1: Vlad was released before the end of the year but was forced to leave his two young sons as hostages in the Ottoman court.
column2: Vlad va ser alliberat abans de finals d'any, però es va veure obligat a deixar els seus dos fills petits com a ostatges a la cort otomana.

column1: He was restored in Wallachia with Ottoman support in 1443.
column2: Va ser restaurat a Valàquia amb el suport otomà el 1443.

column1: He remained neutral during Hunyadi's "Long Campaign" against the Ottoman Empire between October 1443 and January 1444, but he sent 4,000 horsemen to fight against the Ottomans during the Crusade of Varna.
column2: Va romandre neutral durant la "Llarga Campanya" d'Hunyadi contra l'Imperi Otomà entre l'octubre de 1443 i el gener de 1444, però va enviar 4.000 genets a lluitar contra els otomans durant la croada de Varna.

column1: With the support of a Burgundian fleet, he captured the important Ottoman fortress at Giurgiu in 1445.
column2: Amb el suport d'una flota borgoñona, va capturar la important fortalesa otomana a Giurgiu el 1445.

column1: He made peace with the Ottoman Empire in 1446 or 1447, which contributed to the deterioration of his relationship with Hunyadi.
column2: Va fer les paus amb l'Imperi otomà el 1446 o 1447, cosa que va contribuir al deteriorament de la seva relació amb Hunyadi.

column1: Hunyadi invaded Wallachia, forcing Vlad to flee from Târgoviște in late November, where he was killed at a nearby village.
column2: Hunyadi va envair Valàquia, obligant Vlad a fugir de Târgoviște a finals de novembre, on va ser assassinat en un poble proper.

column1: Vlad's early life is poorly documented.[1] He was born before 1395,[1] and was one of the numerous illegitimate sons of Mircea I of Wallachia.[1] Vlad's modern biographers agree that he was sent as a hostage to Sigismund of Luxembourg, King of Hungary, in 1395 or 1396.[1][2] Sigismund mentioned that Vlad had been educated at his court, suggesting that he spent his youth in Buda, Nuremberg and other major towns of Hungary and the Holy Roman Empire.[1]
column2: La primera vida de Vlad està poc documentada.[1] Va néixer abans del 1395,[1] i va ser un dels nombrosos fills il·legítims de Mircea I de Valàquia. [1] Els biògrafs moderns de Vlad coincideixen que va ser enviat com a ostatge a Sigismund de Luxemburg, rei d'Hongria, el 1395 o el 1396. [1] [2] Sigismund va esmentar que Vlad havia estat educat a la seva cort, suggerint que va passar el seu jovent a Buda, Nuremberg i altres ciutats importants d'Hongria i del Sacre Imperi Romanogermànic.

column1: Mircea I died in 1418, and his only legitimate son (and co-ruler), Michael, succeeded him.[3] Two years later, Michael died fighting against his cousin, Dan II (the son of Mircea I's elder brother, Dan I).[4] During the following decade, Dan II and Vlad's half-brother, Radu II Praznaglava, were fighting against each other for Wallachia.[5]
column2: Mircea I va morir el 1418 i el seu únic fill legítim (i co-governant), Miquel, el va succeir.[3] Dos anys després, Michael va morir lluitant contra el seu cosí, Dan II (el fill del germà gran de Mircea I, Dan I ).[4] Durant la dècada següent, Dan II i el germanastre de Vlad, Radu II Praznaglava, lluitaven entre si per Valàquia.[5]

column1: Vlad left Buda for Poland without Sigismund's authorization in early 1423, but was captured before reaching the border.[6] Before long, Sigismund acknowledged Dan II as the lawful ruler of Wallachia.[7] The Byzantine historian, Doukas, recorded that Vlad was "an officer in the army" of the Byzantine Emperor, John VIII Palaiologos, and he "had access" to the imperial palace in Constantinople.[7] Historian Radu Florescu says that Sigismund had appointed Vlad to receive John VIII (who had come to Italy to seek assistance against the Ottomans) in Venice in 1423, and Vlad accompanied the emperor back to Constantinople.[7] After realizing that John VIII could not help him to seize Wallachia, Vlad returned to Hungary in 1429.[8][2]
column2: [7] L'historiador bizantí, Doukas, va registrar que Vlad era "un oficial de l'exèrcit" de l'emperador bizantí, Joan VIII Paleòleg, i que "tenia accés" al palau imperial de Constantinoble. [7] L'historiador Radu Florescu diu que Sigismund havia nomenat Vlad per rebre Joan VIII (que havia vingut a Itàlia a buscar ajuda contra els otomans) a Venècia el 1423, i Vlad va acompanyar l'emperador a Constantinoble. [7] Després d'adonar-se que Joan VIII no podia ajudar-lo a apoderar-se de Valàquia, Vlad va tornar a Hongria el 1429.

column1: The house in the main square of Sighișoara where Vlad Dracul lived in the early 1430s
column2: La casa de la plaça principal de Sighișoara on vivia Vlad dracul a principis de la dècada de 1430

column1: Sound of Metal found its origins in the unfinished Derek Cianfrance project Metalhead, which centers on a metal drummer whose eardrums are ruptured and he becomes deaf.
column2: Sound of Metal neix de l'inacabat projecte Metalhead de Derek Cianfrance, que se centra en un bateria que té els timpans trencats i que es torna sord.

column1: The film featured the members of the band Jucifer portraying themselves.
column2: La pel·lícula presentava els membres de la banda Jucifer retratant-se.

column1: However, the project was later scrapped, until Cianfrance's friend Darius Marder took it up.[12] In January 2016, it was announced Dakota Johnson and Matthias Schoenaerts had joined the cast of the film, with Marder directing.[13] In July 2018, it was announced Riz Ahmed and Olivia Cooke had joined the cast of the film, replacing Johnson and Schoenaerts, alongside Mathieu Amalric.[14] Before the casting, Marder had spent 13 years vetting actors who would match his commitment to the film.[4]
column2: El projecte va ser desestimat més tard, fins que l'amic de Cianfrance, Darius Marder, el va assumir.[1] El gener de 2016, es va anunciar que Dakota Johnson i Matthias Schoenaerts s'havien unit al repartiment de la pel·lícula, amb la direcció de Marder.[2] El juliol de 2018, es va anunciar que Riz Ahmed i Olivia Cooke s'havien unit al repartiment de la pel·lícula en substitució de Johnson i Schoenaerts, al costat de Mathieu Amalric.[3] Abans del càsting, Marder havia passat 13 anys provant actors per a la pel·lícula.[4]

column1: A large number of the cast were hired from the deaf community.[1] For eight months, Ahmed prepared for the film by spending two hours a day learning American Sign Language, two hours a day in drum lessons, two hours a day with a personal trainer and the remainder with his acting coach.[15][17] Marder wanted Ahmed to "trust his instincts" and did not allow him to review dailies of his performance or script analysis.[15]
column2: Un gran nombre d'intèrprets contractats són sords.[1] Durant vuit mesos, Ahmed es va preparar per a la pel·lícula passant dues hores al dia aprenent la llengua de signes americana, dues hores al dia fent classes de bateria, dues hores al dia amb un entrenador personal i la resta assajant el seu paper.[2][3] Marder volia que Ahmed "confiés en els seus instints" i no li permetia revisar els diaris de la seva interpretació ni l'anàlisi del guió.[2]

column1: Sound of Metal was shot in 24 non-consecutive days during the spring, summer and fall of 2018.[18] Marder operated on a limited budget, and shot only two takes per scene.[16] The film was shot in the Greater Boston area, primarily in Ipswich, Massachusetts.
column2: Sound of Metal es va rodar en 24 dies no consecutius durant la primavera, l'estiu i la tardor de 2018.[1] Marder va treballar amb un pressupost limitat i va rodar només dues preses per escena.[2] La pel·lícula es va rodar principalment a Ipswich, Massachusetts.

column1: However, other scenes were shot in Boston, Lynn, Cambridge, Danvers, Framingham, Lawrence, Malden, Rowley, and Topsfield.[19][20] Filming also took place in Antwerp, Belgium.[18]
column2: Tanmateix, es van rodar altres escenes a Boston, Lynn, Cambridge, Danvers, Framingham, Lawrence, Malden, Rowley, Topsfield[3][4] i Anvers.[1]

column1: Riz Ahmed received widespread critical acclaim for his performance, including a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Actor.
column2: Riz Ahmed va rebre una nominació a l'Oscar al millor actor.

column1: Sound of Metal is a 2019 American drama film directed and co-written by Darius Marder and starring Riz Ahmed, Olivia Cooke, Paul Raci, Lauren Ridloff, and Mathieu Amalric.
column2: Sound of Metal és una pel·lícula dramàtica estatunidenca del 2019 dirigida i coescrita per Darius Marder i protagonitzada per Riz Ahmed, Olivia Cooke, Paul Raci, Lauren Ridloff i Mathieu Amalric.

column1: It tells the story of a heavy metal drummer who loses his hearing.
column2: Explica la història d'un bateria de heavy metal que perd l'audició.

column1: The film had its world premiere in the Platform Prize program at the 2019 Toronto International Film Festival on September 6, 2019. It was released theatrically on November 20, 2020, and began streaming on Prime Video on December 4, 2020, by Amazon Studios.
column2: La pel·lícula es va estrenar al Festival Internacional de Cinema de Toronto el 6 de setembre de 2019.[1] També es va projectar al Festival de Cinema de Zuric[2] i al Festival Internacional de Cinema de Rotterdam.[3]

column1: John DeFore of The Hollywood Reporter wrote, "Without romanticizing deafness, Sound of Metal makes a case for acceptance and for embracing the inevitability of unpredictable change."[29] David Fear of Rolling Stone praised Riz Ahmed's performance, commenting that "this film probably works best as a showcase for its star."[30] Norman Wilner of Now wrote, "The assaultive, near-experimental sound design goes a long way towards putting us in Ruben's head, but Ahmed's performance makes us understand his character with a clarity that eludes Ruben himself."[31] Eric Kohn of IndieWire gave the film a grade of A−, writing, "Ahmed's so believable that he keeps the suspense of the drama in play even as it pushes into contrived circumstances during the prolonged final act, and eventually takes a melodramatic plunge."[32]
column2: John DeFore a The Hollywood Reporter va escriure: "Sense romantitzar la sordesa, el Sound of Metal és un pretext per a l'acceptació i per abraçar la inevitabilitat d'un canvi imprevisible".[1] David Fear a Rolling Stone va elogiar l'actuació de Riz Ahmed i va comentar que "aquesta pel·lícula probablement funcioni millor com a aparador de la seva estrella".[2] Norman Wilner a Now va escriure: "El disseny de so agressiu i quasi experimental ens ajuda a posar-nos al cap de Ruben, però l'actuació d'Ahmed ens fa entendre el seu personatge amb una claredat que eludeix el mateix Ruben".[3] Eric Kohn a IndieWire va escriure: "Ahmed és tan versemblant que manté en joc el suspens del drama, fins i tot quan entra en circumstàncies artificioses durant el final prolongat i fa un salt melodramàtic".[4]

column1: Ruben is a drummer and one half of the heavy metal duo Blackgammon, along with the singer and girlfriend, Lou.
column2: Ruben és bateria i la meitat del duet de heavy metal Blackgammon, juntament amb la cantant i parella sentimental Lou.

column1: They live in an RV while driving across the United States to perform gigs.
column2: Viuen en una càmper mentre giren pels Estats Units fent concerts.

column1: When Ruben begins to suddenly lose his hearing, he goes to a pharmacy seeking a diagnosis.
column2: Quan Ruben comença a perdre l'audició de sobte, va a una farmàcia a buscar un diagnòstic.

column1: The pharmacist refers him to a doctor, who performs a hearing test and finds that Ruben can only make out 20–30 percent of words he hears and his hearing will deteriorate rapidly; moreover, although cochlear implants may benefit him, their high cost is not covered by insurance.
column2: El farmacèutic el remet a un metge, que realitza una prova auditiva i detecta que Ruben només pot distingir entre el 20 i el 30% de les paraules que escolta i la seva audició es deteriorarà ràpidament; a més, tot i que els implants coclears poden beneficiar-lo, el seu elevat cost no està cobert per l'assegurança mèdica.

column1: The doctor suggests that Ruben eliminate all exposure to loud noises and later undergo further testing, but Ruben continues to perform.
column2: El metge suggereix que Ruben elimini tota exposició a sorolls forts i se sotmeti a proves posteriors.

column1: Lou learns of Ruben's condition and wants to stop performing for his safety, but he wants to continue.
column2: Lou s'assabenta de l'estat de Ruben i vol deixar de fer concerts per la seva seguretat.

column1: Lou is also concerned about his sobriety, as he is a recovering drug addict.
column2: Lou també està preocupada per la seva sobrietat, ja que és un addicte a les drogues en procés de recuperació.

column1: They call his narcotics anonymous sponsor, Hector, who finds a rural shelter for deaf recovering addicts that accepts Ruben, run by a man named Joe, a recovering alcoholic who lost his hearing in the Vietnam War.
column2: Ruben accepta anar a una casa rural per a sords dirigit per un home anomenat Joe, un ex-alcohòlic que va perdre l'audició a la Guerra del Vietnam.

column1: Ruben leaves with Lou because they will not let her live there with him and he wants only the implants.
column2: Ruben marxa amb Lou perquè no la deixaran viure allà amb ell i ell només vol els implants.

column1: Lou, anxious for his well-being, leaves and persuades Ruben to return to the shelter.
column2: Lou, preocupada pel seu benestar, marxa i persuadeix Ruben perquè torni al refugi.

column1: Ruben begins to meet the other members of the shelter as he attends meetings and settles into his new life. He is introduced to Diane, a teacher, and the children in her class, and begins to learn American Sign Language.
column2: Ruben comença a conèixer els altres membres de la casa mentre assisteix a les reunions i s'instal·la en la seva nova vida.

column1: Joe tasks Ruben with writing endlessly and sitting peacefully in an effort to make him comfortable with the silence, and confides to him that he himself will do the same, simultaneously.
column2: Coneix Diane, una mestra i als infants de la seva classe, i comença a aprendre la llengua de signes americana.

column1: Ruben joins Diane's class and starts to connect with the children and the rest of the community. He gives the children and Diane basic drumming lessons.
column2: Ruben s'uneix a la classe de Diane i comença a connectar amb els nens i la resta de la comunitat a la vegada que els fa classes de bateria.

column1: Award Date of ceremony Category Recipient(s) Result Ref.
column2: Premi Data Categoria Recipient(s) Result Ref.

column1: Travers and McKenna received an offer to go to Hollywood to appear in The Barretts of Wimpole Street (1957).
column2: Travers i McKenna van rebre una oferta per anar a Hollywood per aparèixer a The Barretts of Wimpole Street (1957).

column1: Travers played Robert Browning and McKenna had the support part of Elizabeth Barrett Browning's sister.
column2: Travers va interpretar a Robert Browning i McKenna va comptar amb el suport de la germana d'Elizabeth Barrett Browning.

column1: The movie flopped at the box office.
column2: La pel·lícula va fallar a la taquilla.

column1: The same year, Travers and McKenna, along with Margaret Rutherford and Peter Sellers, co-starred in the comedy The Smallest Show on Earth, made back in Britain.
column2: El mateix any, Travers i McKenna, juntament amb Margaret Rutherford i Peter Sellers, van coprotagonitzar la comèdia The Smallest Show on Earth, feta a la Gran Bretanya.

column1: McKenna had another hit with Carve Her Name with Pride (1958), playing Second World War SOE agent Violette Szabo.
column2: McKenna va tenir un altre èxit amb Carve Her Name with Pride (1958), interpretant a l' agent del Special Operations Execuive (SOE) Violette Szabo a la Segona Guerra Mundial.

column1: She was nominated for another BAFTA Award and was voted the fifth most popular British star of 1958 (and the ninth most popular regardless of nationality).
column2: Va ser nominada a un altre premi BAFTA i va ser elegida la cinquena estrella britànica més popular del 1958 (i la novena més popular independentment de la nacionalitat).

column1: She and Travers were reunited in Passionate Summer (1959), then she had a support part in MGM's The Wreck of the Mary Deare (1959).
column2: Ella i Travers es van reunir en la interpretació a Passionate Summer (1959), i després va tenir un paper de suport a Misteri en el vaixell perdut (1959) de MGM.

column1: McKenna and Travers were also in Two Living, One Dead (1961), shot in Sweden.
column2: McKenna i Travers també van estar presents a Two Living, One Dead (1961), rodada a Suècia.

column1: She was in an adaptation of A Passage to India for the BBC in 1965.
column2: També va fer una adaptació de A Passage to India de la BBC el 1965.

column1: McKenna is best remembered for her 1966 role as Joy Adamson in the true-life film Born Free for which she received a nomination for a Golden Globe.
column2: McKenna és recordada sobretot pel seu paper de Joy Adamson el 1966 a la pel·lícula de la vida real Nascuda lliure per la qual va rebre una nominació als Globus d'Or .

column1: It was not only a huge success at the box office but a life changing experience for her and her husband Bill Travers who co-starred with her, portraying game warden and conservationist George Adamson.
column2: No només va ser un gran èxit a taquilla, sinó una experiència que va canviar la vida per a ella i per al seu marit Bill Travers, que va interpretar al guardaboscs conservacionista George Adamson .

column1: The experience led them to become active supporters for wild animal rights as well as the protection of their natural habitat.
column2: L'experiència els va portar a dedicar les seves vides a tenir un paper actiu vers els drets dels animals salvatges i de la protecció del seu hàbitat natural.

column1: McKenna and Travers starred in another animal-themed story, Ring of Bright Water (1969), but it failed to match Born Free's success.
column2: McKenna i Travers van protagonitzar una altra història de temàtica animalista, Ring of Bright Water (1969), però no va aconseguir l'èxit de Born Free .

column1: McKenna appeared in An Elephant Called Slowly.
column2: McKenna va aparèixer a An Elephant Called Slowly .

column1: The film features her close friend conservationist George Adamson and also elephants Eleanor (brought up by conservationist Daphne Sheldrick) and young Pole Pole.
column2: La pel·lícula comptava amb el seu amic íntim conservacionista George Adamson i els elefants Eleanor (educada per la conservacionista Daphne Sheldrick ) i el jove Pole Pole.

column1: The subsequent premature death of Pole Pole in London Zoo led to McKenna and her husband to establish Zoo Check in 1984 with their eldest son Will Travers.[13] Zoo Check was renamed Born Free Foundation in 1991.
column2: La mort prematurea de Pole Pole al Zoo de Londres va portar a McKenna i al seu marit a establir Zoo Check el 1984 amb el seu fill gran Will Travers . [1] El Zoo Check va canviar el nom per Born Free Foundation el 1991.

column1: In 1984 McKenna was involved with a protest against the poor conditions at Southampton Zoo which was closed a year later.[14]
column2: El 1984 McKenna va participar en una protesta contra les males condicions del zoo de Southampton, el qual va ser tancat un any després. [2]

column1: Virginia Anne McKenna,[1] OBE (born 7 June 1931), is an English stage and screen actress, author and wildlife campaigner.
column2: Virginia Anne McKenna, [1] OIB (nascuda el 7 de juny de 1931), és una actriu, autora i defensora de la vida salvatge anglesa.

column1: She is best known for the films A Town Like Alice (1956), Carve Her Name with Pride (1958), Born Free (1966), and Ring of Bright Water (1969), as well as her work with The Born Free Foundation.[2]
column2: És coneguda sobretot per les pel·lícules A Town Like Alice (1956), Carve Her Name with Pride (1958), Nascuda lliure (1966) i Ring of Bright Water (1969), així com pel seu treball amb The Born Free Foundation . [2]

column1: On the stage, in 1979 she won the Olivier Award for Best Actress in a British musical for her performance opposite Yul Brynner in The King and I. Over the years she appeared in more films but was also very active with television roles and on stage where she continues to make occasional appearances.
column2: Als escenaris, el 1979 va guanyar el premi Launrce Olivier a la millor actriu en un musical britànic per la seva actuació al costat de Yul Brynner a The King and I. Al llarg dels anys va aparèixer en més pel·lícules, però també va ser molt activa amb papers televisius i fent aparicions ocasionals als escenaris.

column1: McKenna has also been responsible for helping create and furnish the Gavin Maxwell Museum[15] on Eilean Bàn, the last island home of Maxwell, an author and naturalist, most famous for his book Ring of Bright Water.
column2: McKenna també va ser responsable d'ajudar a crear i moblar el museu Gavin Maxwell [1] a Eilean Bàn, l'última llar de Maxwell, autor i naturalista, famosa pel seu llibre Ring of Bright Water .

column1: McKenna and husband Bill Travers starred in the 1969 film adaptation of the book.
column2: McKenna i el seu marit Bill Travers van protagonitzar l' adaptació cinematogràfica del llibre del 1969.

column1: McKenna is still actively involved at Born Free Foundation as a Trustee.[16]
column2: McKenna encara participa activament a Born Free Foundation com a administradora. [1]

column1: McKenna was made an Officer of the Order of the British Empire (OBE) in the 2004 New Year Honours for services to wildlife and to the arts. Her autobiography, The Life in My Years, was published by Oberon Books in March 2009.
column2: McKenna va ser nomenat Oficial de l'Ordre de l'Imperi Britànic (OBE) en el Cap d'Any de 2004 per serveis a la vida salvatge i a les arts. La seva autobiografia, The Life in My Years, va ser publicada per Oberon Books el març del 2009.

column1: In 1975 she released an album of twelve songs called Two Faces of Love, which included two of her own compositions and a sung version of the poem "The Life That I Have" from the film Carve Her Name with Pride.
column2: El 1975 va publicar un àlbum de dotze cançons anomenat Two Faces of Love, que incloïa dues composicions pròpies i una versió cantada del poema " The Life That I Have " de la pel·lícula Carve Her Name with Pride .

column1: The record was released on the Gold Star label with two line drawings of McKenna by her sister-in-law Linden Travers, but these were replaced by a photograph when the album was reissued on the Rim label in 1979.
column2: El disc es va publicar al segell Gold Star amb dos dibuixos lineals de McKenna per part de la seva cunyada Linden Travers, però van ser substituïts per una fotografia quan l'àlbum es va reeditar al segell Rim el 1979.

column1: Her audiobook work includes The Secret Garden by Frances Hodgson Burnett,[17] and narration of The Lonely Doll by Dare Wright.
column2: El seu treball d'audiollibre inclou The Secret Garden de Frances Hodgson Burnett, [1] i la narració de The Lonely Doll de Dare Wright .

column1: She is a patron of Cinnamon Trust - a national charity that helps elderly people to keep their pets.
column2: Es també directora de Cinnamon Trust, una organització benèfica nacional que ajuda les persones grans a mantenir les seves mascotes.

column1: McKenna and Travers had four children, one of whom is Will Travers.
column2: McKenna i Travers van tenir quatre fills, un dels quals és Will Travers .

column1: She is the grandmother of actress Lily Travers.
column2: És l'àvia de l'actriu Lily Travers .

column1: McKenna was born in Marylebone to a theatrical family and was educated at Heron's Ghyll School, a former independent boarding school near the market town of Horsham in Sussex.
column2: McKenna va néixer a Marylebone en una família teatral i es va formar a Heron's Ghyll School, un antic internat independent a prop del poble mercat de Horsham, a Sussex.

column1: She spent six years in South Africa before returning to the school at the age of fourteen, after which she attended the Central School of Speech and Drama, then based at the Royal Albert Hall, London.[3]
column2: Va passar sis anys a Sud-àfrica abans de tornar a l'escola als catorze anys, després dels quals va assistir a la Central School of Speech and Drama, que llavors tenia seu al Royal Albert Hall, Londres. [1]

column1: Aged 19, McKenna spent six months at Dundee Repertory Theatre.
column2: Amb 19 anys, McKenna va passar sis mesos al Dundee Repertory Theatre .

column1: She worked on stage in London's West End theatre, making her debut in Penny for a Song.
column2: Va treballar a l'escenari del West End de Londres i va debutar a Penny for a Song .

column1: She attracted attention on TV appearing in Winter's Tale with John Gielgud and Shout Aloud Salvation.[4][5]
column2: Cridà l'atenció a la televisió amb la seva aparició a Winter's Tale amb John Gielgud i Shout Aloud Salvation . [1] [2]

column1: McKenna's first film was The Second Mrs Tanqueray (1952), followed by a comedy, Father's Doing Fine (1952).
column2: La primera pel·lícula de McKenna va ser The Second Mrs Tanqueray (1952), seguida d'una comèdia, Father's Doing Fine (1952).

column1: She had a small role in the popular war film The Cruel Sea (1953) and a better part in the low budget comedy The Oracle (1953).
column2: Va tenir un petit paper a la popular pel·lícula de guerra The Cruel Sea (1953) i un millor paper a la comèdia de baix pressupost The Oracle (1953).

column1: She received excellent reviews for her stage performance in The River Line.[1]
column2: Va rebre excel·lents crítiques per la seva representació escènica a The River Line . [1]

column1: From 1954 to 1955 she was a member of the Old Vic theatre company, appearing in Henry IV and Richard II,[6] and was married for a few months in 1954 to actor Denholm Elliott, whom she met on the set of The Cruel Sea.
column2: Del 1954 al 1955 va formar part de la companyia de teatre Old Vic, apareixent a Enric IV i Ricard II, [1] i es va casar durant uns mesos el 1954 amb l'actor Denholm Elliott, a qui va conèixer al plató de The Cruel Sea. .

column1: Their marriage ended owing to his affairs with men.[7] In 1957, she married actor Bill Travers,[8] with whom she had four children and to whom she remained married until his death in 1994.
column2: El seu matrimoni va acabar a causa dels seves aventures amb homes. [2] El 1957 es va casar amb l'actor Bill Travers, [3] amb qui va tenir quatre fills i amb qui va romandre casada fins a la seva mort el 1994.

column1: McKenna returned to films with Simba (1955), a drama about the Mau Mau, playing Dirk Bogarde's love interest.
column2: McKenna va tornar al cinema amb Simba (1955), un drama sobre el Mau Mau, interpretant l'objecte de desig de Dirk Bogarde.

column1: Rank signed her to a long term contract[9] and director Brian Desmond Hurst said "She has a terrific future, properly handled.
column2: Rank la va signar amb un contracte a llarg termini [1] i el director Brian Desmond Hurst va dir que "té un futur fantàstic, que es maneja adequadament.

column1: She has all the qualities of a young Bergman and a young Katharine Hepburn.[10] McKenna was also in The Ship That Died of Shame (1955).
column2: Té totes les qualitats d'un jove Bergman i d'una jove Katharine Hepburn . [2] McKenna també va estar a The Ship that Died of Shame (1955).

column1: Love Affair(s) (French: Les Choses qu'on dit, les choses qu'on fait, lit. 'The things we say, the things we do') is a 2020 French drama film written and directed by Emmanuel Mouret.
column2: Les Choses qu'on dit, les choses qu'on fait (literalment, en francès: Les coses que es diuen, les coses que es fan) és una pel·lícula dramàtica francesa de 2020 escrita i dirigida per Emmanuel Mouret.

column1: The film stars Camelia Jordana, Niels Schneider, Vincent Macaigne and Julia Piaton.[2]
column2: Està protagonitzada per Camelia Jordana, Niels Schneider, Vincent Macaigne i Julia Piaton.[1]

column1: The film was released on September 16, 2020 in France.[1]
column2: La pel·lícula es va estrenar el 16 de setembre de 2020 a França.[1]

column1: The film received 13 nominations for the 46th César Awards, the most nominations of any eligible film.[3]
column2: La pel·lícula va rebre 13 nominacions en els 46s Premis César, el màxim de nominacions que pot tenir una pel·lícula.[1]

column1: Camelia Jordana as Daphné Niels Schneider as Maxime Vincent Macaigne as François Émilie Dequenne as Louise Jenna Thiam as Sandra Guillaume Gouix as Gaspard Julia Piaton as Victoire Louis-Do de Lencquesaing as The director
column2: Camelia Jordana com a Daphné Niels Schneider com a Maxime Vincent Macaigne com a François Émilie Dequenne com a Louise Jenna Thiam com a Sandra Guillaume Gouix com a Gaspard Julia Piaton com a Victoire Louis-Fer de Lencquesaing com a El director

column1: The film was released in France on September 16, 2020 in 294 theaters, with 11,144 admissions on its first day.[4]
column2: La pel·lícula va ser estrenada a França el 16 de setembre de 2020 en 294 cinemes, amb 11,144 visions en el seu primer dia.[1]

column1: The first weekend in theaters brings together 55,695 admissions.[5] After a week, the film has accumulated 77,092 admissions.
column2: El primer cap de setmana en sales va aplegar 55,695 espectadors.[1] Després d'una setmana, la pel·lícula havia acumulat 77,092 visionats.

column1: Despite 66 additional screens, the second weekend was marked by a 24.5% drop in admissions with 58,182 additional spectators.[6]
column2: Malgrat projectar-se en 66 sales més, el segon cap de setmana va estar marcat per una devallada d'un 24.5% en el nombre d'espectadors, uns 58,182.[2]

column1: In January 2021, 279,094 admissions were recorded.[7]
column2: Al gener de 2021, la van veure un total de 279,094 espectadors.[1]

column1: The Castello Maniace is a citadel and castle in Syracuse, Sicily, southern Italy.
column2: El Castello Maniace és una ciutadella i un castell de Siracusa, Sicília, al sud d' Itàlia .

column1: It is situated at the far point of the Ortygia island promontory, where it was constructed between 1232 and 1240 by the Emperor Frederick II.
column2: Es troba a l'extrem del promontori de l'illa Ortigia, on va ser construït entre 1232 i 1240 per l' emperador Frederic II .

column1: It bears the name of George Maniakes, the Byzantine general who besieged and took the city in 1038.
column2: Porta el nom de George Maniakes, el general bizantí que va assetjar i va prendre la ciutat el 1038.

column1: Originally, one could only enter the castle over a bridge spanning a moat (now filled).
column2: Originalment, només es podia entrar al castell per un pont que abastava un fossat (ara ple).

column1: A feature of the castle is the decorated portal.
column2: Una característica del castell és el portal decorat.

column1: Today the castle is open to public and is a local tourist attraction in Syracuse.
column2: Avui el castell és obert al públic i és una atracció turística local a Siracusa.[1]

column1: Alexander Knaak: Prolegomena zu einem Corpuswerk der Architektur Friedrichs II. von Hohenstaufen im Königreich Sizilien 1220–1250, Marburg 2001. .mw-parser-output
